None
text:
This carrot cake is super delicious! Follow the advice of the top review and you won't be disappointed! I also substituted 1/2 cup of the oil with applesauce, added an extra tsp vanilla, used 1 cup white and 1 cup brown sugars, and added a tsp (or more) of cinnamon along with a little nutmeg and touch of ginger. I did not add pineapple as that review suggested only because I don't care for pineapple. The frosting is perfect! You can adjust the sugar depending on your sweet tooth, but the measurements are just fine!
***Edit: 10/1/2015 - I have since made this multiple times adding the drained can of crushed pineapple, and it is even better! This is still my go to carrot cake recipe!

text:
This was such a great carrot cake recipe...I turned it into cupcakes! It made 30! The only thing I changed was I substituted 1/2 cup of the white sugar for light brown sugar. I also used a food processor for the carrots...much easier. For the icing I only used 3 cups of confectioners sugar...was perfect for my taste....I only had 1/2 teaspoon left of vanilla so I used pure almond extract..about 1/4 teaspoon and I didn't have any real butter so I used Smart Balance...this icing was SO delicious...This will be the only carrot cake recipe I ever use!!

text:
This was the first carrot cake I made. I used to buy cake mix in a box, never again! This was simple, delicious and a hit! My friends and hubby loved it, made it yesterday and both cakes are gone today. I read some other reviews and made only 2 changes. I used 1 1/2 cup of white sugar and 1/2 cup of brown sugar. Instead of adding 1 cup of chopped pecan in the frosting mix. I simply sprinkle on top of the frosting. I used 1/2 cup instead of 1. I'm not a big fan of nuts. It was great I could have done with less pecans but everyone else said it was perfect. Also I had a lot of extra cream cheese frosting left after I piled on both cakes. Next time I'll cut the frosting recipe in half. Will definitely make this again.

text:
Delicious!  Only things I did different were substitute 1/2 cup plain applesauce for 1/2 cup of the oil to cut down oiliness, and I didn't add any nuts to the icing.  I baked it in a 9 x 13 pan as directed, then, after cake had cooled, I cut it in half and made a smaller, rectangular layer cake. I would recommend refrigerating the cake until serving to firm up the icing a little and then refrigerate leftovers (if you have any!) to keep the icing firm and prevent the butter in the icing from going rancid..not that it'll last that long though!  This was an excellent cake!

text:
I halved this recipe and got 10 cupcakes out of it. I also added an extra tsp cinnamon, some nutmeg and used 1/2 canola 1/2 applesauce (unsweetened). It turned out fantastic! Baked at 350 for 25 mins and they came out so nice and moist. I heeded the advice of others and made sure not to overbeat, that is key as I had never baked carrot cake before and was afraid my cupcakes would fall. The frosting included is delicious as well. I served them up to a friend on Christmas night and after a full meal of jalapeno poppers, chicken, potatoes and green beans, he scooped up 2 one right after the other eagerly! Wonderful recipe.

text:
I have been cooking for over 40 years and tried many different carrot cake recipes.  Some were good, others not so much.  BUT - I have to admit - this one TAKES THE CAKE as the very best.  I made a few adjustments however, this cake is an absolute keeper recipe! Bar none, the VERY best I have found - and being from the 70's generation when it was the thing to make - I have had the time to experience many.  Very moist and great integration of flavors.  The adjustments I made are slight but I have listed them: 1 c. white and 1 cup drk brown sugar, extra pecans in cake.  I also added an extra 4 oz. cream cheese and reduced the powdered sugar to 3 c. for the icing.  I did not mix the pecans in but sprinkled them on top and they were only very roughly chopped.  I even left it in the 9 x 13 pan.  Leftovers didn't make it 2 days and that is only 3 people.  I know, rather like gluttony however, it was that good.  Even ate it for breakfast one morning and I am not a sweet eater!  Try this one!

This is my first time making carrot cake.  I made them into cupcakes, and it turned out really well!  If you do cupcakes, be sure to check on them at 20 minutes because mine were done around then.  I used most of the suggestions from other reviews (I increased the cinnamon, subbed some brown sugar for white, added nutmeg, subbed some applesauce for the oil, and used crushed pineapple), and it came out fantastic.  However, next time, I'm going to skip the pineapple, as I thought it was gross getting little bits of pineapple in my cake.

text:
My boyfriend's favorite cake is carrot cake - so I decided to try this recipe for this birthday. I made just a few changes and it came out great. Instead of 2 cups of sugar, I did 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar - it really added some great extra flavor. Also, instead of vegetable oil, I always use regular apple sauce. I do this for all of my cakes - its healthier and I think it comes out more moist. Also, I too added some pineapple. On a side note - the cream cheese frosting was WAY to sweet, so I had to go out and buy cream cheese frosting at the market, and it tasted just fine. I hope these suggestions help you! Yummy cake!!

I do have to admit that I made some changes to this recipe but I also have to say that it is ridiculously good and I'm sure it would be even without them!! I used 1 c applesauce + 1/4 c coconut oil instead of veg oil, added 1 tsp almond extract, added 1/2 tsp allspice and a dash of ginger and nutmeg, used whole wheat flour instead of white, raw sugar instead of white, and 3.5 c confectioner's sugar instead of 4 for the icing which was plenty sweet enough. Oh, and no nuts. It was delicious (better than restaurant quality) and I would absolutely make it again!!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/49705.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is my third time making this cake and my husband loves it. The worst part however is the shredding. Here are some hints on shredding that I had to learn the hard way. :) 1. Don't buy baby carrots...it will take forever and you are more likely to cut your fingers! P.S. 4 large carrots = 3 cups. 2. Try holding two large carrots at once while rubbing over your shredder. 3. If you have a heavy duty food processor you can cut the carrots into little chunks and then put it in the processor. Mine isn't quite strong enough to handle this! 4. If all else fails buy pre-shredded, but it might be a little dry. Happy shredding!

text:
OMIGOD! BEST CARROT CAKE EVER!!!! I was left speechless after tasting this cake I made. Couple things I did change per suggestions from other members: I used 1 CP white sugar and 1 CP brown sugar. I increased the vanilla to 1 TBSP (3 tsp). I increased the cinnamon to 1 TBSP (3 tsp). I added 1/2 tsp of nutmeg. I used 3/4 CP oil and 1/2 CP unsweetened applesauce. The cake was so beautifully moist and spiced! Just perfect. I baked the cake in 2 round cake pans and stacked them with icing in the middle and on top. I doubled the icing, though, to make sure I had enough. I used only 5 CP of powdered sugar instead of 8 and it was plenty sweet. I also tripled the vanilla and left out the pecans. So good! I would give this 10 stars if I could!

text:
I made this last night for my supervisor who wasn't at the office on Friday (Boss'Day).  I was very interested in all the reviews but I had to make it my own.  I took some of the ideas like the spices (always like more) and vanilla and I used the walnuts instead of the pecans.  But what my final version was adding only 3 cups of carrots, using 1/2 bag of coconut, 2 tbl of crushed pineapple and a hand full of raisins.  I also used less oil and added 1/2 buttermilk.  My supervisor and co-workers now rate this as #2 of the favorite cakes that I make for them (#1 is the Italian Cream Cake).  The middle did sink a little because I opened the door.  I will make this again and again.  Thanks for a Great Recipe, it's a keeper!!!!

text:
I made this with all of gneebeanie's suggestions.  It was truly fantastic.  I baked it in three 8 inch layers.  I stacked and frosted two, kept the other layer for unfrosted (fewer calories).  It was light, moist, tasty, and a real winner!

Hint to avoid "clumped" carrots:  I shredded the carrots using my food processor twice.  First, through the top with the grater attachment.  Second in the lower part with the swirling blade.  This way I got finely shredded carrot pieces.  I added them slowly to the batter while mixing.  Worked fine!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
My 3 rating is rating this cake as written.  The only thing I did differently was use 1C white and 1C brown sugar,  a cup of applesauce and 1/4 cup of oil (1 1/4 C oil is a lot of oil, so I was trying to cut down on fat) as well as some minor alterations to adjust for high altitude since I live about a mile high (raised temp 25 degrees, decreased sugar by 1 T, increased applesauce by 1T and decreased baking powder by 1/4 tsp).  I, also, made it in 2 9 inch pans (for about 25 minutes) and doubled the frosting to make a layered cake.  I tasted the batter after I'd made it as written and it was really bland.  So, I added a 1/2 tsp of nutmeg, another tsp of cinnamon and another tsp of vanilla.  With my changes, it was WONDERFUL!  I couldn't get my company to stop eating it.  I will definitely make this again!

text:
the carrot cake was wonderful...HOWEVER, using my better judgement, i only used 1/2 the sugar called for in the frosting and thought it was still was way too sweet (and i have a big time sweet tooth!) i added more cream cheese to equal out the sweetness until i ran out of cream cheese and had to settle for what i had, which i still thought was too sweet.  I shared the finished product with our softball team for my bf's birthday and people were actually throwing away 1/2 eaten pieces stating it was too sweet!  my recommendation? only add a little sugar at a time to get it to how YOU like it.  you can always add more, but you cant take it out!

None
text:
Cake turned out really well.  I read the reviews and adjusted like recommended 1) 3/4 cup oil + 1/2 cup apple sauce 2) 1 cup white and 1 cup brown sugar 3) 3 tsp cinnamon 4) 3 tsp vanilla 5) 1 cup crushed pinapple drained of fluids 6) 1/4 tsp nutmeg.   I made 2 x 9" cake pans of cake, I cooled it on rack and then cut it in half, then used the icing mixture in the middle and on top to make it a double layered carrot cake.  Oh, I also only used 2 cups of sifted icing for the frosting..I made it with 4 before and it was WAY too sweet.

This recipe AS IS deserves 5 stars!!! Really simple and very delicious. I have also made various modifications (because I just always do) like adding nutmeg, some cloves, raisins and grated apple. I have also tried substituting 1/2 c. applesauce for oil and still the cake is great. I also cut the powdered sugar back by 1/2 c. the second time around. My advice is to remember to preheat your oven for at least 20 minutes to ensure even and thorough baking. Great recipe!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674141.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the BEST carrot cake I have ever made. My husband doesn't like carrot cake and he LOVED this! Thank you Tammy! Followed advise of others. Decreased oil amount to  3/4 cup and added 1/2 cup applesauce. Used 1 cup white and 1 cup brown sugar. Added 3/4 cup golden raisins. Decreased 10X sugar to 2 cups and still had leftover frosting. Used parchment paper on bottom of 13X9 pan -- a must to remove cake without breaking. Used glass pan so I lowered oven temp to 325* and baked about 45 minutes. After cooling cake for 10 minutes, put cooling rack on top of cake and turned cake out onto rack. Cool. Turn over again onto hard surface to frost and cut into pieces. Use spatula to lift pieces onto serving plate. You can then throw away parchment paper. No mess.

This is by far the best carrot cake I've ever tasted.I read the reviews and made some changes and wow, fantastic. I added 1 8oz can of drained crushed pineapple & 1 cup of oil & added the drained pineapple juice. 2 cups of carrots with 3/4 cup of raisins.For the sugar 1 cup  white & 1 cup of light brown sugar.Also 1/2tsp nutmeg & 1/8tsp ground cloves. The frosting I used 2 1/2 cups of confectioners suger & 3tsp vanilla & 3/4 cup chopped pecans, let frosting stay a room temp.,this will make it easy to spread once cake is cool.Everything else stayed the same.Had to cook just alittle longer. This is a keeper.

text:
Unbelievable!  I made a few changes myself based on previous reviews and have made this cake 3 times  now to rave reviews!!!   For oil, use 3/4 c. and add 1/2 c applesauce, instead of all white sugar, use 1c. white and 1c. brown sugar, use 3 t. vanilla, 3 t. cinnamon, add 1/4 t. nutmeg and 8 oz can of pineapple.  Fo9r the frsting, I use 3 c. conf. sugar instead of 4, and if making this a layer cake, double the frsoting recipe so that there is lots since that is the way we like it!  Can't go wrong with this recipe.

SUPERB!!!  Only few alterations to the original recipe : Split the sugar to 1 cup brown and 1 cup white and add 1/2 tsp of nutmeg.  That's all.  My kids did NOT like the chopped nuts, so I made it again but this time I powdered the walnuts in my little chopper and told them that there were NO NUTS.  All the flavor but no nutty pieces!!!  I made a wonderful decoration but of course did not take a pic...will do next time and post.  Thanks!  Only one more note: for those who find the icing too sweet, no worries, just add 2 TBSP of lemon juice to original recipe and VOILA!  Try it it's amazing.

I tried to convert this into a little healthier version.  Only used 1 c sugar.  Instead of 2 c all purpose flour, I used 1 1/2 whole wheat and 1/2 all purpose.  I added 1/3 c wheat germ.  I grated a cup of apples and poured apple juice almost to the top level of the apples.  I used walnuts instead of pecans just because that is what is in my pantry.  I only made half as much of the frosting.  I still covered the whole cake adequately. I bet the original is more delicious with all those extras, but it was still good with the changes I madee and I will definitely make it again.

text:
This cake is amazing.  I made it because I have a ton of carrots to use up, even though I've never really cared for carrot cake before.  I made a few changes, I used some applesauce in place of some of the oil as other reviewers suggested, and I used 1 c of brown sugar in place of 1 c of regular sugar.  Made the frosting without the nuts, but kept the nuts in the cake.  Eating this fresh after cooling that same day, it was only ok.  But eating it from the fridge the next day?  Insanely heavenly.  I've never had a cake taste so much better the 2nd day.  Even my young daughters loved it, they want me to make it as their birthday cake...over chocolate!!  I can't wait to have an excuse to make this cake again.

I didn't change this recipe too much except for the following: (1) Used half all-purpose and half whole-wheat flour; (2) Used only 1-1/2 cups sugar; (3) Used 3-1/2 cups grated carrots; (4) Used walnuts in place of pecans in the cake but not in the frosting; (5) Added allspice, ground nutmeg and clove as suggested by other reviewers; (6) Frosted with coconut extract-flavored buttercream frosting instead. The cake still turned out to be slightly sweet for me; I guess I'll reduce sugar to 1-1/3 cups next time. Other than that, it was a very moist spiced carrot cake! (If you add more spices as suggested by others.) Definitely a keeper!

This is a wonderful carrot cake recipe!! Changes: Added a dash of allspice and nutmeg, and a few drops of coconut extract. Used 3/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup applesauce. Reduced sugar to 1 1/3 cups. text:
I followed gneebeanie's recommendations and added a pinch of ginger, and the cake came out perfect. Incredibly moist, but still sturdy. And with wonderful flavor and textures (the carrot, nuts, pineapple, etc). I also prefer a less-sweet frosting, so I only use 2 cups of sugar when I make cream cheese frosting. By far the best recipe i've found. My husband's aunt called me after we left his family's Easter celebration just to tell me it was the best carrot cake she'd ever had. My husband was in shock because she's not one to compliment anyone. :)

text:
This was my first attempt at homemade carrot cake, and I was so pleasantly suprised. This cake was so moist and delicious. After reading all the reviews I decided to make some of the suggested changes, however I feel that without them the recipe would still be awesome as the changes don't alter it much. First I decided to replace 1/2c of the oil with applesauce. I used 1c brown & 1c white sugar. Also I added 8oz crushed pineapple. With the frosting I cut the sugar to 2cups. It's a really delicious frosting recipe, but unless you like your frosting really really really sweet, 4cups is just too much. But all in all this is a fantastic recipe and will now be my go-to recipe for carrot cake, thanks!

text:
I made this with a few of the modifications listed.  I added half brown sugar and half white sugar, added a dash of nutmeg and since I was eating an orange at the time, I added some orange zest to the batter.  I did not use the frosting directions since I had some white frosting already in the fridge so I added some orange zest, cream cheese, milk, and powdered sugar to it.  This cake was very dense but so good and the next day after the frosting sat on it, it became much more moist.  I would definitely make this again.

text:
This recipe is phenominal.  My husband who is a die hard carrot cake lover, said this is the best carrot cake he has ever had.
I also followed some of the substitutions, 1 cup brown, 1 cup white, added 1 8-oz can crushed pineapple, drained, used 3/4 cup canola oil, 1/2 cup applesauce, added 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg, added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon, an extra teaspoon of vanilla.  I also cut the confectioner's sugar to 3.5 cups.  
This comes out moist and so tasty, and the frosting is amazing.

text:
This cake turned out perfect.  I made the suggestions (half brown suger and white sugar, added nutmeg and a little more vanilla and cinnamon) but I did not add applesauce and it still turned out wonderfully.  I made 2 for a larger birthday that fell close to Easter and tried a 9x13 cake pan and 2 9" round cake pans for a layered cake.  The 9" rounds turned out MUCH better.  The 9x13 seemed flat and the frosting overpowered the cake.  I will definitely continue to make it layered in the future.

text:
So moist, so yummy...oh so good. I've made this quite a few times now. I prepared in 2 8in cake pans. I didn't line with parchment, but I use Bakers Joy spray that has flour in it, and it came out beautifully. I omitted the pecans and opted to chop walnuts and encrusted the side of the iced cake with walnuts instead. On occassion I also add premium raisins (Trader Joes are nice and plump), I didn't want raisins that were too dry to remove the moisture from the cake.

Holy cow! This cake was delicious! I'd never made a carrot cake before but I wanted to surprise my girlfriend with a cake when she returned from a business trip. She LOVES carrot cake. text:
The basic cake recipe is pretty good.  I did change up some of the items though:
-Used 1/4 applesauce and cut back 1/4 on the oil.
-Can of crushed pineapple.
-Frosting:  Used 2 pkgs of 8oz Cream Cheese and 3 cups of powdered sugar.  This made the perfect amount for a circular layered cake.  It wasn't too sweet, just perfect.  I also didn't put the pecans in the frosting, I just put the chopped pecans on the sides of the cake and inside the batter.


I  made this for a poker party and it was a hit.

This was an awesome recipe! I added 2 cups of carrots and 1 cup strained crushed pinapple that I dried moderatly with paper towels. I also added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon and a pinch of nutmeg, and I used walnuts since the grocery store was out of pecans. It came out wonderfully. I did have to bake it an extra 10 minutes to make sure the middle was cooked all the way through, but it is moist and firm. I also added just a pinch of lemon zest to the icing to give it a little zing. Wonderful cake, my husband loves it!

I am only giving this 4 stars, but only because, I along with everyone did not follow the recipe, By other reviews, I also used 1c white sugar and 1c Brown, I added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon, and An extra teaspoon of vanilla, I did 3/4cup oil, and 1/2 cup applesauce, Originally I used all the oil, And I also had bigger grates of Carrots and my cake Caved in the center, I made it again with the applesauce and made my grated carrots smaller, and it did not cave, who knows though maybe someone ran in the kitchen to much, and thats why it caved. city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I also used the substitutions, 1/2 c applesauce and 3/4 c canola oil, 1 c. brown sugar and 1 c. white, and next time I will use 4 1/2 c of carrots and possibly more brown sugar and less white, I also added nutmeg, more vanilla and cinnamon, and used walnuts instead of pecans. I tried three variations, no nuts, chopped nuts, and powdered nuts (ground fine for taste without chunks).  Then I made them into cupcakes and frosted them and filled them using the Orange Cream Cheese Frosting recipe (without the nuts and use 1 1/2 tea zest instead of 2 unless you want a more orange zest flavor- it's still delicious, just takes away from the rest) and a pastry bag.  I poked a hole in the centers with a toothpick and "swirled" it inside to make room for the frosting to spread, while they were still warm.  I filled them, then put them in the fridge to cool, then took them out and frosted the tops.  They turned out wonderfully.  I'd have to say my favorite were the powdered nut ones, but I will double the amount next time (2 c. instead of 1).

text:
This cake was fantastic!  I made a few minor modifications based on other reviews.  I used 1 cup of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar.  I also used 3/4 cup of oil and 1/2 cup of apple sauce.  The end result was the best carrot cake I've ever had.  So moist and delicious!

I used the "Cream Cheese Frosting II" recipe found on this site for the icing because I like a more "cream cheese" frosting and this one seemed too sweet.  I'd highly recommend trying it - it complemented the cake perfectly!

I just made this tonight for the first time, and it was so good that I had to hop right on and review it. Easy recipe, easy to make--although next time I plan on buying shredded carrots, as I am never grating them again!

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
This was my first time baking a carrot cake, and it turned out great.  Although I'm not a big carrot cake connoisseur, my mother, who has eaten many-a-carrot-cake, said that it tasted gourmet and immediately asked for the recipe.  The procedure was simple, the ingredients basic, the taste sublime.  

Following almost all of gneebeanie's modifications, I was very pleased with the results.  I didn't add pineapple because I wanted a more traditional carrot cake, I didn't add pecans to the cake batter because I don't like crunchy things in my cake, and I didn't have nutmeg, so I added a bit of ground ginger (approx. 1/2 - 1 tsp) instead.  Instead of mixing the pecans in with the icing, I chopped them up and sprinkled/pressed them into the icing around the top of the cake.  It did look very gourmet, if I do say so myself, and it tasted grrrrrrrrrrrrreat!

text:
The cake was absolutely moist and lightly fluffed. I used 3/4cup white sugar and 3/4 cup brown. It was still a little sweet for my liking though. And used 3 large eggs instead of 4, increased the cinnamon by 1 tsp, used 1 cup of canola oil and a cup of walnuts. U definitely have to squeeze the carrots and pineapple then add 2 tbs juice of each or u'll end up with a pudding-like super dense cake. I made 29 cupcakes and baked it for 20 mins at mid level. Make sure to fill the cupcakes slightly less than 3/4 full as it rises quite a bit. Thanks for this wonderful recipe!

text:
I have to agree with another reviewer in that 2 cups of sugar is a better option.  As much as I *love* the frosting part of any cake, it was still too much.  My cake too sunk in the middle and although the toothpick came out clean, it was still too oily in the middle.  I did bake it on the convection setting for 35 minutes in the 9x13 pan.  **Updated 23MAR08: I just had to try this again with the "most helpful" poster.  What a difference!  It was cooked perfectly, again on convection bake at 325 degrees for 35 minutes.  I think the big difference was using 1/2 c applesauce and 3/4 c oil.  I'm glad I tried it again so I could up that star rating to a 5.

WOW, this was so good!! I made this for Easter dinner and everyone loved it. So moist. text:
I am a completely new baker/cook (a student too), and this came out *fantastic*. 
The only difference I did is lessen the icing to 1/4 cup butter, and 1 cup sugar, and didn't add pecans to the icing, as I felt the creaminess is enough (and enough pecans would be in the cake).

The cake was half eaten right away by roomates, and the next morning, with the icing chilled it was even better! 

One more thing I saw being done and wish I could do, is add raw pumpking seeds on top of the icing. I couldn't find any, but it tastes excellent.

text:
We've made this about 10 times now and it always gets compliments and requests for the recipe. We've made the frosting and tinted and used it to decorate. Works great in a decorating bag, too. I've used a finely chopped apple as a substitute for some of the oil and added more cinnamon, and about 1/4 tsp each nutmeg, allspice, and clove. Tastes better if you make the night before and then refrigerate. We used a 9 x 13 pyrex pan and it overflowed so now use 2 9" rounds or 3 8" squares.

756182
Display Name:
Me

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/109.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe makes an excellent carrot cake.  I was extremely pleased with the results.  I did, however, make a few changes.  I reduced the sugar to 1 1/2 cups,used only 1 cup of oil, added 1 cup finely chopped apple, increased salt to 1 tsp and increased the cinnamon to 2 tbsp for kick.  I then baked it in 2 9 inch cake pans.  I didnt use the icing called for in the recipe, I used mine--2 8 oz pkgs cream cheese, 1/2 cup butter, 1 tsp vanilla and 3 cups icing sugar.  I then split the layers and filled and frosted them.  I was truly impressed and so were my guests who raved about it. I also found this cake is best made a day ahead and left in the refrigerator, as with most desserts--Its makes a difference in how the cake will taste.  Thanks for a keeper, Tammy.

text:
After making this cake just once, I have been asked to make it again for every party or event I go to.  It IS that good!  I didn't use a 9x13 pan, instead I used 2 round 8 inch pans.  I will be making this again very soon and the only difference I may make is with the frosting.  The first time I just added the ingredients.  This time I may add the sugar a little at a time to taste.  Also, I am one of those people who like a smooth carrot cake.  If you prefer a smooth texture, grate the carrots by hand.  This will give it a consistancy just above puree.

text:
I absolutely LOVE this recipe! I have probably made this cake 20+ times (without changing anything) and it is always a hit. I have adults and kids always asking me to make it for birthdays or other occasions. Sometimes I leave out the pecans in the frosting, depends on who the cake is for...it is delicious either way. I have also made it a couple times for my niece, who is allergic to eggs...when making it for her, I use flaxseed instead (1 tablespoon flaxseed and 3 tablespoons of water for each egg replaced). It turns out great with the flax as well!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/867475.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
After reading all the reviews and confusion "change this, add that, omit this, etc. " I decided it looked good on its own and I made it as written. This cake was wonderful as written. The only thing I left out was the nuts, otherwise, no changes. The cake is moist and delicious. Probably the best carrot cake we have had. Anywhere. I was a bit skeptical of the baking soda amount and the reviews stating their cake tasted like baking soda?! But there must be some mistake. There was no baking soda taste, just moist, flavorful carrot cake taste! I also had no collapsing of the middle as some described. You don't need pineapple to "balance" the baking soda, that is silly. There are many cakes made without an acid. I made this cake specifically because it had no pineapple in it. Why add it? It doesn't need it. I could go on after reading pages of reviews that changed this unnecessarily. Don't change a thing! Now for the frosting - wonderful. I would start with 3 1/2 cups of powdered sugar and taste it. If you want it sweeter add the last 1/2 cup. This will be my go to cream cheese frosting from now on.

text:
This is by far the best carrot cake I've ever had or made. The batter rose about 2.5 times and the cake was moist and delicious. I didn't think it needed any modifications - it was good as it is. Some things are good because they are not overcomplicated with 50 different ingredients.  The frosting was creamy and tasted good. I followed advice from several comments and only used 3 cups of powdered sugar as i personally do not like it too sweet and it was plenty sweet and thick enough to hold it's "fluff".  I didn't have any pecans so I made it without them since the recipe said it was OK either way and it was still amazing. I'll definitely save this as my go to carrot cake recipe.

text:
I suck at making cakes and this came out brilliantly. Followed reviewers recommendation of 1 c brown sugar and 1 c white sugar, +1 tsp of vanilla extract, + 1/4 tsp nutmeg, and +1 tsp of cinnamon. My fiance complained that he couldn't taste the nutmeg, but as it's not even in the recipe, I have no complaints about it. Used 2 cups of walnuts as opposed to pecans. Split the batter between two 9 inch cake pans and baked at 350 for 35 minutes. Thanks for the great recipe and the great reviewer recommendations.

text:
With this recipe and made 2 delicious cakes  that came out better than i could have hoped! Instead of layering them, i made 2 separate cakes and there was more than enough frosting for both! This was the first carrot cake I've ever made, so i was very proud. Some changes i made to the recipe:

- i juiced carrots in the juicer and used the carrot pulp for the cake, much easier than grating carrots,and tastes just as good! 

- i added 1/2 cup of apple sauce

- i used 1/2 cup less sugar for cake 

The result was a moist, addicting cake that everyone loved!! I will be using this recipe again for sure.

Ah-MAY-zing!   This is the first cake I have successfully made from scratch!  I, like many people, read lots of reviews, and I did make a few tiny adjustments (more vanilla, more cinnamon, a hint of nutmeg, and half brown sugar), but I made no major changes to the recipe.  I even used the amount of oil called for....and it was perfect. Moist, spicy, flavorful, and the frosting was fabulous!  I used the exact amounts called for and whipped the fool out of it in the stand mixer. I have avoided cake making for a long time, because I had never been able to make a good one from scratch....that is, until today.  Thank you so much for the recipe and the confidence.  :-)

text:
I chose this recipe because it was as close to the one that I have been making for over 30 year. I lost all my recipes in when I moved from Georgia to Florida:-) I did make a few adjustment mainly to make it healthier! Lol 
I used whole wheat flour, used coconut oil and replaced a 1 tbs of the oil with 3 tbs of ground flax seeds. It didn't change the taste at all and almost all of the cake was eat at the dinner party I took it to.
Next Time I make it I think I'm going to reduce the sugar to 1 1/2 cups because it is so sweet. The cream chease icing I've been making it for so long. If you let your butter and cream cheese soften or microwave for about a minute it is much easer to mix. I sift and beat the whole box of C. Sugar into the mixture then add vanilla last. I also sift the flour in the cake mixture after I measure it first. This is an awesome cake as is:-) my family demolished it in one night!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've made this recipe several times because once someone tries it, they want me to make it again. No substitutions are needed. I have tried it with 1 c white and 1 cup brown sugar and it's great that way too.  Adding fresh grated nutmeg gives it another great flavor boost.  I've packed in extra carrots and extra pecans and last time I ran out of vegetable oil and used about 1/3 c canola to supplement. Still great!  It is a lot of oil, but not too much and the oil crisps up the edges of the cake.  The only thing I do differently is the frosting.  It falls in the center when you move it before it's done!  Let it cook! If it does fall, give the center to the frosting lovers. I don't like cream cheese frosting at all, so I use the recipe with a package of vanilla pudding whisked into 1 cup of milk, with an 8 oz tub of cool whip and a tsp 1 tsp of vanilla mixed in at the end.  That's my preference though and in no reflects the yumminess of the cake!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I've tried this recipe at least four times. Although it has turned out yummy and moist each time, I've still had to deal with the sinking in the center. This past week, when I made it for my birthday, I made a few changes that have resulted in an equally yummy cake without the sinking center. I replaced the 1-1/4 cups canola oil with 1 cup of grape seed oil (more healthy) and 1/2 cup of apple sauce. I also added 1/2 cup of finely chopped fresh pineapple. In terms of the grated carrot, I used a cheese grater on the largest setting. After grating the carrots, I then mince them further with a large knife. This really minimized the wetness of the grated carrots. The overall texture of the cake was a lot lighter than before. I'm very happy with the outcome.

text:
I made this carrot cake for my husband's birthday a few days ago. My first cake from scratch. Everyone at the party loved it and I have to say so did I! I made two 9'' rounds. The only change I would make next time is double the frosting. It got pretty thin as I was icing the outside. I like this recipe as is...they only things I did differently were: I squeezed excess water out of grated carrots in cheese cloth to prevent too much moisture in cake. I did 1/2 brown sugar and 1/2 white. I subbed raisins for the nuts in the cake and re-hydrated them in some warm water before adding. The frosting was sweet enough for me after 3 1/2 cups of sugar. Delicious and will definitely make again! Crowd pleaser!!

text:
This is possibly the best carrot cake recipe I have found to date. Moist and delicious, and the icing is great too. I tried Sam's carrot cake recipe and it was good but this had more "wow!"  to it despite fewer ingredients.  I did a few changes recommended by others: 3/4 c oil and 1/2 c applesauce, 1 cup each white and brown sugar, and 1 extra tsp cinnamon and a dash of cloves, nutmeg and cardamom ( which I love in anything with cinnamon in it also). I also had to use 1 c wholewheat flour because I ran out of all purpose, and it had great texture. I will use this as my go-to recipe from now on!

I baked the cake as it was written. I liked it well enough, but it was almost too moist. It ended up kind of mushy textured for lack of a better way to describe it. It also didn't seem to have much carrot flavor, but it was a good spice cake. The frosting was also ok, not great but ok. As written it was a very thin/runny frosting and didn't really work for what I wanted. Worth trying if you like super moist spice cake with a hint of carrot. -1 star for not really being much of a carrot cake, and -1 star for it being a little too moist and the runny frosting.

None
text:
This recipe is wonderful. Went through the reviews and the general consensus was to reduce the oil, substitute some of the white sugar for brown and extra the cinnamon and vanilla. I also added 1/4 tsp of nutmeg. So, I reduced the oil by 1/4 cup, did 1 cup of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar, added one extra tsp of cinnamon and vanilla, substituted walnuts for the pecans and it turned out great! Also for the icing I reduced the confectioners sugar to 3 cups instead of 4. The results were outstanding. I wasn't sure about the 3 cups of carrots, so I just added one pound. Next time I may just try 2 cups of confectioners sugar for icing. Happy baking!

city:

country:
None
text:
I love this recipe, but I did not follow the recipe as written, because I do not use vegetable oil. I substituted 1 cup butter, and added 1/4-1/2 cup applesauce and decreased the sugar in the cake by 1/2 cup. I also added a sprinkling of allspice. It was fantastic! for the frosting, 4 cups of sugar waaaaay too much, so I decreased it by  half and doubled the other ingredients. It was perfect!

*Update* Many experience carrots turning green in carrot cake. I have experienced this as well, and as disconcerting as it was, I read many "options" to avoid this, but happily stumbled on the solution quite by accident...pineapple! I was missing applesauce one day, and in a pinch I pureed some pineapple in juice, added that, and for a while couldn't figure out why the carrots no longer turned green, until I realized that that was the only thing I changed and was the solution!

text:
I can't figure it out. To be fair this is my first carrot cake. I don't like the thought of carrots in my cake because I have a child's mentality when it comes to food. I cooked it twice...both times it was ugly as home made sin. I tried cupcakes instead of a cake. I would have thought it would be the same but My cupcake tops were not fluffed up, they puddled out. Then I threw all the batter in a loaf pan and figured it would be a shallow loaf...the middle was icky. My husband liked the flavor of the cake so he gets to gorge himself on unfrosted carrot puddle-cake since I didn't want anyone to see my shamefully ugly baked goods. 

I hate to do it but I am going to get a boxed mix carrot cake to bake so I can maybe have an idea of what it is supposed to be like. If the cake mix does a simular thing then I will know that carrot cake is supposed to be flat and ugly I guess.

text:
Okay, I made this cake twice, I rated it on the actual recipe.  Here is what I think of the actual recipe: The cake is bland, there is WAY too much icing!!  Even my kids couldnt take it!  I read other reviews and tried it with these changes: I added 1 tsp nutmeg, 1 extra tsp cinnamon, 1 extra tsp vanilla, 3/4cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce.  The cake was moist and perfect!  Then for the frosting, I just made half the recipe, it was perfect!  That is a 5 star cake!

city:

country:
None
text:
I loved the cake but make a few modifications as follows: 1/4 cup applesauce and 3/4 cup oil (canola and coconut mixed). I left out the raisins, I used 2 packed cups of finely grated carrots (3 large carrots). Decreased sugar to 3/4 cup brown sugar and 3/4 cup white sugar. Increased spices to 1 tablespoon vanilla, Didn't have nutmeg so used 1 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice instead. I cooked it in a bundt pan in my toaster oven at 325 for 50 minutes. 

Cake was lovely but think that I will increase the amount of pumpkin pie spice (or just use nutmeg) next time and add in the raisins.

For the icing: 
I thought 4 cups sugar was too much so I only added 1 cup and thought it was sweet enough. I did think it was rather buttery and will decrease the butter to 1/4 cup next time.

This recipe gets an A from me. I love baking and this was my very first carrot cake from scratch. It was moist, sweet and very easy to make. I made it exactly as written. However, I didn't have any pecans on hand so I used walnuts. I also used the frosting recipe without the nuts and it turned out good. I used 2 9' round pans and baked for 35 mins. With that being said, goodbye box cake! This is now my go to carrot cake.

text:
I took this to a potluck, and everyone loved it. I read a few of the many reviews and added my own touch. I used 1 cup of brown sugar in place of the white. I added a 1/2 teaspoon of nutmeg. I used the 8 oz package of matchstick carrots, which was a real time saver. I put them in a bowl and microwaved them for a few minutes, so they were still a little crisp. For the frosting, i used the cream cheeese/greek yogurt combo as it has less fat. The result was a good, but not overly sweet frosting. I will make this cake again!

text:
I made cupcakes rather than a cake, and the original recipe yielded about thirty cupcakes. I included some changes I had seen in the reviews, including an extra teaspoon of cinnamon, a tiny bit of nutmeg, a 1/2 cup applesauce with 3/4 cup oil, one cup brown sugar and one cup white, and an extra teaspoon of vanilla. I used walnuts instead of pecans and baked the cupcakes for 22 to 25 minutes. The results were truly spectacular. I took them to work and my colleagues raved that these were my best cupcakes yet! Thank you!

text:
This is an old and excellent recipe. For anyone that didn't like it may I suggest that you bake just a bit longer and allow it to cool in the oven to prevent the middle sinking. I used to  make and serve this in my own cafe and customers told me it was the best ever carrot cake. Many needed their fix of it every other day. It is easy to make and has a lovely flavour. I used walnuts as I find they have more flavour than pecans. Also I would line the pan with parchment paper allowing me to lift the cake easily for even cutting and icing.

text:
This was the best carrot cake I have ever had. Period. I followed all of Gneebeanie's advise, I think the brown sugar added a nice darkness, although I did use all vegetable oil. I also wanted to throw in some coconut, so I left a tiny bit of carrot out so I didn't over load it, if that's even possible. It was moist and delicious and full of texture, which is what I LOVE about carrot cake. I could spend a lot of time browsing the internet for a carrot cake that calls for everything I want in it (pecans, crushed pineapple & coconut), but I just found that this recipe makes a wonderful base carrot cake recipe, with which you really can make it exactly to your own tastes. Just the best.

THIS IS THE BEST CARROT CAKE EVER!

I used walnuts instead of pecans.. chopped them up nicely and topped the cream cheese with walnuts for every small square I cut. 

My family loves this and I am doing this again for my churchs' fun fair!

Only difference is that I used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar. Added 2 more tsps of cinnamon for a spicy cake! 

Don't hesitate to try it and if the top is getting burnt before it's done, cover with aluminium foil and you will be fine!

This is how my mom makes Carrot Cake.  I made this into 24 individual cakes for a friend's birthday.  They were enjoyed at "Girls Night Out" in August.  The texture is moist and heavy.  The frosting is sweet and delicious.  I did add the pecans to the cake portion, but not the frosting.  I liked the presentation of these made into individual cakes, but this would also be yummy as a 2-layer cake or a 13 x 9 cake.  Can't go wrong with Carrot Cake in my book.  It is my birthday cake of choice, every August!

I made some of the suggested changes and some of my own. I used Olive Oil instead so that there was no hydrogenated oils in it (used the full 1 1/4 cups of Olive Oil) and added 1/2 cup of Apple Sauce. I also added a additional tsp of vanilla (for 3 tsp in the cake), added the additional tsp of cinnamon (for 3 tsp of cinnamon in the cake) and left out the nuts. Everything else I followed to direction. I made it for our national night out and everyone was raving about it. I was hoping to have some left over to bring home, but everyone at it all.

Delicious and moist! I had a bunch of cupcake liners lying around, so I made carrot cupcakes. I filled the cups about 1/2 to 3/4 full and baked for 20 min. I ended up not making the frosting because the cake itself was sweet enough for me & my family. Also, the first time I made them, the cupcake liners were pretty soaked in oil, so I cut down to 1 cup veg oil for my second try. Still came out moist, but less greasy!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This carrot cake was a BIG hit at my party, it was all gone before the end of the party!! I followed instructions with a few minor simple changes after reading different reviews. I strained the grated carrot as much as I could by hang to reduce adding any extra added carrot juice to make cake extra moist. I also did 1 1/2cup white sugar, and 1/2 cup brown sugar. I added 1/2 cup walnuts (instead of pecans) 1 cup raisins, and 3/4 cup of canned chunk pineapple (without juice). I let it cool outside of refrigerator over night but covered it to stay fresh. I chilled the frosting overnight to make a creamier texture and frosted cake in morning. Cake was perfectly moist when we ate and it was delicious. ALso, modified frosting to 3cups powd.sugar instead of 4. I only had to bake 45mins and it was perfect time. My oven is pretty standard.

Display Name:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/3054975.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Best carrot cake ever!
It's the first time I've made carrot cake from scratch and I was surprised how easy it was. I especially liked the frosting, and the pecans were a great touch; I'm not a raisin fan, and the added texture was great.
For a shortcut I purchased pre-shredded carrots by the bag which I then chopped into smaller pieces to avoid those long stringy pieces you sometimes find in homemade carrot cakes. It was still a lot better than having to grate 3 cups by hand!
This cake is best served at room temperature; after you refrigerate it you'll want to give the frosting a chance to soften for the best experience.
I would highly recommend this recipe to anyone who wants to impress their company!

text:
This recipe was awesome & easy! Thank you for the recipe!! It's a huge hit!!! Below are some slight changes I made due to reading reviews and to my liking :o) 

Cake Mix:
Ommited Pecans
Used 1 Cup Brown Sugar, 1 Cup White Sugar
Used 3/4 Cup Oil, 1/2 Cup Apple Sauce

Baking Time: 
Approx. 40 mins ( I kept checking back) 
Its best not to shake the pan too much to check if its done because the MIDDLE will definitely sink in! 

Frosting: 
I used 2 and a Half cups of powdered sugar

text:
For lack of a better way of putting it, this cake is "just right." Just the right moisture, just the right carrot flavor, just the right amount of cinnamon flavor, just the right sweetness. Wouldn't change a thing. I made it as written, and we both loved it. That's saying a lot for my husband who isn't the biggest carrot cake fan. This recipe is also pretty forgiving if you don't have everything on hand. The second time I made it I was short half a cup of carrots, so I added just a bit of milk to make up for moisture content. Still turned out scrumptious.

Excellent cake! I used most of the modifications suggested by gneebeanie and baked two 9" rounds for 33 mins. The cake was dense but not overly sweet. It took a double batch of frosting to cover the cake when layered. I used only 2 cups of confectioners' sugar per batch - it lightly sweetened the frosting without making it overly sweet. I already have plans to make again.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Most carrot cake recipes include pineapple, which I can't have, so I'm glad I found this one. As many other reviewers, I also tweaked this recipe using 1 C. of white sugar and 1 C. of brown sugar. I also used walnuts because I had some in my freezer. I used 2 9-inch round pans and baked at 350 for 30 mins. then rotated the pans (because I did notice the middle sinking a bit) for an additional 10 mins. The cake is pretty dense but has a great flavor...tastes like carrot cake lol! Overall, I'm happy :) Thanks for sharing the recipe!!

text:
The only thing I do differently is reduce the oil to 1c.  You don't need to add anything to substitute either!
Optional: Substitute 2/3c caster sugar with 2/3c packed brown for a deeper flavour. 
Optional to add a tin of chopped pineapple or some poppy/pumpkin seeds or orange zest.
SO Yummmmy!

PS if you're out of cream cheese, just take a cup of icing sugar and add a few drops of lemon/lime juice (& zest) to make a paste. Not the same but compliments this cake.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/908620.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this cake according to the directions the first time then made it again with a few adjustments.  I would have liked to have given it 5 stars on its own merit; however, it got better reviews after the adjustments.  I followed what a few others did and used 1/2 cup applesauce and 1/2 cup canola oil.  I also added an extra tsp. each of vanilla and cinnamon and 1/4 tsp. nutmeg.  I omitted the nuts since nobody in my family wanted them.  I wound up having to use 2 packages of cream cheese in the frosting because it was too runny but after adding the extra cream cheese it came out perfect.

All and all with the few minor changes it was a very moist, flavorful cake.  I even made cupcakes and they were wonderful.  I'll be making this again for sure.

2 1/2 stars would be more accurate of our opinion of this cake.  Did not like this cake!  I followed the cake recipe with the exception of using 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup apple sauce, I made no other changes.  I thought the cake turned out dry and bland, tasted like a bland spice cake.  Edible but not good.  I also did not like the frosting.  I followed the frosting recipe exactly and I didn't like it.  It tasted too "cheesecake-y", which just wasn't right for this cake.  I took a lot of time and money to make this cake and it would have been much better and so much easier (and cheaper) if I would have just used a store bought boxed cake and frosting.  I expected it to be better considering all the 5 star ratings. We are big desert people here and no one wanted seconds of this cake. I won't make this again.

I used this recipe to make 18 large muffins.
I halved the oil and sugar, used brown sugar not white, 2 1/4 cups whole wheat flour, 2 tsps baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, omitted salt, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp pumpkin pie spice, 6 large carrots finely grated and omitted nuts.
Baked at 350 degrees for 30 minutes, excellent healthy muffin for my sons lunches and snacks.

text:
This carrot cake is extremely moist and delicious!

We used a food processor to shred the carrots instead of grate them, and it worked perfect.  We put it in the oven for 50 min at 350 and it was gorgeous.  A tad crunchy on the outside, perfectly cooked through and moist on the inside.

We only used 1 cup of oil and omitted the additional 1/4C- no need for it.  Instead of this icing, I made my own Espresso Crunch icing with instant coffee grinds, vanilla extract, cream cheese and butter.  Absolutely out of this world!!!!

Display Name:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Tried carrot cake for the first time using THIS recipe, and--oh my goodness--SO good! I did not have enough carrots, but I was craving carrot cake, so I did this: The recipe calls for 3 cups of grated carrots but I only had 1, so I added 1/2 cup of shredded unsweetened coconut and 1/2 cup of raisins, along with 1 cup of shredded APPLE.  I did make the few changes as many have suggested--Reducing oil to 3/4 cups and substituting the rest with 1/2 cup homemade chunky applesauce (with molasses), increasing cinnamon from 2 tsp to 4, and increasing vanilla from 2 tsp to 3. I also added a pinch of allspice. The cake was soft, moist but flaky at the same time, had a hint of spice and vanilla which wasn't too strong but just perfect, but still had that scrumptious carrot flavour with a touch of apple, and I also did not have enough cream cheese so I made a thick cream cheese glaze using the confectioner's sugar instead = yummy. It may be a little too sweet for some people, so I tried this recipe a second time and reduced sugar from 2 cups to 1 3/4 cups; the cake was not as dark but it was still very good. Overall, fantastic results and everyone loved it. Saying that this was one of the best recipes I have ever tried would be an understatement!

text:
I actually had to make this cake twice, since I forgot the carrots the first time and didn't realize it until the cake was in the oven. LOL. I am actually glad I made the mistake, though, because I liked it better without the carrots. (I left out the nuts. My husband hates them.)
 
It was almost perfect without the carrots. Unfortunately, when the carrots were added, the raisins where in too high of proportion. It could also do with more spice. Now I know the carrot flavor depends on the carrots you use, and mine were getting a little aged, but next time I make it, I may add some carrot puree to amp up the carrot flavor. I am pretty sure I will make it without carrots again, though. (I have not decided yet if I will add more spice to that one.)

Overall, pretty good cake. Really easy to make. Thank you Tammy.

text:
GREAT! I did as many other users suggested and did 1 cup of regular sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar.  I added the 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg as well.  I also chose to not follow the oil as many other did; I did 3/4 cup butter and 1/2 applesauce.  The cake was very moist and delicious!!  Only had to bake it 40 minutes.  The only thing I plan to do differently next time is either cut wayyy back on the pecans, or actually completely omit them.  Pecans give a strong flavor (stronger than many other nuts) and my family felt this was a flavor that wasn't bad, but took away from the flavor of the actual cake.

The frosting is delicious too!  Followed it exactly!  I didn't use the bar/block of cream cheese though, I just scooped it from the large tubs they sell at Costco.  Not sure if that makes a difference.  (Next time I will probably omit the nuts from it too though, for the same reasons as the cake).

text:
1 star.  I understand that carrot cake is made many many different ways and to ones liking.  To me a good carrot cake is a dark moist cake that is spicy almost like a pumpkin cake.  This is "ok" cake as far as cakes are concerned.  However to pawn this off as a 5 star carrot cake is crazy. When you bake it, your kitchen should smell like your cooking a carrot cake, not baking cookies. No cloves,nutmeg, allspice, mace or ginger.  To me this tasted like a snickerdoodle recipe made into a cake. Very bland but moist cake. Tasted more like a dessert bread.  Icing was great though. If you like a dark spicy carrot cake, stay away!

text:
This is the same recipe my mom used forever.  My favorite cake (have had people that didn't like carrot cake like this one)  I usually leave the pecans out of the cake and either just mix them with the icing, or press them into the sides of the frosted cake.  Can also substitute all or part of the oil with applesauce to save alot of fat/calories and still taste great.  I've also used lower fat cream cheese (don't use fat free).  Great recipe!

text:
This has been an amazing cake numerous times! I've done a couple things differently a couple different times. I have followed "gneebeanie" with their sugar, vanilla, nutmeg, and cinnamon; I've used 1/2 cup oil with 20 oz of drained crushed pineapple; I've used 2.25 cups powdered sugar in the frosting; and I've also served with cake with just whip cream and no frosting. I've probably used walnuts instead of pecans, and Light Smart Balance instead of butter, at times, too.

text:
Awesome recipe "as is".   So good, in fact, that the husband asked I never make it again, as he will eat the whole thing.  :) 

Since the recipe didn't clarify how thick to grate the carrots, I used the "fine" side on my grater.  Carrots seemed to disappear into the cake after baking, which I preferred.     I also omitted the nuts as I don't like them. 

Family and friends loved this cake!

text:
Made this today for my daughter's birthday. It was delish - everyone really liked it. I took a few ideas from other reviewers and used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown; 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce; 1/4 tsp nutmeg; omitted the nuts and kept the rest the same. I baked it in a bundt pan and it took about 45 min. Iced 2/3 of the cake with my own cream cheese frosting and left the rest plain - birthday girl does not like frosting. It was so very moist and yummy!

text:
For our family, this cake was simply too oily. The taste of the fat overwhelmed the whole thing and the carrot flavour was masked. I would never make this again or I would scale way back on the oil, we found it tasted oily. Because of the addition of carrots usually less oil fat is required to make a cake moist. This recipe calls for more than half of the flour quantity in oil-I should have known better. I think that the reviewers who used applesauce probably had better success. Thank you for sharing anyway.

I'm of the mind that you rate a recipe based on the recipe itself, not the changes you made.  I made this recipe as is for my sister-in-law's birthday and it turned out perfect!  The whole family loved it.  My husband took it took work and a coworker said it was the best he ever had, simply because it wasn't as spicy as most carrot cakes. If you want a simple carrot cake that will please everyone, this is definitely for you.

text:
DELICIOUS! This was an awesome carrot cake recipe and my family was amazed I made this from scratch. I didn't have enough carrots, almost 2 1/2 cups and it still tasted very much like carrot cake. I did read several reviews before making this recipe and made some modifications. For a much healthier version, I used 3/4 cup applesauce and 1/2 canola oil. Trust me, you won't miss the rest of the oil, it is extremely moist. I used 1 cup brown sugar and 3/4 cup white sugar. I added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon and vanilla extract. I also added 1/4 tsp nutmeg. And I used 3/4 cup walnuts. For the frosting, I softened 6-7 ounces neufchatel cheese and mixed 1/2 tsp vanilla extract and about 1/2 cup powdered sugar. It was enough frosting for the top. After calculating the calories, the cake was around 274 calories! When I tried this cake the first day, I felt like it was missing some sort of spice. But the next day, all the flavors came together perfectly and it was PERFECT.

text:
AWESOME CAKE!  As much as I hate when people make changes instead of rating the original recipe... I did use half white/half brown sugar. Otherwise I didn't change any ingredients, I just baked it in 2- 9" cake pans instead of the 9x13. I've made this several times now and everyone always loves it! Even my husband who thought he hated carrot cake is a big fan.  The frosting is also the perfect ratio of butter/sugar/cream cheese.

text:
After reading the reviews, I decided to use all brown sugar to make the cake moister. Also, when I measured the flour, I spooned it into the cup and then leveled with a knife: this way you get less flour and as a result, lowers the ratio of dry : wet ingredients. The cake was very moist and delicious with 1/2 cup of raisins (coated with flour to prevent sinking). But a tad more cinnamon would have made the cake even better.

text:
I took the suggestions of another reviewer and did the following: 1) Added 1 extra teaspoon of vanilla extract 2) Added a 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg 3) Added almost 1 teaspoon of cinnamon 4) Used 3/4cup oil and 1/2 cup Golden sauce 5) Only 1 1/4 - 1 1/2 cups of brown sugar (no white sugar) I skipped nuts and the frosting 'cause I felt this cake didn't require it!  I baked a few of these as mini-muffins and used the rest to bake a 9x9 cake. TOTALLY out of this world. It made my Easter very Eastery! :D Thank you Tammy! :)

I've made this recipe four times.  I've made it as a 9" layer cake, and as cupcakes.  It does fall in the middle somewhat, even when baking at a higher temp.  Almost too moist, but very delicious. I give it 5 stars even with my changes as I think it would still be awesome with no changes.  Thanks for sharing!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I didn't try the frosting this time (had a can of store-bought), so this review is of the cake only.  I followed other reviewers' suggestions and used 1 c. brown sugar & 1 cup white, subbed 1/2 c. applesauce for the oil, added 1 8 oz. can drained crushed pineapple, and added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon and 1/4 tsp. nutmeg.  I used 1 pound of carrots to get exactly 3 cups of big shreds (no juice problem). Baked it in 2 oiled and floured 9" rounds for 40 minutes at 350. Even after flouring the pans, the cakes were hard to get out (and my pan sides come off!) so next time I will flour better.  Needed to cook another 5 minutes to get the middles done, or might be better in a 9" x 13" pan.  Outstanding flavor and texture (the done parts, anyway)! The carrot and pineapple chunks look big, but this is the best carrot cake I've ever ha - super moist!  A definite keeper!

I did follow other suggestions and did half brown sugar/half white, added a little extra cinnamon and a teaspoon of nutmeg. My boyfriend's mother said it was the best carrot cake she had ever had and asked for the recipe!

text:
I only bake for special occasion.  And this recipe never fails me.  The last time I use this recipe was 3 years ago and it was a hit.  I baked the cake yesterday for Easter day and it was a hit again.  Gone in a flash.  I made few adjustments especially on the sugar, I reduce it to 1 1/4 cup. And as for the frosting I reduce the confectioner's sugar to 2 cups.  However, the portion of the frosting is too much for one cake.   I served the cake with less icing frosting on top and serve the rest of the frosting in another bowl so that any guests who has sweet tooth can opt for more frosting. I LOVE this recipe is the best.

Display Name:
Michelle Wigmore

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/4882697.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This cake is delicious! Don't use an insulated baking pan. I tested this recipe as I plan to make it next weekend. It's a good thing it was only a test because I made it in an insulated 9x13 baking pan. It took 1 hour and 5 minutes to bake and the centre caved in a bit. I waited over 30 minutes to remove it from the pan and when I did, it fell apart! There was a small area in the centre that was stuck to the pan even though I had sprayed the pan beforehand with cooking spray. We think the long baking time and even the falling apart might be because I used an insulated baking pan. I am going to try it again using a noninsulated one. The cake is so good that I am determined to make it work! I would like to hear from others if they have made this in an insulated pan.

UPDATE: I made this again using a NON insulated baking pan and it turned out perfectly!. It was done in 50 minutes. The only changes I made to the recipe was I reduced the amount of oil to 3/4 cup and added 1/2 cup applesauce. I also used 1 cup brown sugar and one cup white sugar. I omitted the pecans.
Delicious!

country:
None
text:
This was my very first attempt at baking anything from scratch. It turned out excellent! I read tons of reviews and made a few changes: Instead of 1 1/4 cup vegetable oil I used 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. Instead of 2 cups white sugar I used 1 cup white and 1 cup brown. I also added 3 tablespoons vanilla extract instead of 2. Also substituted chopped walnuts for pecans. For the icing I did not use 4 cups confectioner's sugar as I did not have enough. I ended up using a little over 3 cups and it tasted great. I think 4 cups might be too sweet. Thanks for the great recipe!!

text:
This cake was excellent. I followed the directions with the exception of adding another tsp. of cinnamon (to make 3 total). I shredded my carrots with my food processor, and then placed them on a paper towel to absorb any excess water. Instead of baking the cake in a pan, I used my mini-muffin pan. The muffins were fairly soft, so instead of frosting them with an offset spatula (which was tearing up the muffins), I put the frosting in a pastry bag with a large star tip adn piped it on. The results were beautiful, delicious, mini carrot cakes!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent recipe. I made a few changes as written by another reviewer and it was the best carrot cake I have ever had. I did the following: 1.) used 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar 2.) added an extra teaspoon of vanilla extract 3.) added 1 8oz. can of crushed pineapple (I squeezed out most of the juice before adding it) 4.) Added 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg 5.) added 1 extra teaspoon of cinnamon 6.) used 3/4 cup canola oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. The result came out incredibly delicious - the cake was very flavorful and moist. For the frosting, I only used 3.5 cups of powdered sugar, and it was more than sweet enough, with a nicely balanced cream cheese vs. sweet flavor. I can't wait to make this again.

I made this carrot cake AS IS, except I didn't hand grate the carrots, I just used a food processor.  I also used 1/2 brown sugar 1/2 white sugar instead of using only white sugar.  It turned out very moist and perfectly sweet, balanced out nicely by the cream cheese frosting.  I only wish it had more texture, so next time I'll grate chunkier carrots and add in golden raisins.

text:
I did not make any changes to the original cake recipe although I opted to omit the pecans. I think the cake is delicious as is, defiantly the best carrot cake I have ever made and I have made A LOT of them (I make it every year for my hubby's b-day).   I did however, make adjustments to the icing. I started out following it exactly but as many others said, it was WAY to sweet. I suggest the following:  1) use only half the butter (1/4 cup).   2) use 12oz cream cheese (the extra bite of the cream cheese cuts the sweetness)  3) use an extra tsp vanilla (2 tsp total)

country:
None
text:
Simply wonderful! I love carrot cake and has been wanting to try making my own. I read through some suggestions before tackling the task. The changes i made was 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown, 1/2 tsp nutmeg, 3 tbs vanilla instead of 2, 3 tbs cinnamon instead of 2, 3/4 cup oil with 1/2 cup apple sauce instead of just the 1 1/4 cup oil. I baked then in 2 9in round pans for 35min in 350 degree. I also used walnuts instead of pecans. For the icing i only used 3 cups confectioners sugar and omitted adding more nuts. My first attempt came out very moist and tasty. Even my 4 year old is asking for more. I will definitely make this again and next time i will add some raisins.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was SO moist, I couldn't believe it!  My husband went nuts (ha).  Here are the errors I made and my overally thoughts: I did add pineapple and my husband loved it.  I, on the other hand would have really preferred this recipe as-is.  If you do add the pineapple, you may need to extend the cook time 10-15 mins...or maybe it was just my oven OR the fact that I used a ceramic pan.  I did not turn the cake out to cool but left it in the pan and piled the frosting high.  With regards to the frosting...I added about two table spoons of melted white chocolate and two table spoons of heavy cream while I was whipping.  I got this from another recipe on this sight.  It also called for orange extract, which once again, my husband loved but I would omit next time.  I did not put the nuts in the frosting.  My final thoughts about THIS recipe (forget all my own alterations), It is absolutely a keeper.  I do think that I would reduce down the sugar in the cake, it was a little sweet for my taste, maybe by about a half a cup.  I know some people swapped the white sugar and used brown (at least partially) I don't think I'll do that, I liked the flavor without the molasis punch that brown sugar delivers.  Also, I don't think I'll ever put nuts in my frosting.  I love a good, smooth, frosting.

This was a very good carrot cake.  I had some trouble on the baking time and my cake came out a little too brown for my liking. Very good overall and we enjoyed the cake.

text:
i made the cake in a bunt pan and it turned out pretty and delicious! I used coconut oil and limited the sugar to 1 cup brown and 1/2 cup white in the cake.  The cake turned out delicious- very moist. For the frosting I cut the powdered sugar in half to 2 cups. It was the BEST cream cheese frosting I've ever had- and still very sweet! Next time I will add even less powdered sugar.  I did not use walnuts.  I highly recommend this recipe for families since it doesn't have raisins, coconut, or pineapple- as long as everyone likes carrots no one will be picking anything out!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
this is my all time favorite carrot cake recipe.  well not ver batum of the recipe, but minor tweaks here and there as noted by previous reviews.  1) use only half of the oil and replace the other half with apple sauce 2)use 1 cup of the white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar (light or dark, in order of preference) 3) walnuts are a must, but raisins, pineapples, and other dried fruit or nuts are totally optional i found this recipe best cooked in two 9 inch baking pans.  that way it's easier to set up as a two layered cake.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/6130979.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the first cake I've ever made and it came out delicious! I read the reviews and I tweaked the recipe according to some of the suggestions. To make it a little bit healthier I used wheat flour instead of all-purpose; I used 3/4 cups of vegetable oil and 1/4 of applesauce instead of 1 1/4 cup of vegetable oil; I also reduced the pecans to 1/2 cup and added 1/2 cup of raisins. Also for those who want to bake but do not have the equipment (i.e. a mixer or a food processor) fear not because all you need is a large mixing bowl, a whisk and a little bit of muscle.

text:
I made all the alterations to the recipe suggested by gneebeanie (Dec. 8, 2006). Draining the unsweetened, crushed pineapple, I soaked 1 cup of raisins in the juice then drained them before adding.  I also reduced the nuts to 1/2 cup, using walnuts.  The cake is so flavorful, the next time around, I'm going to replace the 1 cup of granulated sugar with 1 cup of Splenda to help reduce calories.  With all the alterations, in the end, it's an entirely different recipe but a gourmet treat.

country:

text:
Can I give it 6 stars? This is by far the best cake I've ever had, period (all flavors included). My 68 year old father said he'd had none better, and it was my first time making carrot cake, so that's a testament to how easy to follow this recipe is. Like others here, I used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown. Also I cut the oil to 3/4 cup and used 1/2 cup applesauce to supplement, and added a little nutmeg into the mix. If there is any problem with this cake it is that the total thing (with frosting) I calculated out to be about 7600 Calories. Split it to 8 pieces, that's just under 1000 Calories a slice, or in other words, 50-75% of one's daily recommended intake. Because of that this cake will only be made for very special occasions, otherwise I would have it weekly. Oh god it is so MOIST! n_n

I am embarrassed to say that this was the first time I had ever made a cake from scratch, oh, except for a cheescake which I have made about 3-4 times.  Up to this point every other cake I have made has come from a box. This carrot cake was awesome!  I looked at some reviews and the only changes I made were adding a teaspoon more cinnamon than was called for and reducing the sugar for the frosting by 1/2 cup. Yup. This was really, really good. I brought this for Easter dinner at my sisters. The next day she phoned me and asked for the recipe and then said that it's the kind of cake she'd pay to have a slice of. My alterations: I used the 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce combo as suggested. I also used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown as was also suggested. I'm actually going to make it again today for Easter dinner with the in-laws - it was that good. Thanks for a great recipe!

I forgot how much I loved cake batter. There were some modifications, mostly based on other reviewer's suggestions which are summarized nicely at the top. I did muffins because they are portable and easier for groups, read: my coworkers. This makes about 28 muffins - bake at 30 min and use the muffin pan liners. Muffin makers also note you can cut the icing in half if you make muffins. Pineapple may have been too juicy for muffins but overall this was moist and lightly sweet and spiced. Thanks!

Oooops!  I wrote a review for this recipe and after I had posted it I realized that I reviewed the wrong recipe.  I did Not serve this with crusty bread and grated cheddar.  This carrot cake was excellent!  I used 2 round pans and made it as a double layer cake.  I substituted 1/2c apple sauce in place of 1/2c oil.  Cooked them for about 25 min. until knife came out clean.  There was enough frosting to put between the layers.  Will definately make this again.

text:
I made half batch for 10 muffins. Baked for 22 mins. They were moist & yummy. No cream cheese on hand, used peanut butter frosting from this site. Good. Followup: Made this again. This time I used 3/4c white & 1/2c brown sugar to subs. 2c white sugar. For the frosting, 1 & 3/4c icing sugar is sweet enough for my taste. As another viewer mentioned, I add 1 tbsp lemon juice to the frosting. It balances the sweetness and bring up more flavor. Baked 6 Xlarge and 10 large in one batch.

text:
Gorgeous!! No wonder it's the best-rated carrot cake recipe on this site. Ever since my first taste of carrot cake at an exclusive bakery I've tried to find a recipe that yields the same magic...and here it is! I've made this cake a few times now - even in a ring cake tin - and it impresses every time. Stick to the recipe 'as is'...you won't go wrong. Although I did have to bake mine a little longer with some aluminium foil on top (to prevent burning), but that's because my oven has seen better days and tends to be unreliable and heats unevenly.

UPDATE: though I said it's a great recipe 'as is', I've tried it with toasted walnuts (skin blanched off) and nutmeg as suggested by many others (for me nutmeg is a must in a carrot cake) and the taste just gets better. Hmm...I drool just thinking of this cake. Makes me wanna open my own carrot cake shop!!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was absolutely fantastic! As suggested by previous reviewers, I added an extra teaspoon of vanilla, an extra teaspoon of cinnamon and a 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg for additional flavor. I also subsituted walnuts for pecans and added an 8 oz. can of drained crushed pineapple. I don't have a grater or a food processor so I chopped up several carrots and used the "Grind" option on my blender. 
I made two round cakes with it, but take heed to the fact that if you're using round cake pans, 35 minutes in the oven should be enough. I baked mine for 45 min and the tops came out slightly burned. Despite that, the cake was still moist and delicious. Another problem I had was with the frosting. It was way too sweet, so I would suggest cutting the confectioner's sugar down to three cups. Otherwise, I would definitely reccommend this to everyone!

text:
I have made this several times.  Made exactly to specifications, it is very very good.  After reading the reviews, I made the following changes, which we now prefer:  (1) use 1 cup white and 1 cup dark brown sugar; (2) add a little extra vanilla; (3) add some rehydrated raisins (maybe 3/4 cup); and (4) add 1/4 tsp nutmeg.  These are not required, but we like it even better with these changes.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This recipe was great! My dad has a insatiable sweet tooth, and carrot cake is his favorite desert. I've been trying to find a good recipe for years, but they'd either come out too dry or too wet. And the ones that did come out relatively okay weren't up to par with my dad discerning palate. This one, with a few personal adjustments of mine, has turned out to be a favorite. So much so that my dad, who rarely bakes, asked me for the recipe. Believe me, that is not a small compliment. Anyway, the adjustments I made are: 1 c white sugar/1 c light brown sugar. I reduced the oil to 1 c(2 sticks), and instead used real, unsalted butter. Not necessarily the healthy choice, but it does make for a nice flavor. Also, added 2 tsp nutmeg, just for that extra bite of spice. With or without my adjustments, this cake is still wonderful. I will be using both versions for years to come! Thanks so much for sharing this with all of us!!!

text:
Good LORD! This was amazing!  My sister requested a carrot cake for her 20th b-day so I searched for a recipe, and this ended up being the winning entry:) My first attempt at a carrot cake ever, and as a professional pastry chef I must say I was mighty impressed!  Very moist, the frosting was to die for and just yum.  I will note that I omitted the pecans in the frosting, those in the cake were nutty enough for us, and also if you DON'T like a really thick frosting, scale it down accordingly because you get a nice thick lawn of cream cheese frosting here!  Also the 18 portions in the original recipe are more than generous, so if you intend on feeding a smaller crowd I would consider scaling down.  Thanks!

text:
This recipe is a great way to start! I made my first Carrot Cake a few days ago. I started with the recipe, read the other reviewers' alterations and came up with my own variant. Instead of using so much oil, I substituted 1/2 cup oil and 1/2 cup fresh chopped apples. I also threw in about 1/2 cup crushed pineapple. I used 1 Tablespoon of cinnamon and 1 tablespoon of vanilla (instead of two teaspoons each.) I used half white sugar and half brown sugar. I added a small handful of flaked coconut to the cake ingredients. For the frosting, I omitted the nuts, and I added the zest from one lemon instead. I received rave reviews and many requests for the recipe. I can't say my variant qualifies as a new recipe altogether because I did start with the Carrot Cake III recipe here. Thanks for the help!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a simple cake to make and is absolutely delicious!  I followed some of the previous suggestions and did the following:
(1) Used 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar
(2) Added 1/4 tsp nutmeg
(3) Added an additional 1 tsp vanilla
(4) Added 8oz drained crushed pineapple.
I hand-grated the carrots for large slices.  I also purchased a jar of ready-made Betty Crocker cream cheese frosting to hurry the process!
I suggest frosting the pieces as you serve them, so you don't have leftover cake with the cream cheese frosting sitting on it.  Then you can store the frosting in the fridge and frost as you eat for a fresher taste.  Enjoy!
