text:
SUPERB CAKE!  I made this using the recommended changes:  used 1/2 white and 1/2 brown sugar, doubled the cinnamon and vanilla, added 1/2 t nutmeg, added 1 c pineapple, added 1 c raisins, made in bundt pan (350 degrees, 50 min) and topped with cream cheese glaze, cinnamon sugar and chopped pecans. Cake was dense, full-bodied and very flavorful.  Family and co-workers fought over it!  Thanks for both the original recipe and all of the recommended revisions - you can't go wrong with any of them.

country:
None
text:
With the substitutions given from the member below it was the best carrot I have ever had. My fiance's family loved it so much, they are requesting it for  birthdays now.

These simple modifications make a huge difference in the overall outcome of the cake. 

•3/4 cups canola oil 
•2 cups sugar (1 cup white, 1 cup brown)
•3 teaspoons vanilla extract
•¼ teaspoon nutmeg 
•½ cup apple sauce
•1 8oz. can of crushed pineapple

I would also recommend only using 3.5 cups of sugar for the frosting because 4 cups seemed a bit too sweet for my preference.

text:
This carrot cake is the best I have EVER had by far. I have tried many from different restaurants and bakeries, and I was always turned off by the overly sweet frosting, with the lack of cream cheese taste, or by the dryness of the cake. This one was excellent! Extremely moist, dense and delicious! I followed the suggestions posted by the previous reviewers, but I did omit the pineapple. I think it was fantastic without it. I also cut the confectioner's sugar down to 2.5 to 2 3/4 cups, and it was perfectly sweet, with the cream cheese shining through. This cake is also so easy to make! My whole family loved it, even self proclaimed "non-likers" of carrot cake. Thanks for the recipe.

This carrot cake was good and the frosting was creamy, sweet, and delicious. However,the next time i make this cake I am going to continually check the carrot cake while cooking because i left mine in for 40 minutes and if i left it in there a little longer it would be on the verge of burning. I tried carrot cake for the first time a few years ago and this cake doesn't quite match that one, but for my first attempt to make it homemade by myself pretty good.Thanks for the recipe!

text:
I just made this cake for a leaving party at work yesterday! Excellent! Went down a treat!
I took some of the advice and used only 1 cup of oil.. Amazing!
I used creme fraiche instead of cream cheese and i only used 1/2 cup of sugar, which i melted in the butter and whisked the butter and sugar mixture while it was cooling. Went into a lovely smooth butterry sauce! I then added this to the creme fraiche and then let it harden in the fridge for 30-50 mins!

Great recipe thanks!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/global/features/1747.gif
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a great recipe to follow, I made a few alterations similar to other readers... 3/4c oil & 3/4c apple sauce, 1c white sugar & 1c brown sugar, extra tsp of vanilla and cinnamon, 1 1/2c finely chopped pecans and lke other readers I used the cheese grater method for shredding my carrots. With the frosting I doubled the recipe since I was making a volcono and needed to ice between 4 layers. I only used 5c powdered sugar though, so that would be 2.5 for a normal cake and it was plenty sweet. 
I loved this carrot cake and so did everyone who ate it at the party I took it to, even my boyfriend who had never liked carrot cake! I made this into a volcano shape using a bundt pan, pyrex bowl, and cupcakes for a coupls that was getting married on a volcano in 
Hawaii.

userID:
1454172
Display Name:
JULESMICHY
isPro:

2

0
madeRecipesCount:
48
favoritesCount:

recipesCount:

reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/301528.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I followed the suggestions of other reviewers and substituted 3/4c applesauce + 1/2c oil, and 3/4c white sugar + 1/2c brown sugar. I also added in 1/4tsp of nutmeg, and a dash each of ground ginger and cloves. The result was a moist, flavorful cake, but I think because I tried to split the recipe into two, 9-inch round pans I had issues that I wouldn't have using a 13x9 baking pan. First of all, the batter is NOT enough to make two round cakes. Also, it took far less than the 40-50 minutes called for in the recipe. I checked it after just 25 minutes, and the edges of my cake were burnt.

So, double the recipe if you want to make a layer cake, and check it before half the recommended time has elapsed. Other than that, great texture and flavor and I'll definitely make it again with the alterations.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made this 3 times.  The first time in a 9 x 13 pan and it turned out great.  The second time I made it in 6 inch pans and it was a disaster.  I thought the cakes were done because the toothpick came out clean and they sprung back when touched.  As soon as they were out of the oven, they started to sink.  When I tried to turn one of the cakes out, it ripped and you could see the middle of the cake was still completely raw.  Dumped the cake back in the pan, put all the cakes back in the oven and let them cook for at least another 20 minutes.  In the end I couldn't use them for the birthday cake I was planning because they looked so horrible.  But my husband was very happy because even though they were a wreck, it still tasted really good.  I tried again today and was meticulous with every step & ingredient.  I baked them 10 minuted longer than I thought I should before I even tested them.  This time I did an internal temp and made sure it was at least 190 degrees.  Once I took them out, I said a prayer and walked away for 15 minutes.  When I came back one sunk just a tiny bit and both came out of the pan well.  I think I finally have usable cake for the birthday party.  In the end I would give this recipe 3 1/2 stars.  Flavor is great but the recipe may be a bit temperamental.

text:
OMG! This was a total hit with friends and family - they said that this was the best cake they ever had.  However, I did do some improvising like a few others did.  I put one cup brown sugar and 1 cup sugar.  I did use 8 oz. crushed pineapple. (get most of the juice out) and added 1/4 tsp. nutmeg.  I did bake in (2) 9 inch cake pans and baked for around 20 minutes or till toothpick comes out clean.  I did also use a cream cheese frosting recipe that I have which was also a huge hit.  Any cream cheese frosting recipe will do.  I sell cakes on the side and this one will definately be a hit!

text:
My husband is a carrot cake junkie and this is the best-ever.  I used some other posters' suggestions as follows: 1/2 c applesauce and 3/4 c Canola, used Brown Sugar (cake only), 3 t Vanilla Extract,3 t Ground Cinnamon,8oz Crushed pineapple drained very well and I didnt use the suggestion of 1/4 Nutmeg but I did give 3-4 good shakes of Pumpkin Pie Spice.  The frosting was to die for by using 16oz Cream Cheese and start slowly with the Confectoners Sugar, I used about 1/4 Cup- but add slowly and taste along the way to get it right- it is the crown on this incredible treat!

text:
yes, this cake was delicious.  i made it for my husband's birthday and everyone loved it.  i don't usually like carrot cake at all, but i liked this.  i used these suggestions from other reviews:  half white, half brown sugar; 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup applesauce instead of full amount of oil; only about 2 1/2 cups of powdered sugar in the frosting.  i had lots of frosting left over, but my husband says i didn't put enough on the cake and has been putting the extra on each individual piece he eats!  this recipe does have a lot of nuts, so if you aren't a big fan of them, you should probably cut back on the pecans in the cake and the frosting.  i really liked them, though.  thanks a bunch for this recipe!

text:
This was the best recipe ever.  All I did was substitute the sugar with brown sugar, used 1 cup whole wheat flour with a tad bit of rye flour, used only applesauce for the oil, used 3 1/2 cups carrots and one jar baby food carrots, toasted walnuts with a mix of pecans, added a can of crushed pineapple (don't forget to drain the juice!), added one cup of golden raisins, two teaspoons of imported cinnamon and madagascar bourbon vanilla.  For the frosting I used low-fat cream cheese, real butter, Pastry Pride and powdered sugar with the madagascar bourbon vanilla.  The results were AMAZING!!  I would make this recipe again and again!!!!

274533
Display Name:
ADLIZA
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674152.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I was a bit apprehensive when I read some of the (really) negative comments here. This is my first time making a carrot cake, and I wanted sth that works.

Nonetheless, I went ahead n chose this recipe because of all the good reviews it received. I used all the most popular modifications suggested here & made my first ever carrot cake.

And voila! The cake definitely tasted great, but the texture was a bit off (only slightly dry) and the sides were kinda hard (slightly, but definitely noticeable). But the taste, NO REGRETS. 

So I decided to give it another try and tried to figure out what went wrong. My second time, I decided to be bold (perhaps stupid?) and decided to bake three more carrot cakes for the party I was throwing. So folks, this is what i've discovered (those of u who r already experts need not read hehe):

1) Use the 1/1 cup white/brown sugar as recommended. Don't reduce it.

2) When they say squeeze out the pineapple juice, don't do what I did - I actually really, really squeezed 'em dry. I placed the pineapple cubes in a kitchen towel and squeeze 'em till I was only left with the fibers. A waste of my time and energy. It's ok to have some moisture left in them. 

3) If you're using 9" square (read: not rectangle) pans, use deep pans instead of shallow ones because with this recipe's portion, it bakes better. 

4) My own modification - I used less than 1/2 c applesauce coz I was running out on my 2nd and 3rd cakes (yes, i mixed them separately because i wanted

text:
My boyfriend said I should give this recipe seven stars.  It's the best carrot cake we've ever had.  I made a few changes:  I used whole wheat flour, which worked great.  I added 8 ounces of squeezed-dry crushed pineapple and omitted the pecans.  I used 3/4 c oil and 2/3 c applesauce.  I used about 3 c sugar in the frosting and reduced fat cream cheese (not fat free).  I also used 1/2 brown and 1/2 white sugar. And since I used organic carrots, I didn't peel them.   I froze some and it thawed well.  Wonderful recipe.

text:
I found this recipe after trying a failed recipe from a book.  
This was a great recipe to start from.  After reading many reviews, here are the substitutions I made-
part applesauce/part vegetable oil
used cinnamon applesauce
half brown sugar/half white sugar
added 8oz. can of crushed pineapple with part of the juice as needed. I also did not use an electric mixer, which may have been the reason for my first cake failing.  I did divide this batter into 2 9inch rounds. 

This cake was so moist, and delicious.  I can't imagine anyone not liking this cake!

This was my first time making a carrot cake. text:
My husband is a carrot cake afficionado and he thought this recipe was the best he's ever had.  I halved the recipe since it's just the 2 of us and baked it in a bread loaf pan.  Then I sliced it into 3 layers horizontally and frosted between each layer.  I also made a few small changes in the recipe itself.  I used 1-1/2 tsp of cinnamon (instead of 1 tsp), I added 1/4 tsp of Nutmeg and ~1.5-2 Tbsp of diced crystallized ginger.  It turned out great!

text:
I used this recipe for my mother's 92nd birthday party. One of the best things about the recipe is that it is very easy to "customize" and still come out with a great tasting product. I grated a bunch of carrots and when all was said and done I had 4 cups instead of 3 but I put them all in. Like others have suggested, I substituted unsweetened applesauce for some of the oil. I also put in about a cup of raisins instead of the nuts. It was fabulous!! Dense, super moist but not oily. Even my 11 year old grandson who said that he didn't like carrot cake decided to try a little piece. He gave it 2 thumbs up and requested seconds. The old carrot cake recipe I had has been thrown away. This is a keeper. I also used the recipe for the frosting, but I only put in 3 cups of powdered sugar and not 4 and it tasted perfect, sweet but not too sweet.

text:
I just made this recipe for a party I am going to tonight but I put a bit of the batter in a tiny pan so that I could try it so I know it's okay and also so my kids could have a taste!

My kids loved it and I loved it too.  I followed the suggestions of greenbean I think the reviewer was?

Next time I think I will add even more nutmeg than 1/4 tsp and add some ginger as well.

It was light and yummy and very good but not necessarily the spiciest carrot cake I've had, even with the extra 1 tsp of cinnamon and bit of nutmeg added again.

I also was too lazy to make the icing but had bought a container of ready made cream cheese icing that turned out to be too sweet and not cream cheese-like enough for me so I added in a block of light cream cheese and beat it up and with that it was very good.

Next time will try the icing that was with the recipe, was just hoping to save a step this time.

text:
Absolutely amazing carrot cake! First carrot cake I've ever made. Replaced all of the vegetable oil with applesauce (used 1 1/2 cups of applesauce), used 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup white flour, 1 cup whole wheat flour, and only 2 cups of confectioners' sugar in the frosting. Turned out incredibly moist - 30 minutes in the convection oven was more than enough (would probably check on it around 25 minutes). Had a difficult time getting frosting perfectly smoot, but it was still delicious! Amazing, easy cake!!!

This is one fantastic recipe.  This is the best carrot cake I've ever made.  I put the pecans into the cake rather than into the frosting.   One thing I found was that the frosting was rather thick and I had problems spreading and keeping it on the cake.  When slicing, I found that the frosting lifted off rather easily.  I am going to search for a different frosting recipe for this cake. 
This is absolutely better the 2nd day and it keeps getting better the longer it sits.  Keep it cold in the fridge.  If it lasts long enough .

text:
I made this cake for my co-workers yesterday and they absolutely loved it. I had to increase recipe to 27 servings. Seems like a lot but I baked it in 2 parchment lined 9" springform pans for 38 minutes, greased and floured sides.  I used 1 cup veg oil, 3/4 cup applesauce, 1 cup white sugar,  1 1/2 cups lt brown sugar, 2 1/2 Tablespoons Vanilla extract,  2 1/2 Tablespoons ground cinnamon, 3/4 tsp nutmeg, grated orange rind.   For the frosting I increased the  softened cream cheese to 28 ounces. Because of the reviews saying it could use more flavor, I did a little tweaking of this recipe. I had 1 piece left over to take home, and the next day after sitting, it even had more flavor, Awesome!   Lorraine

text:
I have made this recipe at least 10 times and it always comes out perfect. I love a moist, dense carrot cake and this one is really the bomb.  I hate reviewers who change people's recipes and give it bad reviews...but I have to have coconut and pineapple in my carrot cake.  I always add ½ cup crushed pineapple (drain most of the liquid) and ½ cup sweetened coconut.  Thanks for a great recipe Tammy!!!  UPDATE:  After reading all the reviews again I noticed that occasionally my cake does sink a little in the center so I followed several reviewers recommendations and perfection!   #1  I did NOT open the oven door at all and made sure I was preheated to 350.  #2  I did NOT over beat the ingredients, as a matter of fact, I always hand mix this cake (I whisk the wet ingredients and use a wooden spoon to stir/incorporate dry ingredients )as not to introduce a lot of air.  I baked for 40 minutes and the cake is picture perfect.  I also always pulse my carrots in a food processor (after grating them) to make them a little finer because I don't like stringy, big pieces of carrot in my cake.

I made this cake for a few people who love carrot cake.  They all really enjoyed it, but I wasn't ecstatic about it myself.  It tasted great!  But, it just wasn't what I am used to in a carrot cake.  Still, I will probably make it again.  I did make a couple, small, changes - I used walnuts instead of pecans (just my personal preference) and I added another 1/2 cup of powdered sugar to the frosting.  TIP: Cream the butter and cream cheese together in a blender or food processor.  It will make your life so much easier.  Then, once mixed, add the vanilla and powdered sugar by hand.

city:

country:
None
text:
I love this cake every time I make it and have gotten tons of compliments, but as usual I changed the recipe according to reviews!  I use only 1/2 cup oil but 5 cups of carrots to keep the moisture (works great and much better for you!).  No pecans (I don't like nuts in cakes).  For 1 cup of the all-purpose flour I substitute whole wheat flour.  For 1 cup of the white sugar I use brown sugar instead. And to up the flavor I use 3 teaspoons of vanilla and 3 teaspoons of cinnamon.  Mostly I don't ice the cake but when I do I use the Whipped Cream - Cream Cheese Frosting from this site.  I love to make it in two round or square pans and freeze one for emergencies.

text:
This was the first carrot cake I ever made and it was absolutely declicious.  The only change that I made to the cake recipe was to use walnuts instead of pecans.  I found that a one-pound bag of carrots yielded the three cups of shredded carrots the recipe calls for.  I baked the batter in two 9" round shiny metal cake pans in a convection oven at 325 degrees for 38 minutes.  Instead of using the traditional cream cheese frosting included in this recipe, I followed the advice of a previous reviewer and used the Whipped Cream Cheese frosting recipe from this website.  My guests raved!

I live in Taiwan, and I've made this dessert countless times for my Chinese co-workers.  They LOVE it...and they're usually picky about sweets!  I always add raisins and sometimes 1/2 cup of crushed pineapples instead of the pecans, since I can't find those here.

Also, I like to add 2 tbsp. of cinnamon to the frosting.  It's delicious!

What can I say about this recipe other than that if you want to blow away your dinner party here it is! The only change I made was that I withheld the nuts from the frosting and added a cup of toasted coconut to the nuts and pressed then into the sides and top of the cake. I then piped the cream cheese in swirls around the top edge. Very pretty presentation and a knock out dessert that went well with our Columbian coffee. I would give this 12 stars if I could.

text:
Great carrot cake here but here's the BEST SECRET! On a whim I substituted 3 cups of chopped apples (1/4") for the carrots and ended up w/ THE BEST APPLE CAKE EVER INVENTED!!! Instead of the cream cheese frosting, do this: 
Melt one stick of butter on medium flame. Add 1 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup of heavy cream. Stir slightly and bring to a boil. Simmer for ten (10)minutes- DO NOT STIR! Remove from heat and add 2 tsp of vanilla. Stir in and let cool slightly. Pour/drizzle over cake. Almost too good!

text:
Sooooo good!  I made this for Easter and it was gone that day.  Out of 6 adults and 4 kids, all loved it.  It is moist and delicious.  As far as the other reviews: yes it does need a day for the flavors to blend, I made it Saturday and it was pretty good, but by Sunday wow!  I also took the other advice and used applesauce for half the oil, and used brown sugar for half of the white.  For the frosting, I also only used half of the powdered sugar.  It was perfect.  The cake was very moist!  Thank you so much for this recipe Tammy!  I have tried to make carrot cake 3 times and it always turned out bad.  No more!  :)

text:
Changes ahead...hang on to your soap boxes. The base recipe is great AND I used all of the changes from the premier review (applesauce, brown sugar, extra vanilla and cinnamon). I got rave reviews from my eaters. 
I don't understand all of the complaints about changes--that is what cooking and baking is all about. You have certain things on hand or don't like ingredients and so you make changes. Personally, I want to hear about how that process works for others. Until AR recipes provides some new widget to allow people to declare"made as shown" or "made with changes" let's be thankful for the brave bakers out there.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The video instructs you to wait until you get the wet and dry ingredients mixed together before grating the carrots- don't do that. Once the leavening ingredients (baking soda and baking powder) are wet -they start to active. Have your carrots grated and ready to go first. I grate mine before I start to do anything. Then you can mix the wet with the dry ingredients, then add your  waiting carrots, and then get your cake right in the oven! Someone else already suggested adding 1 cup crushed pineapple and I wholeheartedly agree- OMG, so good....

city:

text:
Unfortunately I did not make the recipe as is.  Browsing through the other reviews I did as they suggested.  The changes I made:
- 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar (next time I make this I may just use brown sugar as I found this was too sweet for our diabetic household)
- 3 tsp cinnamon
- 1 tsp nutmeg
- 1 tsp ground clove
- 1 tsp all spice
- 3 tsp vanilla extract
- 1/2 apple sauce and 3/4 vegetable oil (using the apple sauce will help get rid of the baking soda/powder taste)
- I grated the carrots using the larger holes on yh grater

I made mini cupcakes and came out with 72 perfect bite sized cupcakes.  Baked them for 20 min and they came out perfectly. 

For the frosting I used light cream cheese instead of regular and used 2 cups of sugar. 

Loved the adjustments reccomemed. Will be making this again this week!

text:
My review is on the batter because I didn't have the ingredients to make the frosting. Luckily I had a jar of cream cheese frosting in my pantry. Let me start by saying I hate carrot cake. I've had many kinds because I never want to offend someone by not trying it, but I have never had any that I liked. The only reason why I decided to make this was because my roommate asked if I would make him a carrot cake sometime, and I just bought a new KitchenAid mixer. I had all the ingredients, so I went ahead and started grating the carrots. I read some reviews where many people changed one thing or another. I decided to just stick to the original recipie first and see how it came out, and I'm glad I did. This cake is amazing! My roommate said it was "f**king delicious!" I actually ate two pieces because I liked it so much. Thanks for a great recipie and for making me like carrot cake :)

text:
This recipe is a staple for me. I have made this cake probably 30 to 40 times over the years. 
I have noticed people commenting here about ppl making changes and acting like it is a huge improvement. They are upset with this practice and I do agree. Part of the problem is that this site specifically asks if you have made any changes when you are reviewing a recipe and perhaps that encourages them. I have done plenty of things to this recipe like adding shredded coconut, crushed pineapple, broken almonds because someone was allergic to pecans and walnuts but not almonds. I have substituted brown for white sugar mostly because I was out of white.  But the real truth is that no matter what I do with this recipe and in particular even just following it exactly, all my friends basically lose their mind over it and almost all say it is the best carrot cake they have ever had. It is simple and fantastic. Period.

text:
I made this recipe 3x before I got it right. The only thing I feel is necessary to mention is omitting the baking soda. When I used it, my center collapsed after removing it from the oven. Once I took another reviewer's suggestion to instead use double the baking powder and no soda, it turned out absolutely perfect! If you find grating carrots annoying, just buy one of those pre-shredded bags in the produce section. Next time, I'm going to try it without pecans in the frosting (there are a lot), just to see. This recipe is pretty rad, especially for those that don't care for the cake with pineapple in it. Happy baking! :)

country:
None
text:
I made this cake today.

The only changes I made were:
I used walnuts instead of pecans, because that's what we had, and prefer.
Even my neighbour loves this carrot cake...with the walnuts.

I also cut the recipe in half, and used a 9-inch cake pan, just in case we didn't like the cake, and wouldn't waste so much.
I cooked the 9-inch cake for 30-35 mins. 

Edit: I've made this cake many times now, using the whole 9x13 recipe. I still cook it in two 9-inch pans, and take one to my neighbour. He says you really can't taste the cinnamon in it, and he's right. I'm not a fan of cinnamon and was worried two teaspoons would stand out in flavour. It didn't, luckily.

It came out very moist, and did not sink in the centre.
It was my first time making carrot cake from scratch.

I'm not a big fan of carrot cake, that's why I made a smaller one. I did like this one, though. 
However, my husband really loved it. 
Maybe next time, I will make the 9x13 inch cake and freeze pieces for him to take to work.

Nothing in this recipe needs to be changed at all.

None
text:
Great recipe. However, I used white spelt flour, l  cup grape seed oil because that's all I had, and less processed cane sugar. The sugar had a sugar cane smell to it, so I was concerned about the flavor, but it turned out perfect. I also only used 2 cups of grated carrots and that was 4 carrots. I've been making carrot cake for many years but hadn't made one within the past year. The only drawback is that I think I'll eat too much of it because it's delicious. One more note, to shred my carrots I use the grater disk with my food processor and then I place the S blade in the container and process them again no more than one minute until they're just well grated but not mushy. This works well for me.

text:
I made this following the recipe exactly and it turned out DELICIOUS. I'm a huge carrot cake fan and this is by far the yummiest one I've ever had. I left out the nuts and was glad I did, the decadence in the basic recipe is by far more than enough. Only tip is make sure to dry the carrots after washing and peeling before grating, and use a coarser grade for the grating. I think that may explain some of the extra "juice" others were mentioning. Awesome recipe, thank you!!

text:
followed most of gneebeanie suggestions except I didn't use the pineapples they suggested.  I did the following
1) using 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar 
2) adding an extra teaspoon of vanilla extract 
3) Added 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg 
4) added 1 extra teaspoon of cinnamon 
5) used 3/4 cup canola oil and 1/2 cup applesauce
6) For the frosting, 3.5 cups of powdered sugar

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/2053572.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I love this recipe. My modifications. I use a food processor to totally crumble my carrots and I end up with like 5 cups of carrots. This helps keep it moist. I also, depending on the time of year will split the sugar half white/brown and add extra spice. I also substitute 1/2 cup crushed walnuts in the cake batter. Delish since I'm  not huge on huge pieces of nuts. For frosting I cut half the sugar out and again I crush the pecans so its almost a nut powder. People beg me to make this cake , I've given them recipe with mods. but Still they want me to make it. I always oblige because its sooooo yummy. Thank you for this recipe
p.s I do not recommend cutting the oil. Carrot cake is suppose to moist or else you end up with a loaf or dry muffin style cake. Extra fresh carrots are always a nice addition too.

text:
This must be a great recipe as it is. I made a few major changes to make it a bit more nutritionally friendly. It turned out denser than probably expected but very flavorful. I split the flour with cashew meal/flour, used coconut oil, and coconut sugar. I used lemon extract plus a ½ t instead of vanilla in the frosting to go with all the coconut flavor from the cake. Personally, I didn't eat much frosting because of the butter, but I tasted and I liked it and more important, I got good feedback from the carrot cake fans. Consider this carrot cake LVIX.

text:
This was a good, basic carrot cake recipe.  Nothing special here and if it was my recipe I would reduce the sugar in both the cake and the frosting.  I put 3 instead of 4 cups of sugar in the frosting and it was still way too sweet for my taste.  I think carrot cake is pretty hard to screw up so if you are looking for a basic, no frills cake this is fine but just know there are plenty like this out there that lack the overdose of sugar that this one contains.

This cake is by far my fave. I have made lots of carrot cakes over the years. I did like others suggested add an extra teaspoon of cinnamon and also 1/4 tsp. nutmeg. I also added to the 2 tsp of vanilla, a tsp of rum flavoring. I also used 3/4 cup melted coconut oil and 1/2 cup butter!

text:
This is hands down the most delicious and best carrot cake recipe ever! Once, I made it vegan, by substituting flax seeds for the eggs, and it was still great. Another time, I made it for my diabetic friend, so I used either Splenda,Stevia, or Truvia, and added yogurt for moisture, plus one other suggestion on the sugar substitute package. I  must have added too much extra liquid, so I ended up baking it an additional 30 minutes, until it wasn't liquid in the middle. It turned out to be the best cake ever! Everyone (3 men and one boy) one ate it right then and there, there were no left overs!

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674168.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was really good, my family loved it!  I made the following substitutions:  Out of necessity, used 1C brown and 1C white sugar rather than all white (I was running low on white).  From a calorie standpoint I used 1/2 C applesauce and 3/4 C oil in place of all oil.  Added just a 1/2 t ginger, because I love the stuff, and no nuts, because my kids aren't crazy about them.  Made 2 nine-inch round layers, which did sink just a bit in the middle, but it wasn't noticable once frosted.  Plenty moist and very delicious--even son #3 liked it, in spite of the carrots!  :) For frosting--added extra 4 oz cream cheese to this recipe, as I prefer that ratio of "tang".  Perfection, definite keeper.  Thanks!

text:
I have been making this recipe for years. People rave over how delicious it is. A few notes: If the cake will be frosted, I reduce the sugar to 1 cup. Also I reduce the oil to 1 cup. I find that 1 1/4 makes the cake almost wet. Lastly, sometimes the cake makes my tongue feel weird. Possibly the baking powder is too much.

I believe this is my first from scratch cake. I did use half brown packed sugar and half white sugar. I also didn't use any nuts, although I may try that!  Son C and I picked fresh carrots from our garden, and all the boys took turns shredding carrots to make packed cups to go into this cake. All of the kids and I loved this recipe! After I frosted the cake I put in the fridge to set up a bit.

text:
Really nice recipe. It works as is and it's nice if you tweak it a little too. With this cake, I like using all brown sugar, adding an extra tsp of cinnamon, 1/4 tsp of nutmeg and a little honey. I made these as cupcakes too; in the dark tins, they took ~ 20 mins, in aluminum (light) tins they took ~ 22, and in silicone ~ 24. Made 28 (1/4 cup when wet) cupcakes. This recipe is definitely worth a try.

This was absolutely wonderful! It was moist and tasted amazing. Even the frosting was great. I omitted the pecans and just added some chopped to the top for decoration. I cooked mine in two 9" round pans for 40 minutes. I also upped the cinnamon to 3 tsp and added 2 tsp allspice and 2 tsp nutmeg. text:
This recipe is super easy, and it turned out great. I've made it twice, and the second time I made some of my own changes. 

I added an extra teaspoon of vanilla to the batter and used gluten free flour. I think the gluten free flour made the cake stick to the pan less, and made it less dense. 

The frosting is much better with only 2 cups of confectioners sugar. It's lighter and fluffier.

text:
I followed the recipe exactly (because it has good reviews, meaning the recipe as written should be good). It bubbled over massively and I had to clean it up, yet it sunk in the middle. Every cake I've ever made has domed, never sunk.

40 minutes into "baking" I tested it, because the outside looked dark. It wasn't burnt, just caramelized and the center was literally liquid. After "baking," aside from the very center (which is the consistency of oil after 50 minutes in the oven), the rest of the cake is caramelized. The cake tastes like caramelized vegetable oil.

I used packed cups of carrots, 1/3rd cup crushed drained pineapple, 1/3rd cup raisins soaked in pineapple juice, 3/4th cup oil + 1/2 cup applesauce, 1cup brown sugar 1 cup white sugar. I used two round pans + a loaf pan for baking. My cake broke when I cooked it till just set in the center, but if I let it go for a bit longer, it does not break.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674161.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I have made this several times with great results. I used the changes in the "Most Helpful Positve Review". That would be:  using 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar 2) adding an extra teaspoon of vanilla extract 3) adding 1 8oz. can of crushed pineapple (I squeezed out most of the juice before adding it, I didn't want any extra fluids in the cake) 4) Added 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg 5) added 1 extra teaspoon of cinnamon 6) used 3/4 cup canola oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. 
For the frosting, I only used 3.5 cups of powdered sugar, and it was more than sweet enough, with a nicely balanced cream cheese vs. sweet flavor. I also omitted the pecans from the frosting. 
My husband said this is the best cake he has ever eaten.

text:
I have used the same carrot cake recipe for years.  I love it but it takes forever to bake.  So I thought I would give this one a try.  It was great! I did however make a few changes per the other reviews.  I am making a note of them and this will be my new carrot cake recipe.  I used 3 eggs not 4. I used 3/4 cup vegetable oil and 1/2 cup apple sauce.  I used one cup of white sugar and one cup of brown. 1/4 tsp salt. And I added 1 1/2 cup walnuts!  I think this recipe will make excellent muffins too!!  Thank you for the recipe and thank you for the reviews!  Allrecipes.com is Great!!!

text:
This was very delicious and moist. After reading pages of reviews, I made the following changes:
Used 5/6 cup (1/2 + 1/3) oil and 2/3 cup drained crushed pineapple in place of all the oil the recipe calls for. Increased cinnamon to 3 tsp. Used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar. Added 1/2 tsp nutmeg. Frosting: used 3 1/4 cup conf sugar. 
Baked 37 min. Perfect! Received many compliments. Will definitely make again.

text:
I have tried this recipe and it is the only carrot cake recipe I use. I made a few of my own changes.  Instead of pecans, I use walnuts, the taste combination is better to me.....although, pecans are good, I prefer walnuts.  I also grease and SUGAR and pan and NOT grease and FLOUR the pan.  Once cooled, I turn it out onto a platter so that the sugar coating is on the outside of the cake.  I make the frosting and pour it over the cake and spread it around.  PERFECT!!!

text:
I have made this recipe many times, both with and without nuts, and it is always delicious! I have come up a modified version that is lower in fat, but still retains all the deliciousness. It is even good without the frosting, but be warned, if you do make the frosting you won't be able to go back to the unfrosted version. Here are the modifications: 3 eggs instead of 4, 3/4 cup oil instead of 1.5, add 1/3 cup unsweetened applesauce, 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown instead of 2 cups white, 3 teaspoons cinnamon instead of 2, add 1/4 tsp nutmeg. I am working on perfecting a version for cooking in muffin cups...will post when I'm happy with it.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
Best Carrot Cake recipe!  This is a very versatile recipe too.  I only made it because I had leftover carrots and cream cheese frosting from the holidays.  I boiled a package of baby carrots in lightly sugared water until soft, then mashed.  I don't like nuts in my desserts so I omitted them and replaced with about a cup of golden raisins.  While I was measuring the dry ingredients I realized I didn't have baking powder so I replaced with 1/4ts baking soda (in addition to what it called for), 1/2ts cream of tartar and 1/4ts cornstarch.  Since I had some cream cheese frosting on hand, I didn't prepare the frosting called for in the recipe.  It turned out so incredibly tasty.  I will never make any other kind of carrot cake - ever!

text:
Came out sweet and moist. I did make a couple alterations, though.
(A) 
Substituted half the oil and half the sugar with about 1/2 to 3/4 cup of homemade applebutter. 
(B) 
Also, juiced carrots and used 3 cups of the "pulp" then added in enough juice to make a good cake batter consistency.


RESULT: Every time I walk into the firehouse for a visit, I am asked to bring more carrot cake. One of the very few things to-date to be requested again and the only one to be requested emphatically.

This is a good starter recipe. I've altered it to my own taste. I use 3/4 cup white and 3/4 cup brown sugar (I always reduce the sugar in my dessert recipes), used walnuts instead of pecans and added  1/2 cup raisins and a 1/4 cup carrot juice. I grated the carrots too.
The result is a delicious super moist carrot cake, that's just a bit healthier than the original.

This cake was AMAZING!  i did see how the it might be better to use the bigger slots for grating the carrots in stead of the smaller, it came out os very finely shredded cheese, BUT, i think it also helped my kids like it more because they couldn't really SEE the carrots. text:
Amazing cake. I used all of the changes listed in the first review (extra vanilla, extra cinnamon, crushed pineapple, apple sauce + oil, 1 cup brown, 1 cup white sugar, etc). It turned out perfectly. The only thing I would say is that the icing is very sweet. I would almost cut some of the sugar next time I make it, but the cake itself is perfect sweetness, almost not sweet. I baked it for about 42 minutes and it was perfectly moist. I didn't put pecans in the icing, I just sprinkled some on top of the cake after icing it. Great recipe!

PHENOMENAL!!!!  my first attempt at homemade carrot cake, and it was amazing.  for some reason this was one type of cake i've never made, and decided to give it a go for easter.  i made two 8" sqaures and layered them, and instead of mixing the nuts into the frosting, i pressed them into the sides of the cake once frosted.  very moist, flavorful, and delicious!

text:
Excellent, excellent!  I've always shied away from making from-scratch cakes, because I've had trouble getting them to taste right or to be moist enough.  But this cake was wonderful.  (I didn't make the icing, so I can't speak to that.)  In the interest of lowering the fat content, I reduced the oil a little and adding some applesauce and crushed pineapple.  The cake came out plenty moist and rich, so I might be a little bolder in replacing some of the oil with applesauce next time.  The pineapple was yummy, but I may try it without next time--just depends on what you're in the mood for.  I made a layer cake with 9-inch round pans and baked them for 40 minutes at 350.

city:

country:
None
text:
This carrot cake was wonderful.  I made some changes based on personal preference and the other review- no pecans, 1/2 cup applesauce & 3/4 cup oil instead of all oil, 1 cup white & 1 cup dark brown sugar, added 1/4 t each - nutmeg, allspice & cloves.  I baked it in a 8in springform pan for about 60 minutes.  It was quite the hit.  I have never made a cake from scratch, this will definitely be my go-to carrot cake though I think I will look for a different frosting recipe but there was nothing wrong with this one.  For the reviewers complaining about the changes people make-  Cooking is an art, not an carbon copy of someone else's creation.  I, personally, enjoy reading reviews by others for inspiration.  Even without the changes I made to this recipe it would have been great.

None
text:
I'm giving it only 4 stars as I have never ate or made a carrot cake before and I didn't use the cream cheese frosting recipe listed, as I already have a good recipe for that. :)  As for the cake (which I made late last night) I only upped the vanilla to 1TBSP (I like lots of vanilla in my baked goods) and with a lot of reviews stating that they spiced it up a little, I also added 1/8 tsp nutmeg.  I make a very spiced pumpkin cake,bread,bar, cookie recipe that is a big hit here and even though a lot of reviews stated adding more spice I want to keep this close to the original recipe and tasted the batter before adding it and felt it just needed a LITTLE more spice.  :)  I also left out the nuts in the cake part and sub pecans for walnuts that I placed onto the sides of the frosted cake (hubby ate all the pecans).  My recently turned 4yr old said she wanted it for her next birthday cake, until she got to the edge with the nuts.  LOL.  Over all  with my slight changes it is a great tasting cake. :)  Thanks for sharing!

Display Name:

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674156.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was my first attempt at carrot cake. I no longer need to search for the perfect recipe because this is it!! If you like dense, moist cake, this is the recipe for you. I only made some very minor changes after reading other reviews. I used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar as suggested and I added an extra 1/2 tsp cinnamon and 1/4 tsp nutmeg. I also only used 1/2 cup oil and 3/4 cup applesauce. I really think this is what helped make it so moist and yummy (and less calories and fat!!). I made it the night before and frosted it and covered it and stored it in the fridge till the next evening. Pulled it out an hour before serving and it was FABULOUS!! Rave reviews from all . . .even my picky kids! Will definitely make this one again!

text:
Carrot cake was a special request by my husband for his birthday. I am NOT domestic and am terrified when special requests come my way! Luckily baking is my stronger suit. I followed another members suggestions to combine all of the other tweaks (except for adding pineapple) and made my own tweak to the icing. I doubled the recipe since I was making a double layer round cake. My recipe was; 1 cup butter, 16 oz cream cheese, 16 oz light sour cream, 2/3 cup confectioners sugar, blend. My husband usually doesn't like cake due to the overly sweet icing. THIS WAS PERFECT!! Very cream cheesy! He love love loved it!

Almost every thing I bake is a flop...just don't have that 'thing' some women have and figured I was doomed to have rotten desserts!  BUT, I JUST made this cake and LOVED IT!!  Yay! There IS hope :)

Normally, i hate when people rate a recipe with so many changes that it's a completely different recipe. Can't wait until my husband gets home from work...he won't believe that i actually made a yummy dessert ;)

oh, one thing...next time i WILL lower pecan count.  little too nutty.

text:
Thank you for a great recipe! Sorry about the rating with a lot of changes, but they were successful, so I wanted to let others know. I needed to have my (carrot) cake, and eat it, too! I cut the oil in half and added 3/4 c crush pinapplee, drained. I reduced the sugar to 1 1/2 cups, and I used "white" whole wheat flour. Added a little fresh nutmeg and walnuts, might do raisins next time. Added a couple of minutes to the bake time and it was still moist. This was great by itself, and w/crean cheese frosting. Everyone loved it!

text:
My first attempt at carrot cake and it turned out great. I used the suggested alterations from gneebeanie and skipped the nuts. I could see where the pineapple added great flavor, but for those who do not like this idea, it's okay to omit. The nutmeg and additional cinnamon are essential. The next time I make this, and I will, I may double the nutmeg to 1/4 tsp and cinnamon to 4 tsp. Instead of grating carrots, the food processor made quick work without the mush other reviewers mentioned. Excellent cake!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I am making this cake for the second time, it was soooo good the first time.

I took recommendations and replaced half the oil for apple sauce.  I also subbed in 1/2 cup whole wheat plus 1 and 1/2 cup all purpose flour.  I also added 1/2 teaspoon ginger and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg.

I have added an additional cup of carrots before and it came out perfectly.  I have a feeling the quantity of carrots is flexible.  I put the batter into 2-9 inch rounds for 45 mins.

I doubled the cream cheese frosting but halved the amour of icing sugar.  When I made the cake the first time, there wasnt enough frosting for the 4 layers, top and sides.  It was skimpy ;). And I like a fair amount of cream cheese frosting, and my carrot cake tall and layered!

This recipe is a keeper, and is flexible to any persons taste.  Was glad to find a recipe without pineapple, but flexible on the nuts and raisins.  Right now, our toddler is in an anti texture mood.  This cake fits the bill!

text:
Absolutely delicious! My 4 year old asked me to make a carrot cake for Easter. I never made one before so I took a chance on this recipe. A real winner!  Everyone loved it!  Some changes made:  used 3/4 cup of canola oil and 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce, 1 cup AP flour and 1 cup white whole wheat flour plus added about 1 cup of sweetened flaked coconut.  For the frosting I used neufchatel cream cheese for less fat and omitted the pecans. I also added about 1/3 cup of ground flax seed.  Next time I'll try using a little more applesauce and a little less oil and all white whole wheat flour.  Thanks for such a great recipe!  Now I can sneak carrots into my carrot hating 6 year old's muffins ;)

text:
This was the perfect carrot cake recipe, but instead of making a whole cake, I halved the recipe and still was able to make 13 normal sized cupcakes. I have to praise this recipe for being easy and simple... and of course delicious! The only changes I made was leaving out the pecans (I'm not a nut lover) and adding a dash of nutmeg. I baked the cupcakes for a little less than 40 minutes and they turned out nice and slightly moist, which was perfect. To frost the cupcakes, I used the recipe "cream cheese frosting II" instead. This was a great recipe for a delicious carrot cake!

text:
Delicious and very moist! I omitted the pecans and used 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar. I made them into 24 cupcakes, but I slightly overfilled the muffin cups. They overflowed while baking and later sunk in the middle, but were still delicious. Next time I will soak up all the carrot juice before throwing them in the batter! I covered the tops with icing and green flaked coconut (for Easter) and everyone loved them! If you make cupcakes with this recipe, only fill the muffin cups 2/3 full and you should get at least 26 cupcakes.

Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2011-03-01T12:25:01.13
helpfulCount:
1
userID:
4565736
Display Name:
BitchinKitchen
isPro:
False
followersCount:
0
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
4
favoritesCount:
37
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/350750.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent recipe I have used several times now I believe it is almost fool-proof. I let the carrots soak in the vegetable oil with all the seasonings while I get everything ready. In addition to 2Tbsp vanilla extract I added a Tbsp of butter extract, I have tried maple extract but found it too overpowering. I also add 2Tblsp of 5-spice seasoning, a tsp of nutmeg as well as a tsp of ginger (neither were in the 5-spice blend sometimes they are) and an additional tsp of cinnamon. I often incorporate raisins or diced dried pineapple along with the nuts and butterscotch chips also work very well in this cake. The dry ingredients I keep the same as the recipe calls for this last time I did add a regular box of instant vanilla pudding just to see the difference but to be honest unless your cake tends to dry out quickly I don't think it will be around long after its done. It did make it a bit more moist and I would only add it again if not making layers I think it was harder to get them out of the pans. Everyone who I have made this cake for agrees it is one of the best they've had. I think the original recipe has a great foundation but the spices really add the gusto. Also not all carrots are created equal - the nice big restaurant quality ones have the most flavor, others tend to have very little taste or even a musty one so be choosy, many people think they will use their 'old' carrots to make this cake and it just isn't always a good idea. Fresh ones are best. Good Luck!

text:
Amazing recipe!!! Moist, great after taste and easy to play around with. I subbed 1/4 cup of applesauce from the oil and subbed 1 cup whole wheat flour for the flour in the recipe. I also used a egg replacer and it worked like a charm and subbed 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar. Excellent recipe!!!

That was some good cake! Brought it to my mom's 60th birthday party and it disappeared! text:
O.M.G.! Best carrot cake ever!!!!  I've made like 3 times soo far.. its delicious! Everyone loves it and asks for the recipe. The cake is moist and hardy. The frosting and sweet and creamy. YUM!  Except i do make a few adjustments.. I add coconut flakes, walnuts, pineapple chunks into the batter and 1/4 C. of pineapple juice from the can I used the chunks from.  For the frosting, I add a teaspoon or so of coconut extract. its delicious! When the cake is baking, i put the frosting in the fridge, until the cake is done baking and fully cooled... then the frosting will be nice and stiffened.. a dream to frost! To finish it all up... I decorate all w/ coconut flakes & cut up pineapple chunks! This is totally a cake I advise everyone to make, a favorite in my opinion! Thanks so much Tammy for the cake recipe! :)

Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2010-11-07T13:51:40.36
helpfulCount:
1
userID:
931633
Display Name:
MARYSUNSHINE1
isPro:
False
followersCount:
23
followingCount:
0
madeRecipesCount:
232
favoritesCount:
1299
recipesCount:
0
reviewsCount:
0
photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/265233.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Excellent! The first few times I made this my layer cakes were perfect. When I made cupcakes, they kept sinking in the middle. I was so frustrated I quit making them for several months. Not finding another recipe to match this one in taste, I was determined to figure this out. This time I did everything perfectly, preheating the oven extra early, bringing the eggs to room temp, and using my stand mixer for the eggs, sugar, oil and vanilla. The rest of the mixing I did with a wooden spoon, being careful to not over mix and in fact, I added the carrots and nuts before I had all of the flour mixed in.By the time I had them mixed in, so was the flour. I also filled my paper liners 1/2 full and no more.  I use the match stix cut carrots in the little bags instead of grated carrots. I chop them very small and I think it makes a difference in the taste & texture because I think the grated can get sort of lost. The main difference I made was checking the container of baking powder. Although it wasn't due to expire for several months, I still decided to pitch it and open the new can. Thanks Tammy for the best carrot cake ever!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I loved this recipe! It was easy to follow and easy to personalize. I followed some of the suggestions here (I did 1 cup white sugar and 1 part brown sugar, I also added 1/4 tsp nutmeg and an extra tsp of vanilla extract). The cake turned out so moist and tasty, and it was just the nice balance of sweet and spice. I omitted the nuts.  As for the frosting, I thinking that even three cups of the confectioner's sugar is too much. Next time, I'll cut it down to 2 1/4 - 2 1/2 cups. I cut the sweetness by folding in 3 tsp of calamansi juice. (It's a citrus fruit that's a cross between a lime and a tangerine that's very prevalent in Southeast Asian cooking - particularly with Filipino cuisine) The addition of the citrus flavor worked marvelously in cutting the sweetness and introducing notes of lightness and freshness in a very rich and thick frosting.   Thank you for sharing this recipe. :)

text:
I made these for my husband's birthday and they were so good I had to make them again the next week. I subbed cinnamon apple sauce for 1/2c of oil and one cup each of white and brown sugar. I also added a few gratings of nutmeg. I made these into cupcakes. When I filled the muffin tins 1/2 full these cooked in about 12-15 minutes. I accidentally overfilled some and they turned out like big muffins after cooking about 18 minutes. I made these with my oven at 325 (I think my oven may run hot so I automatically turn it down a little when baking anything). My husband and all of his family loved them. The cream cheese frosting is excellent. This is one to keep on hand for sure.

text:
I used this recipe to make my first ever carrot cake. I changed very little about it, just split the sugar 1/2 brown and white instead of just white. I also grated the carrots instead of shredding them, other reviewers said if you do grate them the cake would come out too moist so I just squeezed thejuice out of the grated carrot and it came out wonderful...definitly competes with bakery carrot cake. The icing however was just a little too sweet so I will cut the powdered sugar to 2 cups next time. I also sprinkled finely chopped walnuts on top instead of mixing them in. I'm going to make them into muffins next. My family loved it! So yummy!

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was great, but I of course made it my own by doing the following: 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup light brown sugar, added 1/4 tsp nutmeg, added an extra 1/2 tsp cinnamon, and used 3/4 cup unsweetened applesauce with 1/2 cup oil. I also made a cream cheese glaze as follows: 4 oz cream cheese, 3/4 cup confectioners sugar, 1 tsp finely grated lemon zest, and a little bit of water to make it into a glaze-like consistency. It was very good, and I will definitely be making it again.

country:
None
text:
Simply the BEST carrot cake recipe you will ever find. I did some modifications based on other reviews: 1) I used applesauce for a portion of the fat, 2) I used a small can of drained, crushed pineapple. I couldn't find my 9" rounds, so I cooked this in a 9x13" pan and when it was cooled I took the cake out of the pan, frosted it with the cream cheese frosting and covered the sides with chopped pecans. I took this to a luncheon my grandma and her friends invited me to and many of the ladies told me it was not only the best dessert there, but the best carrot cake they had ever had! That is quite a compliment from a room full of experienced cooks and bakers. This recipe is a a guaranteed success if you know what you are doing!

text:
This is a wonderful moist cake, I only added 1 more tsp of vanilla and put 3/4 oil and 1/2 applesauce and added 1/2 tsp nutmeg. I used walnuts (1 cup), coconut (1 cup), and Rasins (3/4 cup).  I was so good next time I will try it without coconut and use your recommended pecans!! I baked in a 9x13 pan carrots were finely grated and drained very well.  After 43 minutes in the oven, I put it straight in the freezer for 20-30min to make moist. This is the only recipe I have gave five stars.  We all may make a few changes to it but the Base of the recipe is YOURS! and without it, my cake would not have been this great!  Thank you

text:
A very good and very easy recipe! I made this for my fiance who is diabetic but loves carrot cake. To cut down on the carbs, I reduced the sugar in the frosting by half by substituting Splenda for confectioners sugar.  I knew this would give the frosting a different texture since it is not as fine of a granule as confectioners sugar.  To disguise this, I added 1/2 C of shredded coconut to the frosting and it was wonderful! I will definitely make this again.

text:
I prepared this recipe as written, and I found it to be mediocre.  It wasn't bad, but it lacked a certain punch.  I definitely think it needs more spices.  I also found that it was very oily.  It leaves visible smears of oil on the plate.    The icing was very tasty, although I'd recommend using an electric mixer when preparing it.  I tried to whip it by hand at first, and it was kind of lumpy.  It smooths out very well when using an electric mixer, and I like that even when it's been refrigerated, it is still soft enough to spread.

userID:
4385869
Display Name:
Bakeswithluv

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674136.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this as a birthday cake for a friend who loves carrot cake and she thought it was great! The recipe is the perfect amount for two 9 inch rounds for a layered cake. I made the recipe as is except for just a couple minor tweaks: To cut down on fat, I halved the oil with applesauce and used half brown sugar and half white. I left the pecans out because I wasn't sure if my friend liked nuts in the cake and the flavor was very nice even without them! I ended up just rimming the cake with the pecans as I've seen many others do, but after tasting the combination with the nuts, I will be definitely adding them to the batter next time. So good!  The frosting recipe is great, but I cut back on the sugar by a cup just because I prefer it a little less sweet. Also, if you like a thicker frosting I would suggest doubling the recipe, which is what I plan to do next time. It was so delicious!  Also, my cakes were done after about 20 min. of baking, so make sure to keep an eye on it and don't let it overbake! Overall, this was a wonderful recipe and I plan on making another with the ingredients I have left over soon! Thanks so much for sharing!

text:
This is the best carrot cake. My grandpa's favorite dessert is carrot cake and he has had his share but he says this is his favorite by far. I also took this to a bake sell, selling per slice and all I got was raves and it was the first to go. I did use a lot of suggestions that other people posted. Instead of all of the oil I used 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup unsweetened apple sauce. 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar. 1/4 tea nutmeg, and 1/2 cup raisins. For the frosting I used 1 less cup of sugar and usually doubled the recipe so I could have lots of frosting and a layer in between the two cakes. Yummy!!

text:
I have made this carrot cake on many occasions now, and every time I literally have people with their mouth full going, "Oh my god, this is amazing!" After taking all the credit, I smile inside thinking how EASY this recipe is.  Everyone else on here seems to alter so many things. I grate my carrot on the small side of the grater and I don't change the sugar. I only add more vanilla (because I love it) and I always leave out of the nuts. The cake comes out moist and beautiful every time.   I have also made these into cupcakes - rave reviews from my boyfriend and roommate (it's his number one baking request).  Of course, If you want to be healthy, alter it. But if you don't eat it every day, just keep it the same and you won't be disappointed!

text:
The only thing I did different than what the recipie dictated (based on several other reviews) was to use a combo of brown sugar and white sugar.  However, I did not use 2 cups total.  I used about 3/4 cup of white and 3/4 cups of brown.  Next time I will try even less as it was sweet enough for my family even with this reduction.  I gave 4 stars and not 5 because of the frosting.  It is just okay.  The cake recipie is wonderful and can easily be eaten without the frosting for a bread/muffin like cake.  The frosting is just way too sweet, plus it does not taste like the frosting on carrot cake should.  I am not an expert so I am not sure what it is missing, but it is just not quite right.  Beware, the measurements called for in the frosting make A LOT of frosting.  I only needed about half of what I made.

text:
Super moist, tasty cake! Here's my trick for 'grating' all those carrots - peel and chop the carrots in chunks. Put a third of the carrots in the blender and cover with water about 2 inches above the carrots -- then blend until the carrots are finely chopped. Pour into a fine sieve and drain well. Repeat until all the carrots are done. Voila.

country:
None
text:
This is really good. My first time making carrot cake.  Few things though.  I'm not sure why it's just me but I was beating my frosting for a while and nothing was going on other than large chunks even though everything was room temp so I added a bit of milk to make it spreadable.  Worked immediately so I'll do the same next time.  I also added walnuts instead of pecans (personal preference) but I only used it in the batter because I agree that nuts in the frosting is strange.  I do think the nuts add a nice addition to the cake itself.  Last thing, I'm not trying to rain on anyone's parade but substituting applesauce/pineapple instead of oil, yes you are decreasing the fat but you're increasing the sugar on an already sugary cake so it's not exactly a healthy tradeoff.  If you want healthy, skip the cake ;)

text:
This carrot cake was AMAZING! I made it with a few modifications at the suggestion of other reviewers (I used 3/4 c. oil and 1/2 c. chunky applesauce; 1c. brown sugar and 1 c. white sugar, added extra vanilla, nutmeg, and cinnamon; and added a can of crushed pineapple to keep it moist) and folded 3/4 c. raisins into the mixture. I also used neufchatel cheese instead of cream cheese for the frosting to cut a few of the calories (not many :)).   It was PHENOMENAL. Everyone who tried it loved it (even my picky friend who hates carrot cake admitted it wasn't bad), and several people told me it was the best carrot cake they had ever had. DEFINITELY going to make this one again!

I looked for this recipe because of my bf's request. The first time I followed everything that mentioned, except the vegetable oil. I added too little oil by mistake and the cake turned out a bit dry. No surprise, hah! The second time I added exact amount of oil as the recipe called for. All of my family and friends didn't like it at all. It was too oily and tasteless. They preferred the first one if I could make it a bit moister. So the third time I added 1/8 cup or 30 ml of oil. Guess what?! It turned out perfect!

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674134.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Absolutely delicious carrot cake!  I made carrot cake muffins/cupcakes at 350 degrees F for 18-20 minutes.  I also followed some suggestions made by some reviewers: used 3/4 C veg oil, 1/2 C unsweetened apple sauce (instead of the 1 1/4 veg oil); used 1 cup white and 1 cup brown sugar (instead of 2 cup white), 3 tsp vanilla, 3 tsp ground cinnamon, and added  approx 1/4 tsp nutmeg, allspice and ground cloves.  So delicious and moist!  My family and I are not big on cream cheese tasting frosting but made the frosting as is in the recipe except using 3.5 cups confectioner sugar.  The frosting tasted better the second day as the cream cheese taste dulled a bit in the fridge.  if you make cupcakes/muffins, use cupcake liners for an absolute easy clean up!  So yummy and delicious - will definately make again and again.

AERISH

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674146.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Oh. My. God.  This is heavenly.  Carrot cake is my favourite kind of cake, but here's how I changed it a bit: I did as others suggested and used half white and half brown sugar and used more spice, increasing the cinnamon by only 1/2 a tsp, then added 1 tsp of allspice and 1/2 tsp of nutmeg.  I also cut the oil down to 1 cup, and used a big more carrot.  I didn't add any extra fluid, though.  I had to substitute walnuts for pecans, but I roasted them first to bring out more flavour.  Finally, I made a much simpler cream cheese frosting: mix 200g cream cheese with 1 1/4 cup icing sugar and add some vanilla. et voila, perfect icing!  I don't like butter in my cream cheese icing :)  It's plenty sweet with tons of the cream cheese flavour this way.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614254.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the BEST carrot cake recipe ever!! I'm a novice baker and it has turned out perfectly for me twice now. I will always use this recipe for carrot cake - it's always a HUGE hit! Just a couple of things that I found I liked. I leave OUT the chopped pecans from the cake and leave them IN the frosting. YUM! I also have used 3/4 c. vegetable oil and 1/2 c. applesauce to make it have a little less fat and I couldn't tell any difference. Both times I used 1 c. white sugar and 1 c. brown (rather than 2 c. white) for the "spice cake" sort of taste and added 1/2 tsp. nutmeg. The first time I tried 1/2 all-purpose flour and 1/2 whole wheat flour. It turned out just fine, but I liked the flavor a little better with only all-purpose flour. Also - my oven cooked it completely in 35 minutes, so check it early or it may overcook! Highly recommed!

None
text:
This is an absolutely amazing recipe! However, I did make a few adjustments. I only used 200g of brown sugar for the cake and about 180g of icing (confectioner's) sugar for the icing. I only added about 40g of butter to the icing, which I felt was more than enough (115g was excessive in my opinion). I also added one more teaspoon of vanilla essence to the cake, as well as some chopped (and squeezed of the excess juice) canned pineapple. Delightfully moist and super delicious! The cream cheese icing contrasts beautifully with the best Carrot Cake I've ever tasted! 5 stars for sure!

text:
I made this for my husband's birthday cake. He always asks for carrot cake.  Everyone loved it!  I substituted half the white sugar for brown sugar, added a little pumpkin pie spice, and added one can of crushed pineapple (squeezed out the juice).  It was so moist!  Please note that you should really make sure the cake is cooked in the centre before you remove it from the oven.  I had to bake mine for an hour before it was completely set... but still very moist!  Also, this is way too much frosting... I froze some (it's too good to throw away).

text:
I have made this cake several times.   It has been a hit everytime.  If you are making this cake for the first time, I recommend that you don't change any of the cake measurements, but that you gradually add the confectioners sugar to the frosting mixture to get the right level of sweetness for you.  I did this the 2nd time I made the cake and found that 2 1/2 cups of confectioners sugar gave me the perfect amount of sweetness to pair with the cake.

text:
Ok, so this recipe came out good. I made a lot of alterations though to cut down on fat and calories. 1. Replace eggs with distilled white vinegar, one tbsp for each egg so 4 tbsp total. 2. Replce oil completely with unsweetened applesauce, equal conversion. 3. Cut sugar in half, and used brown instead of white. Even though applesauce is unsweetened it adds enough sweet taste. Other reviews helpful with a lil more vanilla and touch of nutmeg. I also tossed in raisins 'cuz, well I'm jsut used to that in carrot cake. Also, a little bit of water (less than 1/3 cup) was added. Cake came out very nice!! Didn't get around to doing with frosting yet.

text:
My recipe is the same, except it has:   1 8-oz. can crushed pineapple, drained, and    1 1/3 cup toasted coconut. These add extra texture and interest, if you like coconut and pineapple.  Drain the pineapple really well if you use it.  I make it in 3 8" layer pans and decorate with orange and green cream cheese carrots.  I tint some of the frosting and squeeze it out of a Ziploc.  Makes a nice cake for company.

After saving this to my recipe box I FINALLY made it about a year later! I was a bit scared as I had never made carrot cake before but it was actually easy. I didn't have a grater so I just used carrot peels and cut them smaller. If I make again I think it would be better as a layer cake so you get more of the frosting in each bite. I also would skip the pecans in the frosting..I love pecans but it was a bit too much crunch for me. Great recipe!

text:
I love this recipe and have even added unsweetened coconut to the batter (have not perfected this, the extra moisture needs to be adjusted for).  I took several of the pieces of advice given below and incorporated them in.  Instead of 2 cups white sugar, I use one cup brown sugar and one cup white sugar, I also add 1 tsp Vanilla, 1/4 tsp Nutmeg and 1 tsp Cinnamon...and sometimes a bit of ginger.  I don't add the pecans and I always drain the carrots (squish them) well.

city:

country:
None
text:
I'm would have given it a five for taste, but i knocked a star off because it's so hard to work with. I can't believe i'm the only one who had trouble with this recipe.   i had to make this twice because the first batch collapsed. i baked it last night in two 8 inch rounds at 350 for 50 minutes, the toothpick came out clean, i let it cool for half hour and when i came back in the kitchen to make the frosting, they had completely collapsed in the middle. the cake was not even close to being done. My oven is true to temp, and i bake all the time so i was baffled.   i wouldn't have wasted my time making it again, but i tasted a chunk from around the edge and it was so good i had to. I was making it for a birthday today so i made it again this afternoon. i baked them for 60 minutes and they were still not quite done so i turned the oven off and left them alone for two hours.   I pulled them out of the oven and let them cool for 20 minutes and then ran a knife around the edge before turning them out. the first round broke in half and stuck to the bottom of the pan. i was more careful with the second one and it came out better, but it was still mangled, which only made it harder to frost. This cake is like a brick it's so heavy.   but it is delicious!

None
text:
Made this cake for my son's first birthday as I wanted to try this recipe for a long time.  I followed people's recommendations (1 c brown and 1 c white sugar, more vanilla, added crushed pineapple, added nutmeg, more cinnamon, used applesauce to decrease the amount of oil, and cut the icing sugar to 3 cups).  Baked the cake in two 9 inch pans for ~35 minutes.  The cake was delicious!  So moist and flavorful.  My husband said it was the best carrot cake he's ever had and my relatives all thought it was very good.  I would definitely make this again.

text:
This is a great, fluffy, and flavorful carrot cake.  Everyone that's tried this loves it and asks for seconds (or thirds).  I sub 3/4 of the oil with a peeled, grated apple.  I've never tried the frosting. I use 1 8-oz block of cream cheese, 1/2 stick of butter and about a 1/2 t. vanilla extract, beaten until very light and fluffy.  Then I add powdered sugar until I get the consistency and sweetness that I like.  Thanks for such an amazing recipe!

text:
this cake is really superb,made if for my friend's birthday.like it so much.i made some changes as well..my friend doesn't really like sweet cakes,so i use 3/4 cups of packed brown sugar and 1/2 cups of sugar.secondly,i followed the reviews by substituting the oil with apple sauce,1/2 cup of non sweetened apple sauce and 3/4 cups of vegetable oil.third,i uses walnuts in the cake instead of pecans.baked it in 13x9 inch tray or two 9 inch spring form pan.still taste very good!the last changes was on the  on the frosting.i used 16 ounces of cream cheese,3/4 cup of icing sugar,1/2 cup of butter and 1 teaspoon of lemon extract.beat the cream cheese until soft and fluffy.spread it over the cake.the cake taste better after chill.

text:
I used unbleached WHOLE WHEAT FLOUR to up the nutritional value and it still came out fantastic.  I like more of a cream cheese flavor in my frosting so I used only 1 1/2 cup of confectioners sugar with the 8 oz. of cream cheese, and the 1/2 cup whipped butter. I too followed suit with 1/2 cup applesauce with 3/4 cup canola oil, 3 teaspoons vanilla, 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg. Added 1/2 cup of raisins and 3/4 cup walnuts instead of pecans. YUM.

text:
This is a GREAT carrot cake!  I made this for a co-workers birthday and he (and everybody else) is on their 2nd or 3rd piece.  He had never heard of putting crushed pineapple or coconut into a carrot cake, so here I went on search of a new recipe - thanks to everybody who raved about this one because it convinced me to try it.  I made it as the recipe stated and wouldn't change a darn thing!

text:
This is an awesome carrot cake. The first time I made it this week I didn't have any applesauce in the house so I used a cup of the oil and it was plenty, there isn't any need for that amount of oil. I didn't use nuts only because I just don't like nuts mixed in food. I did follow the suggestion of 1/2 brown sugar and added a touch more cinnamon, yummy, my family ate the entire cake in two days and bugged me to make it again. I did it this time with applesauce and my picky DH didn't even notice. Also the first time the centers dropped, I used 2 9", this time I beat it less and I think without the oil helped, it came out beautiful the second time. This is a keeper and my 3 y/o asked if I can make it for his birthday cake in a few weeks, how darn cute is that. Thank you for the great recipe!

I made this for Easter and was very happy with the recipe. I used half white and half brown sugar and replaced 1/4 cup of oil with unsweetened applesauce. text:
I used half white flour and half whole wheat....awesome!!  Used 3/4 c. white sugar and 1 c. brown sugar, because I knew the frosting would make it sweet enough.  1/2 c. oil and 3/4 c. milk. More spices. No nuts, it was for a birthday, and I didn't know who could eat nuts, so I just topped the frosted cake with chopped walnuts.   For the frosting: 1/4 c. butter, 4 oz. cream cheese, about 3 c. powdered sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla, and a bit of milk as needed to make up for the lower amount of butter and cream cheese.

country:
None
text:
This cake was easy to make and the result tasted marvelous. I received many compliments, in fact most people thought I had bought, not made this delicious dessert. I highly recommend this recipe!  I took special care in decorating this since it was the centerpiece for a big dinner I was hosting:  I made a double-layer carrot cake with circular pans with this recipe. I made a little extra icing for between the layers and the decorations on top, but I discovered that the original amount probably would have been enough.  Instead of mixing all the leftover pecans into the icing, I mixed a few into the icing, sprinkled a few in the center of the top of the cake, and pressed the remainder into the sides of the cake.  I then used the technique illustrated in a video on here how to create carrots out of icing to decorate the top.

country:
None
text:
Delicious and a bit hit with everyone who tried it.  I did make some of the same changes others made:  (1) Only 3/4 cup oil (2) Added 1/2 cup applesauce (3) Only 1 cup white sugar (4) Added 1 cup brown sugar (5) Increased vanilla to 3 tsp (6) Increased cinnamon to 3 tsp (7) added 1/4 tsp nutmeg (8) Added 8 oz crushed pineapple with the juice squeezed out.  Finally, I used the "Cream Cheese Frosting II" recipe from this site.  I baked in 2 9-inch round pans for 40 minutes.

text:
FABULOUS!!!!Only one thing would make this better-1 cup of golden raisins! I used post of gneebeanie (who read all reviews-thanks!) I made these for Easter dinner this year. Can't wait to see how my grown up children will like these. (I dont expect grandkids will like them because of nus!) But so far my husband and I cant stop eating them!So I will post what I did:  First I made cupcakes-recipe makes 3 1/2 dozen, And I cooked them at 350 for 20 minutes. Fill cups 2/3 full  Ingredients:  4 eggs 3/4 c canola oil 1/2 c apple sauce 1 c brown sugar 1c white sugar 3t. vanilla extract 2 cups flour 2t. baking soda 2t. baking powder 1/2 t salt 3t. ground cinnamon 8 oz. crushed pineapple(drain well) 24 oz. grated baby carrots 1 c. chopped pecans  Frosting 1/2 c softened butter 8 oz cream cheese, softened 1t vanilla extract  I did not use pecans in frosting but instead put a 1/2 walnut on top of each cupcake for decoration. 3 1/2 c powdered sugar

text:
Great cake, really hit the spot and was easy to make.  My center fell, too, but I didn't care.  I just filled it in with more frosting!

Update: I found an almost identical recipe that calls for a cup each of white and brown sugar  (also an extra teaspoon of cinnamon, and 1/4th teaspoon nutmeg).  I think the brown sugar really improved the texture of the cake and I'll be making it that way from now on.  Also, the other recipe only called for two cups confectioners sugar in the frosting and it was perfect--this from a sugar freak.

city:

region:

country:
None
text:
This is a 5 star recipe with adjustments.  I rated it 4 since it would have been too sweet if I had followed the recipe as is.  I made the following modifications: 1) substituted most of the vegetable oil with unsweetened applesauce  2) halved the sugar in both the cake and the frosting as I don't like cakes which are too sweet 3) used a 50/50 mix of brown sugar and white sugar 4) used a 50/50 mix of white flour and whole wheat flour 5) increased the cinnamon by 50% 6) added some nutmeg 7) added raisins along with the pecans  After the modifications, this was one of the best cakes I have made.  My kids were asking me to make it again after eating it for the first time.  I did not add pecans to the frosting since I thought that the pecans in the cake were enough.  I am glad I made that change.

text:
This carrot cake is absolutely delicious! I followed some other reviewers tips and used 1 cup white and 1 cup brown sugar.  I added an extra teaspoon of cinnamon, and a half teaspoon of ground ginger. I left the nuts out of the batter, but sprinkled some on top of the frosted cake. I baked the cake in 2 9in cake pans. They did sink in the middle, but I 1 1/2x the frosting recipe and gooped it into the middle of the cake. I LOVE cream cheese frosting, so the extra in the middle was a total bonus.
