I made it once and followed the revisions. I used less sugar and apple sauce. It turned out horrible. Tasted fully like salt. This time I only changed a few things .I used sunflower oil. Ran out and only had 3/4 cup if oil, so added 2 heaping tbsp of butter. Added extra tsp of vanilla(love vanilla!) Extra tsp of cinnamon and 1/4 tspnutmeg and 1/2 cloves I love it spicy too. So this time I tasted my batter and could still detect a hint of salt. Added 2 heaping tbps of honey at the end. No pecans don't like them. Made muffins they cooked in 17 minutes dark brown the result was very moist but extremely fluffy. Fluffy rich goodness. Omg.  Cream cheese icing with melted white choclate to follow. Merry Christmas

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Prefer bread-like vegetable goods (think loaf over cake- loaves are usually richer). Substituted equal parts ground cloves and allspice for cinnamon. Used Bob's Red Mill 100% Stone Ground Whole Wheat Flour. Used 0.75 tsp salt (Himalayan rock salt, unbleached, kosher, uniodized, because I did not want anti-caking agents in the dough). Halved white sugar content, compensated with 0.5 cp Dark Muscovado sugar. Excluded nuts. Mixed baking soda and powder as instructed. Quickly added 2 tsp Cream of Tartar right  before baking. Mixed by folding batter. Resulted in darker brown cake with evenly distributed carrots and sweet slightly sticky top  in loaf, cake, muffin, and mini-muffin forms. Omitted butter from frosting and substituted with 2 tbs 2% milk.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:
2015-12-15T13:58:16.047

country:
None
text:
I made this for me fiancés birthday and received so many compliments! Everyone told me it was the best carrot cake they've ever had by a long shot. I made a few modifications based on reviews: 1) 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup white sugar 2) an extra teaspoon vanilla 3) one can crushed pineapple 4) 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg 5) 1 extra teaspoon of cinnamon 5) 1/2 cup coconut. 
It made two 9" rounds and 4 small heart shaped pans. I will never buy another carrot cake again!

text:
I've just made this today. I had reduced the recipe to serve 5. I didn't want to make a whole cake as it was only for me and the Husband. Flavour wise was wonderful, I had added other spices on my own to my liking and substituted apple sauce for oil as I didn't have any flavourless oil on hand. The cake baked perfectly, rose well in the middle and cake tester came out clean. However, the cake began to sink as it cooled. When I cut into it, it was kinda gummy in the middle.

I'm still going to have it for breakfast tomorrow though. Not going to waste food. But any ideas why it sank while cooling? I love the flavour of the cake and how easy it was to make. Would make it again if I know what to look out for to avoid another sinking cake. 

Thank for the recipe!

None
text:
Will definitely make this again! Delicious and easy! I did one thing different: 1 cup sugar and 1 cup brown sugar. Brown sugar is necessary in good carrot cake which is why I added it regardless of the reviews. I think extra cinnamon and added nutmeg is a matter of personal taste but I didn't  add any extra cinnamon or nutmeg my first time around. Absolutely wonderful carrot cake. I HIGHLY recommend making this 1 or 2 days prior to serving because I swear this cake gets better as it sits (in the fridge).  I also trimmed the edges of the cake rounds because they were more stiff than the rest of the cake. I iced just the tops of the cakes and let the icing drip down...very pretty.

text:
I turned this into a bundt cake 50 min bake time.  I'm Southern so bI added an extra tsp of everything & 1tsp nutmeg.  I reserved 1\4  of the chopped pecans because the cream cheese frosting wanted them on top.  I haven't had good luck with bundt's I usually thgem them cool & try to get them out..fail so, I looked up a tip that said to invert it right out of the oven so I did that on a cookie sheet & as the tip suggested I wrapped a clean hot damp towel all over the bundt as it's upside down waited the suggested 10 minutes and there it was as flawless as it gets :). I always make those closest in my life a home made from scratch no good acceptable cake for their Birthdays & I made this for my Daughter In Law & it's now my favorite :) Great recipe for Carrot Cake especially for people who don't like raisins.

country:

text:
I made this cake since I liked the proportions of the recipe. I did change the flour for whole wheat white flour and reduced the sugar to 1 cup of brown sugar and 1/2 white sugar, but I always reduce the sugar in most recipes.  
Made it in a smaller round 6 inch cake pan and made 6 muffin size cakes with the rest of the batter (adding 1/2 cup of raisins and 1/2 cup shredded coconut just to the muffins). This allowed me to make/cut  the cake into 4 layers with three icing interlayers and cover it too,(followed a Zoe bakes video on icing on Youtube),  sprinkling with the chopped pecans.
I cut it the day after and it was delicious, gets really good the second day since the icing fats kind of migrate into the cake layers.
I could probably reduce the sugar even more to just 1 cup when icing , since the icing will compensate for the sweetness. Altough I had never iced before and I will do it only as a treat for special occasions. (Just because of the caloric intake, is hard not to keep eating it!) 

I allready copied the recipe to make it again in the future with or without icing!

text:
4* As is, really loved it, can't go wrong.  Made it with all the additions as suggested, but that was overly spiced in my opinion.  I liked best with suggested 4 cup carrots, 3t cinnamon, 1t nutmeg and only 1/4 t allspice and put all 2c pecans in the mix, none if frosting, I like smooth frosting. Best if made and cooled overnight, but I cooled my frosting overnight and it was hard to spread.  So this time I frosted it in morning and served in evening.  Perfect. Feel no need to try the brown sugar substitution at this time.

text:
I made this recipe with the modifications listed in other reviews. 3/4 cup oil , 1/2 c applesauce, 3 tbsp cinnamon, I c white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, added 1/2 tsp nutmeg 1/2 tsp allspice and 3/4 c chopped walnuts cause that's all I had. It turned out great, moist. Next time I will decrease the sugar, 2 c is to sweet in any recipe if you ask me. I would probably add more spices. But overall, with the icing tasted like any carrot cake you buy from the store. Will defiantly make this again.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This cake tasted good, but there's too much baking powder in it, which causes it too rise too fast and then collapse.  The baking powder also creates a coarser crumb than most cake, and it can leave a bitter taste. Next time I'll leave the powder out completely and just add 1 t. baking soda. The frosting also had a "fatty" taste that coated my mouth, so I added about a teaspoon of lemon juice. That really brightened up the taste of the frosting. I would probably do the same next time but also use low-fat cream cheese.

userID:
13634306
Display Name:
kerrync

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/1639459.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I gave this recipe 4 stars instead of 5 as it is a good recipe, but simply tweaks could be made to improve it. For instance, the taste of cinnamon was too light, so I used 1 tbsp instead of 2 tsp. White sugar generally works fine, but to give the cake a richer flavour, I used 1-3/4 cup white sugar + 1 tbsp molasses (you could also sub 1 cup of white sugar with brown but I didn't have any brown sugar on hand). For those who prefer a less oily cake, the oil can be reduced to 1 cup without compromising on the moistness - my cake was still incredibly moist. In fact, it was still so moist that I had to let it cool in the pan or it would crumble  if I wasn't careful in removing it. I made my own cream cheese frosting as the frosting recipe here looked insanely sweet! I used 1/2 cup butter, 1 block cream cheese, 2/3 cup confectioner's sugar and 1 tsp vanilla essence - it was wonderful! Frosting aside, it is not an amazing carrot cake, but with some tweaking to suit your individual tastes, it can easily be.
Review:
Rating:
5
dateLastModified:

I made the cake yesterday, and it's almost completely gobbled up. My boyfriend hates cake, but he actually loved this one!

text:
I followed the recipe almost exactly as described (Used walnuts rather then pecans), I haven't made the frosting yet, the cake has a good flavor but a strange after taste, I think it might be the baking powder. When I make carrot cake again I am definitely going to find a recipe that doesn't use baking powder, or just omit it all together, because that after taste is just too strange for me. Hopefully the taste of the frosting masks it.  I used 2 round 9" pans and it flowed over, and got all over the oven, It also sank in the middle, I think it was too dense, I might cut back on the oil next time. Also do not attempt to take the cake out of the pan after only 10 min it will crumble, wait 20-30 min.  :/

text:
Just what I have been searching for!  I used to be known for my yummy scratch carrot cake.  After a move and retyping my beat up recipe cards, I knew something was missing.  Now I see what I've been missing!!  Thanks.  This cake gave me a very nice crisp edge, which makes dividing into 4 layers and over icing only the centers, perfect.  When I try this recipe again, i will try the suggested substitution of part of the white for brown sugar.  HINT - in case you have a husband who cannot tolerate nuts - I chopped the pecans, dropped the mix into half of the pans, then added pecans to the second half of the batter and dropped that into the other side.  It baked perfectly and I stacked the layers matching up the nut side. A bit tricky, but my husbands diverticulitis thanks me!!

text:
I've been making this recipe since 2004, and it has been my husband's de facto birthday cake (he insists) every year since.  Anyone lucky enough to share the cake says it's the best they've ever had. I have never changed the ingredients for the cake, only the way I bake it: in two 8" round cake pans.  I use frosting in between the layers, and additional coarsely ground pecans on the finished outer frosting (no need to make more than the recipe calls for). I've also made cupcakes, just as successfully, without changing a thing.  Tammy Elliott, you are famous in my family even though we don't know you.  This cake will never leave us!

text:
I've made this exactly per the recipe and it is very good!  However, for my personal preference I find we  prefer it with and extra tsp of vanilla and cinnamon.  Also made the sugar half brown/half white.  Once I started getting my ingredients together only to realize I had no fresh carrots but did have a can of carrots.  I took a chance, drained them well, slightly mashed them and dumped them into the mixer.  Since then I've done this a couple of times.  It is a bit moister but just as much flavor but do drain them well!

country:
None
text:
An excellent recipe. I've made it many times and only failed once (because of a defective oven, it wasn't the cake's fault). The cake is moist and dense and sweet and spicy and just what I like a carrot cake to be, and it has been rapturously received by others every time I've served it. I agree with the people who say to use half brown sugar and half white, and on one occasion I didn't have enough cinnamon and substituted mixed spice and was very pleased with the result, so that's my regular version of the recipe. The icing quantities given yield so much that it's easy to make a layer cake and ice it top, sides and middle. Roasted pumpkin seeds make a tasty decoration, too.

text:
This recipe (as written) is missing several key ingredients that are essential to obtaining the proper taste of carrot cake. Such as brown sugar, and nutmeg or ginger. It also came out very dry for me, I believe this is due to the fact that it is missing some form of fat (such as butter, yogurt or sour cream) to lock in moisture. I suppose it does the trick if you're in a tough spot or don't have many ingredients on hand.

Display Name:

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674165.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was a very good cake recipe and I would definitely make it again.  I would advise not making this cream cheese frosting recipe though.  The cake is very sweet, and I didn't even attempt to make the frosting with that amount of sugar.  I ended up making a huge batch of frosting because I made the cake double layered.  My frosting had 3 packages of cream cheese, a teaspoon of vanilla, and only about 2 cups of confectioners' sugar.  This was still very sweet, but it wasn't sickly sweet when eating it with the sugary cake.  So, unless you like extremely sweet cake AND frosting, make a less sugary frosting.

Everyone was absolutely heads over heels for this recipe. the only changes i made it that i omitted the 1/4 cup of vegetable oil because i felt that the recipe didn't need as much oil, and for the frosting i placed 3 instead of 4 cups of sugar. the recipe turned out more than perfect. Next time ill do them in a cupcake form, since they're easier to bake and eat.

text:
I made cupcakes for a wedding dessert table.(Doubled this recipe)  My first tray I baked was a total failure (filled 2/3 the way up and baked way over the top of the muffin tin) and I kinda freaked because I didn't have a back up recipe in case this one didn't work.  The next tray I just filled 1/2 way and they were fine. A little smaller then what I wanted, but by the time I added the frosting it was fine. I baked about 15-20 min testing after the 15 min mark.  Nice & moist.  I made the recipe as stated (except for the nuts).I did add 1/4 t. nutmeg to each recipe because I felt it just needed something because I left the nuts out.  All & all a good recipe - if you are making cupcakes, just maybe do a test one to see how full you need to fill them.  : )

my first carrot cake and it was a big success.  i made the recipe as is, other than omitting the pecans from the batter and using different pan sizes.  baked the batter in two 8x8 pans for approximately 40mins.  the frosting was amazing also.  cream cheese and butter... don't think you can go wrong there.  i topped the cakes with crushed pecans, making sure to sift the pecans prior to for a cleaner presentation.  i will be baking this again over the weekend, since i was only able to have a small sliver to taste and am now craving this.  the rest was polished before i could go for seconds.  i should mention that i am not a big fan of carrot cake, but this has definitely changed my mind or should i say palate.  a definite keeper for me.

text:
This recipe turned out great for me after reading reviews and making a few suggested changes. I used half brown half white sugar, added crushed pineapple, raisins, nutmeg, and pumpkin pie spice in addition to the extra cinnamon, and I substituted apple sauce for half of the oil that the recipe called for. The cake came out moist, delicious, and perfect. I would have loved the addition of walnuts or pecans but the person I was preparing it for has a nut allergy.

text:
I made this for my mother-in-law's birthday yesterday. It turned out pretty good! I made the cake the day before and then put the icing on yesterday. Depending on your oven you may want to leave it in longer. I first took it out after 45 minutes and the middle was jello! Another 10+ minutes did the trick though. I didn`t read the recipe and because I didn`t have enough walnuts, I threw in some chopped almonds.

For the icing, you can get away with just one cup of icing sugar, maybe 1 and a bit. 4 cups seems like an excessive amount! And if you find it too stiff, you can dash in some milk until you get the consistency you desire.

Other than that, this was a good cake! Was liked by everyone who had a piece. :)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
My nine year old daughter and I made this today,it was very good. We stuck with the recipe with very slight changes. We used 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup dark brown sugar.

My daughter wanted cupcakes instead so we used 2 cupcake pans making 2 dozen cupcakes. It cooked in half the time, so if you plan to make cupcakes with this recipe, remove from the oven after 20 minutes.

We also used 3 cups of icing sugar. After tasting it as we were mixing we decided it was already very sweet (my nine year old loves sugar and she found it too sweet) I would also cut the frosting mix in half since we had so much left over and each cupcake had a very healthy serving of frosting.

We will definitely make this again!

text:
I followed this recipe exactly as written. My boyfriend and I found it to be too sweet, but I think it was the frosting that was too rich. Overall, the cake tasted fine, but it wasn't outstanding. I used the smallest holes on my cheese grater for the carrots and next time I will definitely make the carrots thicker. I ended up with the same sink hole in the cake after baking it as others have mentioned. I baked it for 40 minutes and it was perfectly moist. Hope my review is helpful.

I absolutely loved this cake. I hate baking because nothing I've ever baked before has tasted good. This cake was just amazing. I must say next time I make it, I will use brown sugar and less pecans as it was a bit too nutty for my taste. You may think it's too many alterations but honestly, the way the recipe is written is excellent. I'm just trying to go a bit wild with my first delicious baking experience!

I made this for a friend's birthday. I used 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup brown sugar..and only 1/2 cup finely chopped pecans. Everyone raved about how moist it was. I couldn't imagine adding crushed pineapple like some people recommend...ick! Don't overmix and don't overbake! It will be plenty moist! I did not make the frosting recipe from here..I made my own "crusting" cream cheese frosting to get a real smooth finish.

country:
None
text:
I made this recipe into cupcakes and LOVED it! Even my husband who doesn't like carrot cake ate a ton of them and raved about it! I split the sugar into white and brown (half each), increased the cinnamon a bit, added a bit of nutmeg, used walnuts instead of pecans, used coconut oil instead of vegetable oil (healthier), and halved the baking powder and baking soda (based on other reviews). Also, when I mixed all the ingredients the batter looked incredibly thick, so i added a cup of yogurt and a few drops of milk. The result was amazing, moist carrot cake. Thank you for this recipe... will definitely make it again!

text:
I halved the portion and made 6 cupcakes and 12 mini cupcakes. My family doesn't like cakes too sweet so I only used 1/2 cup of sugar (half of the halved portion). I found the frosting too sweet even after I've decreased the icing sugar to 1 cup (half of the halved portion). Easy adjustment was to add more cream cheese. At 350F, the mini cupcakes took 10 min and the normal size cupcakes took 20 min. The end product was so delicious!

Absolutely my favorite recipe... I use this as my base reference for making carrot cake, but then change it up- alot, just to experiment. text:
I made this as my first homemade cake.  It was surprisingly easy, considering the circumstances.  I was making the cake for my husband for his birthday, carrot cake is his favorite, however, he didn't like it...  
I gave it a three b/c I did like it, but it was not the best I've ever had by a long shot.  I made the recipe exactly as directed (w/o pecans) and found the cake to be a little bland and the icing to be way too sweet.  These two problems balanced each other out, which is why I kind of liked it.  Next time I need to spruce up the cake and maybe add more cream cheese to the icing.

I followed this recipe 100%. It seemed like too much oil, but I did exactly what the recipe says, and I usually have good luck baking! I didn't overmix, properly preheated... and they FLOPPED! Seemed really oily and not enough flour or something. I coursely grated the carrots, didn't seem like they were watery or anything. text:
This is the best carrot cake I have had after I adjusted the recipe. I used the following instead: 4 eggs, 3/4 cup of oil, 1 cup brown sugar, 1 cup white sugar,2 1/2 tsps of vanilla extract, 2 cups all-purpose flour, 2 tsps baking soda, 2 tsps of baking powder, 1/2 tsp of salt, 2 1/2 tsp. of ground cinnamon,3 cups of grated carrots, 1 cup of chopped pecans, 1/4 tsp of nutmeg, 1/2 of a cup of applesauce.I gathered these from several other suggested. It is delicious. I have been making it for the last 3 years and my family keeps asking for more.

text:
I made a few alterations to this recipe: 
Cake: I made the batter into cupcakes instead of a cake. I also added 1/2 teaspoon of grouind nutmeg and 1/2 teaspoon ground ginger. the cupcakes came out a bit oily...but I'm sure if I'd read the reviews before I would have found an alternative that would not have let this happen.

Icing: I have my own recipe for cream cheese Icing that my family loves: 8 oz cream cheese, 1/2 cup butter, 1 teaspoon vanilla, 2 cups powdered sugar... :)

Enjoy!

I thought this was excellent!! Very most and tasty.  I made the recipe plus another half-recipe for a three nine-inch round tiers. I pretty much followed the recipe, but was short a little oil, so used some applesauce. Also, I did add extra cinnamon and about 1/2 tsp nutmeg.

text:
This is a wonderful recipe for Carrot Cake. It's so moisture, rich and tasty... 

I live in Germany and most people know the "American version" of Carrot Cake from coffee houses like Starbucks. So they usually never had a homemade one... 

The cake itself comes out tender and moist with a wonderful taste and smell of the pecans and cinnamon. 

The frosting is rich & creamy - the perfect addition to a special cake.

As many people before already wrote - it's great to add some crushed pineapples (but you don't have to - it's still great without them).

Definitely a 5* recipe. 
Easy, fast and tasteful.

text:
I loved this. I made some of the changes I read in the reviews here. Subbing half the oil for applesauce and adding just a bit of nutmeg. Wow, I've never seen my family tear through a cake so fast! I did this in 2 9x9 inch pans and did a tiered cake. I only baked for 32 minutes. YUM! I didn't put the pecans IN the frosting but stuck them around the outer edges as a decoration. Also, I did not have to double to frosting, this made PLENTY but mine came out a little thick an I thinned it with about 1 teaspoon of milk for the perfect spreadable consistency! WHAT A WINNER!

userID:

Display Name:
knutcracka

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5614249.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
YUMMY but only with the CHANGES that I made (according to other reviewers & my personal taste). I felt that the original recipe would be TOO sweet. I wanted genuine taste, and not bake a cake that would be too sweet and taste like store-bought.

These were the changes: 
For the cake: 3/4 cups oil, 1.5 cups brown sugar, 1 extra teaspoon of vanilla extract, 1 extra teaspoon of cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 cup applesauce & I didn't add pecans because I didn't have any.

For the frosting: 2 cups powdered sugar (too sweet, in my opinion. For the next bake, I would only add 1.5 cups - this also brings out the cheese taste which is great) & I didn't add pecans because I didn't have any.

I baked on the top rack of my oven at exactly 40 minutes (but do the toothpick test since your oven may be different from mine). I baked in a 9x13 inch pan & cooled completely. I then cut the cake in half and made a layer cake with the frosting. I put it in the fridge for about 4 hours and served. It was delicious and moist. Everyone at home and my friends loved it :)

text:
This cake is very moist and flavorful, but I found that it could have used a bit more salt. I omitted the pecans and added some crushed pineapple and a bit of nutmeg. Mine also turned out very dark, not at all like the picture, but my family loved it. If you're going to make this, I suggest adding about twice the amount of salt it calls for. Overall a delicious cake.

text:
I'm not a big fan of carrot cake, but apparently I'm the only one in my family who isn't. I made this for a birthday and followed the recipe as written using the author's option to leave out the pecans. (I didn't have any.) I used 8 inch rounds and had two full layers & a third slightly shorter layer, which I froze. I believe I would have had enough icing if my kids had stayed out of it until the end. But layers use a little more and we tend to be a bit generous with it anyway. 

 I did not find this cake to be greasy or oily and my family raved about how moist it was. Judging by the way they inhaled it, it must have been fine. It certainly smelled wonderful. I foresee more of these in my future.

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674169.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I was looking for a recipe to send a birthday cake to my son at college, and this was perfect.  I baked it in a disposable 9x13 pan, let it cool in the pan, then placed the pan into the second pan that came in the package.  I frosted it with canned cream cheese frosting (figuring the chemicals/preservatives would travel better than cream cheese), my daughter decorated it, and then covered it with the plastic cover that came with the pans.  It fit perfectly snugly in the fedex box, with some stuffing at one end, and I shipped it 2-day - still  cheaper than having a cake delivered by a bakery.  My son said it was perfect - still moist and delicious after 2 days, and of course lasted less than an hour once it arrived.  He and his friends loved that it was homemade and could basically eat it out of the pan.  Will be an annual birthday tradition for my 3 college kids!

text:
Great recipe.  Instead of nuts, I added raisins.  I am always looking for sweets for my husband to satisfy a sweet tooth without putting him in diabetic shock.  To make the cake more diabetic friendly, cut back real sugar by half and add 1 cup artificial sweetener (splenda).  I haven't found any way to reduce the confectioners sugar in frosting and keep the right flavor... but with this cake, you don't need a thick layer of icing.  It's moist and has a great flavor without drowning it with icing.   About a 1/4 inch is plenty to compliment with that rich cream cheese flavor.

This is the first carrot cake I've ever made and it turned out quite well. I used a round spring form pan (which was smaller in diameter and deeper), since I didn't have a 9x13, so I baked at 325 for 60mins, turned out great. And the frosting is fantastic! text:
I love this recipe! Every time I make this, everyone loves and compliments on how delicious the cake is. I did add modifications to the recipe. Instead of using 1 1/4 cups vegetable oil, I substituted the 1 cup of oil for 1 cup of applesauce. With sweetened applesauce, I used 1 cup of sugar rather than 2 cups of sugar. The cake came out moist & delicious without the extra oil.

This cake is very moist and has a wonderful, classic  flavor!  I used the large grater to grate amazingly sweet, flavorful carrots.  I baked it in two round cake pans for 40 minutes and stacked them once they cooled for a better presentation.  I made sure to whip the frosting until is was light and fluffy (without the nuts).  I would recommend this cake to anyone.

text:
I joined this website specifically to review this cake.. Ihave made this cake about 15 times, and each time I am told it's the best carrot cake they have ever had.  I never tried carrot cake until I made this, and I wont eat any other!  I do not use pecans, I use walnuts.. and I also do not put as much walnuts in the frosting because i find it makes it harder to frost.  Anyone who says this cake isn't good isn't making it the right way!  I use two round pans, and i bake two cakes.  I use the frosting to pile them ontop of eachother making one round cake. Comes out perfect everytime!

text:
This cake is moist and delicious and the frosting is to die for the perfect cream cheese frosting. I followed all the advice of reviewer "gneebeanie" and added a little more cinnamon and around 3/4 c. of raisins, as my hubby loves thim in his carrot cake. Also added an 8 oz can of pineapple tidbits that I chopped in the chopper for about 3-4 pulses. Also, added the nuts (walnuts  not pecans) to the cake and left the icing nice and smooth. This cake is dense without being too sweet and just plain delicious. Did have a little problem getting out of the pan so make sure to grease and flour very well, so just left it in the pan to cool and frost. Will definitely make again!!

text:
It was the first time I ever made a carrot cake, and the recipe was clear and very easy to follow.   The taste was awesome, but the cake was way too oily (compared to all the other carrot cakes I've had, home made by friends or bought in pastry shops). I don't know if it has anything to do with the fact I used the metric conversion supplied on the page. It did seem like a lot of oil at the time when I was making the cake, but I still went ahead.   And once the cake was baked, if you pressed on it gently, you could literally see oil seeping out. Too bad, cause the taste was lovely! I'll definitely do it again, but with about 1/3 less oil.

text:
This recipe is a decent tasting recipe, but it is not at all good for you!  4 cups of confectioner's sugar is WAY TOO MUCH! Not necessary.  If you want a sweet satisfying icing without the sugar spike, diabetes, tooth decay etc.... try using the same amount of cream cheese, butter and vanilla and add only one cup of powdered (I used a coffee grinder to powder mine) xilitol or birch sugar.  Available at health food stores like Vitamin Shoppe.   I added one cup xilitol and one cup Organic cane sugar to the cake.  You can use rapadura instead as well.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
WONDERFUL. I followed the cake recipe exactly - I had zero problems with the amount of baking soda/powder called for.  I did make two 9-inch round cakes instead of a 9x13 because I wanted to serve as a layer cake.   For the frosting I only used 3.5 cups of confectioners' sugar - just add half a cup at a time once you've added 2 cups so that you get the flavor your family loves. We love sweet frosting with a hint of cream cheese, not super tangy or overly sweet either.  You may find that you need to add a couple tablespoons of milk to reach a good spreading consistency (I did).  Cannot stress what rave reviews this received!  Plates were (literally) licked clean :)

Oh my gosh that is heavenly carrot cake... I haven't even frosted yet! I used 1 cup veggie oil and 1/4 cup unsweetened applesauce and left the pecans out and otherwise followed the recipe precisely. It is moist and has a wonderful mild flavor. My first time making homemade carrot cake, and I'm in love. :)

text:
I LOVE this carrot cake but since I don't like my cake too sweet, I down the white sugar to 3/4 of a cup and use 1/2 of brown sugar and 1/4 white sugar instead of all white.  On the frosting, I only use 1 cup of confectioner's sugar instead of 4, and I still find it a tab sweet, so next time I probably only use 3/4 cup instead of 1. And cut the butter to about 1/3 or even 1/4.    Since I have an electric oven, I don't think it needs 30-40 mins, probably 25 should be plenty.  Will def make it again soon!!

text:
This recipe was incredible! It was the perfect texture and sweetness. The only little changes I made were: I used 1/2 cup brown sugar and 1/2 cup white sugar instead. Also, I used 1/2 tsp baking soda and 1 and 1/2 tsp baking powder because I dislike the taste of baking soda in my cakes (it still raised nicely). Instead of using 1/2 cup oil, I used 1/4 cup oil and 1/4 cup sour cream. Lastly, I made these into cupcakes so I obviously adjusted the baking time. Honestly, my family and I all thought they were just perfect.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674149.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Absolute favorite carrot cake recipe. Like many others I adjust the recipe by using half white/half brown sugar (mellows the sweetness a tad), replaced 1/2 cup oil with applesauce (reduces the fat), and added nutmeg (balances the cinnamon-carrot flavor nicely). And I prefer a smooth frosting, so I leave the pecans out (they still come through in the cake itself, where I use finely diced pecans). But even without these changes the recipe stands as a delicious, moist, classic carrot cake (hence the 5-star rating). Make it a day ahead, because it only gets better with age.

Display Name:
JOANNH13

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/214810.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this as sugar-free muffins and also as written.  The sugar-free version was pretty good.  I substituted Splenda for sugar in baking the cake recipe and in the frosting.  Add 1/2 extra tsp baking soda and 1-2 tablespoons honey to the cake batter to compensate for the Splenda.  Was pleased with how it came out for a sugar-free recipe.  For muffins I baked about 20 minutes and that did the trick.  The regular (with sugar / as written) recipe I think was just average.  It was a good cake, but as others have written VERY VERY VERY bland.   I doubled the cinnamon called for and added nutmeg and the cake had very little flavor.  I was very disappointed in the lack of taste compared to the version I'm used to (my mom's recipe).   The icing is great.  I think it's just your basic cream cheese frosting recipe.  It really helps "doll up" the cake (which is so bland I couldn't really eat it without a lot of icing).   Also the amount of oil called for is WAAAAAAAY too much for this cake.  It was very moist - almost too much so.   I put it in a cake plate with a paper towel under it and within minutes the paper towel was soaked in oil.
Review:
Rating:
4

text:
I made this yesterday using the recommendations of 3/4 cup canola oil, 1/2 cup applesauce, extra teaspoon of vanilla and cinnamon, added 1 teaspoon of nutmeg, and only used 3.5 cups of powdered sugar. The cake is incredibly moist and delicious. The frosting was a little on the sweet side, I will probably only use 3 cups of powdered sugar next time.   LOVED IT!!!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this for a family which have various members disliking chocolate, banana, mango, durian, raisins, pineapples and such, resulting in extremely limited cake choices during birthdays.  Followed the recipe except for a few changes due to lack of ingredients: used all brown sugar (no white at home), omitted cinnamon and used almonds instead of pecans (can't find them in the store), and used self-raising flour instead of plain flour, baking soda, baking powder and salt (cos that's what's left at home)  Halved the recipe and made an 8-inch round cake plus 2 cupcakes for trying. The cupcakes turned out perfect, but I overbaked the main cake so that was a little dry - no fault to the recipe, it was the chef... Everyone raved about the frosting. This recipe is definitely a keeper for my troublesome family!

text:
I tried this recipe 2 weeks ago, with the frosting and without. Without the frosting the cake is just OK, but the frosting really makes it WOW! (I thought the 4 cups of sugar to be too much, and only used half the amount)  Frosting aside, I still found the cake too oily, and not spicy enough for me. It also lacked a strong carrot taste.  Despite all else my husband, coworkers and everyone else loved it.  Will definitely make it again, with apple sauce as suggested and more cinnamon and nutmeg.

text:
Delicious! I've made this twice, the first time, I used someone's suggestion to used applesauce instead of half of the oil, it turned out just a little flat, wasn't sure why, but still good. The second time, I only needed a small cake, so I halved the recipe (used all ingredients as written), and used a small round springform pan. It turned out wonderful!  I used the original amount of frosting though, and put a layer of frosting in the middle of the cake as well... I also mixed in walnuts and raisins into the frosting, YUM!

text:
We tried this recipe in a dutch oven and baked it outside on our patio! This was an experiment for us, and now we plan to use it when we go camping. Not only was it delicious and a success, I must add that it rose nicely in the pan, almost double. It smelled absolutely wonderful while it was cooking outside, (our neighbors informed us)  I have no doubts that when we go camping, the whole campground will be able to smell it baking... Instead of the traditional frosting, we were content to sprinkle it with powdered sugar (to be more compatible for  when we are camping).  Also, this recipe was easy enough that my 11 year old son put it together. He did add a bit of fresh ground nutmeg to it, and a handful of golden raisins. Dutch Oven approved by a mother of 6.  Thanks!

Used some of the other suggestions:  - 1 C brown, 1 C white sugar - 14oz can of crushed pineapple (drained) - 1 extra tsp cinnamon - applesauce instead of oil - 1 C coconut - 1 C raisins - frosting - 3.5 C icing sugar - grated carrots with cheese grater  Fantastic cake! I got tons of compliments on it. Will definitely make again.

text:
This is  a wonderful cake, moist and simple to make.  I have a friend that donates carrots to us for our dog, ( dog eats carrots as a daily treat).  It was her birthday and I decided to thank her from our dog and make her a carrot cake! Since I did not have a carrot cake pan, I got a template off the inter-net of a carrot and just traced around the carrot and dyed the frosting green for the top and  orange for the  bottom.  Everyone got a chuckle out of this and were really impressed with flavor and moistness of this cake. I would highly recommend this recipe to anyone!

text:
This cake was a hit. I made it for a co-worker's birthday and everyone at work loved it. It was my first time ever making a carrot cake so I was a bit nervous but all of the reviews convinced me. I used 3/4 cup vegetable oil and 1/2 cup applesauce; 1/4 tsp nutmeg; 3 tsp vanilla; 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar. I left out the pecans and put them on the side as an option for those who wanted them. I also used Cream Cheese Frosting II. The cake was incredibley moist and sooo good. I will definitely be making this cake again. Thanks!!!

text:
Very moist and delicious!  I omitted the nuts, because these were for my daughter's friends and some have nut allergies.  I also cut the oil down to 3/4 cup.  I didn't add anything to make up for it.  And, I used 3/4 cup natural cane sugar and 3/4 brown sugar instead of the 2 cups white.  I used 1 Tablespoon vanilla instead of 2 teaspoons.  I made 2 dozen cupcakes instead of a full size cake.  The cakes were plenty sweet and moist even after I reduced the oil and sugar.  I made the icing (save the pecans) according to recipe, and it was very sweet, so I used it sparingly and the cupcakes came out just wonderfully!

Awesome!! This was my first try at carrot cake and it turned out fabulous.  My family loved it, even the non-carrot cake eaters. I will definitely make this again.  Thanks for the recipe!!!

text:
Awesome cake!!!  If I could give it 10 stars I would....Made a few changes though.  I substituted 3/4 cup of oil with applesauce, changed to 3 tablespoons of cinnamon, added 1 teaspoon of nutmeg and 1/2 teaspoon of ginger, substituted 1/2 of the white sugar with brown sugar and added raisins. For the cream cheese frosting I only added 2 1/2 cups of the sugar and added 2 tablespoons of heavy cream.  While the cake was cooling I had the frosting cooling in the freezer.  It gave it the perfect consistancy for spreading.  This will definately be my one and only Carrot Cake I will ever do...Thank you for sharing!!!

text:
This was the best carrot cake ive ever had! After reading a few pages of reviews i did change the recipe to 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar and added 2 more tsps of cinnamon. The first time i used this recipe the cake tasted of nothing but oil. so the second i made it i used 3/4 cup oil and 3/4 cup milk. it came out more moist and flavorful than the first time. i also used the recipe cream cheese frosting II from this website. Would recommend this recipe for sure!

A very flavorful cake that my family enjoyed so much it was gone in only a few hours. I changed a few things to fit my taste which turned into a great success. I used a mixture of white flour and unbleached wheat flour, used 3/4 C. brown sugar and 3/4 C. white sugar, and added 1/2 C milk. I took the suggestion of using 3 tsp. cinnamon from one of the other reviews and lastly I used pine nuts instead of pecans.

Amazing recipe.  I was looking for a recipe for carrot cake that was moist and tasty without using pineapples as we don't like the fruit.  I hit the jackpot with this recipe!  I have now baked this cake for both my husband and my baby's birthdays.   For my 1 year old's birthday, I baked this as a 2 layer round cake and garnished with sweetened shredded coconut and silver balls.  So pretty and yummy!  We didn't have a scrap left!  (picture attached)  I prefer it spicier so I add 1/4 tsp cloves and substitute brown sugar for the white to add depth to the flavour.  This is now my go-to cake for entertaining.

SOOOO good!!! I chose this because it didn't have pineapple, and was not disappointed! It was moist  and delicious, even though I sadly didn't have any pecans on hand. This is my absolute favorite carrot cake recipe! I've probably made it half a dozen times with only tiny alterations, instead of pecans I use walnuts and probably more like 1 1/2 cups, and when I put the batter into the cake pan (just before it goes into the oven) I sprinkle some extra cinnamon and sugar onto it, just for a little extra something. The icing for this recipe is to die for! I always have a little left over, which is fine by me! I've also used the icing on sugar cookies!

text:
I liked this recipe, I pretty much followed it exactly but I left out the pecans from the icing and baked the cake in a heart shaped pan.  I had to bake the cake for about an hour, the cake browned much too quickly, about 25 mins into baking though the batter was still not wobbly and not cooked, so I turned down the oven to 175C and covered the cake with foil.  It's a nice cake, but I might try adding orange zest to it, it was missing something. The frosting is a bit too rich and sweet, so next time around, I'll reduce both the butter and sugar.

city:

region:
None
country:
None
text:
very good recipe! very well received.  I did use some review suggestions, I added a small can of very well drained crushed pineapple, used half white/half brown sugar and substituted 1/2 cup of oil with applesause. also cooked in two 9in. rounds for a round layer cake.  also, I was short on time, so i took a bag of matchstick carrots and chopped across twice or so instead of grating 3 cups.  it turned out perfectly.  also, the icing came out great and was easy to make, but it didn't taste remarkably different from the canned icing so I think you could interchange if in a rush.
Review:

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Wonderfully moist and scrumptious! Thank you for sharing this terrific recipe!! I love that my 3 yr old got a good serving of carrots and nuts with it without even knowing. Like a lot of readers, I did do 1 c brown sugar and 1 c white sugar, 1/4 c unsweetened applesauce and 3/4 c oil. If you're looking to reduce sugar in your diet, don't be afraid to cut the sugar. I mean, it's delicious with 2 cups of sugar, but it's sweet enough that it won't be bland with less than 2c. Finally, I probably put 4 cups of grated carrot. My cake did sag a little in the middle after coming out of the oven, but I put that down to a baking error on my part (not sure what), not this excellent recipe!

This carrot cake recipe is absolutely fantastic. I followed it exactly, no substitutions, and it turned out perfect. Made it for work and it was a huge hit. I try as much as possible to make a recipe as directed and then make changes the next time. I might try some suggestions by other reviewers like do half white sugar and half brown sugar; add nutmeg; replace some of the oil with applesauce. Anyway, this recipe is great as is ... a must for those who love carrot cakes.

This review is for the cake only. I think that my baking powder might be stale. My cake didn't raise that high. It turned out a little flat. Cake was very simple to make, the reason I gave this 4 instead of 5 stars was because of the changes I made as everyone suggested 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup of applesauce. 1 cup of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar. I baked this in 2 9" rounds. I found that I almost didnt have enough icing when using it in the layered cake. The cake was very moist and delicious. Not too sweet just the right balance. I had it baking for about 30 mins. It came out perfect. Thanks so much Tammy for submitting!

region:

country:
None
text:
This cake is absolutely delicious!!! After reading some of the other reviews I made the following changes: 1) 1 cup white sugar and 1 cup brown sugar, 2) 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 3) 3 tsp cinnamon, 4) 2/3 cp canola oil and 1/2 cp natural applesauce, 5) 12-15oz drained crushed pnieapple. I made the icing as the original recipe called for! I also omitted the nuts from the recipe, due to some allergies in the family. The cake was amazing and I received high praise from the family! I will make this again!!!

text:
The carrot cake turned out quite well.  I made some modifications such as: reducing the oil to 3/4 cup and adding 1/4 cup yogurt.  The cake was really moist.  I also used 1 cup of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar, which is just enough sweetness.  I would add 1/4 tsp nutmeg for a spicier & more improved flavor because I found that even though I added 3 tsp of vanilla extract and 3 tsp of ground cinnamon, it still seemed like something was missing.  I omitted the nuts too.  I'd make this cake again.  Btw, this recipe was enough to make 2 small bundt cakes.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674151.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
The first time I made this, a year ago, I followed the recipe to a T, but the icing turned out extremely clumpy and gross. I still gave the recipe 5* since the cake is so good.

This second time, I followed the recipe, with the addition of 1/4 t of nutmeg. I baked it on 2 9" pans for 31 minutes at 350, rotating the pans half way through.

Again though the icing turned out crappy and clumpy. But I wasn't going to take it lying down, so I threw it out and looked up how to make cream cheese icing on youtube. The trick is you have to mix the butter and cream cheese and vanilla into a beautiful froth before you add any sugar. I put all but the sugar in the large stand mixer bowl, and after it was gorgeous I used a strainer and added the sugar a half cup at a time. It was amazing.

Now the frosting procedures are a new issue. I greased the pans, so the cake was really domed and I debated using a serrated knife to flatten it. But since the top is the best part I kept it, and it looks fine. My frosting job was good, but not gorgeous, and next time I'll def add more in the middle.

Delicious rating coming after Jade's graduation
Review:
Rating:

text:
I had some problems with this cake, but I'm almost positive it was my own fault. My cakes sunk while they were in the oven, woops! I leveled them out and froze them, then I tried to torte them (I lost a layer because I din 't let the cake thaw long enough!). The edges were very hard and crispy, which also made it hard to torte. 3 layers survived and I made a double batch of the icing to frost and fill the entire cake. I let it chill, then took it to my Wilton class and decorated it with icing from a piping bag (little carrots). I took it to a family gathering for Thanksgiving and it was very well received. Perhaps if I had not felt so rushed and paid better attention, it wouldn't have given me so much trouble. Oh, and I give it 4 stars because I didn't care for the nuts in the cake, and I left them out of the icing.

I wish we could give stars by half steps instead of whole ones. I give this recipe 4.5 stars. I did add about a cup of crushed pineapple to help make it more moist (I cut the oil back to 1 C and will cut to about 3/4 C next time) and I substituted wheat flour for half of the all-purpose. This one will stay in my permanent file.

text:
5 star with changes. Used another reviewers tips: 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar. 3 teaspoons of vanilla, 1 8oz. can of crushed pineapple drained, 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg, 3 tsp of cinnamon, 3/4 cup canola oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. I also added walnuts instead of pecans, and I added 1 cup of shredded coconut. I shredded carrots small, and they did not sink at all. I reduced powdered sugar to 3 cups and it came out perfect.

text:
Oh.  My.  Goodness.  Deserves a solid 5 star rating!  I added additional vanilla as suggested, but I disagree with all the comments to add pineapple.  The flavor was perfect without that additional tang, which would change it to a whole different cake in my opinion.  For those who don't like the pecans, try omitting them from the frosting.  The pecans add a depth to the cake and then NOT having them in the frosting makes a delightful contrast in texture.  Wonderful recipe -- thanks!!

text:
This was a great recipe I made it almost exactly as what the recipe calls for and it came out very moist and yummy. It's very sweet and the only thing I changed was I used 3 cups of confectioner's sugar instead of 4. I still had a lot of icing left over. I think it would taste even better with raisins in it and if I was to cut back on the pecan's. I would use 1/2 cup of pecans in the cake mix plus 1/2 a cup of raisins and no pecans in the icing. This was a great recipe, make it and find out for yourself.

text:
Yummy!  I made this a heart-healthy recipe using 4 egg whites, same amount applesauce rather than oil, splenda brown sugar blend (1 cup instead of 2 cups), nonfat cream cheese (two), and only 1/2 stick of light margarine.  Also cut the powdered sugar to 1.5 cups.  Substituted raisins for pecans.  Baked in 8 inch rounds for 30 minutes.  So moist and tasty, you would never know it is almost fat free and sugar free!  One of the best recipes!!!

text:
Tammy Elliot you are awesome! THANKS!! If rebellious me can do it, it will be a piece of cake for you the reader. I hate following recipe, I did this time and it worked ... theN I alter it a bit and it worked too! I have just finished baking my fourth carrot cake since Saturday, August 29. I can't keep them  because people can't stop eating them.  I made a few alterations. I used only 100ml of sugar, less than one cup of canola oil, used one teaspoon of freshly grated nutmeg in addition to cinnamon, I added half cup of raisins, half cup dried cranberries and I used one cup of walnuts.  I will suggest that you whip the oil and sugar very well first, then gradually add eggs and vanilla, whip very well again. Then gently mix wet and dry ingredients (by hand or by spatula). DO NOT OVERMIX. My cakes came out of the oven perfect after 50 minutes (I preheated the oven for 30 minutes, cranked the oven to 400F for the first 10 minutes of preheat and then 350F). I encourage everyone to try this healthy carrot cake recipe soon ...

A neighbor gave us a bag of fresh picked carrots and we had no idea what to do with so many. I wanted the recipe that used the most amount of carrots. Needless to say, we came across this recipe and the carrots are now gone! We made this cake about 4 times. A neighbor even requested this as a birthday cake, wich they loved! I did change the sugar for one cup of brown sugar and one cup of white sugar, i added an extra teaspoon of vanilla extract, and omitted the pecans because i didn't have any in hand. This recipe is a keeper!

text:
I am a lover of carrot cake and I have never tried to bake one before.  However, tonight I made my second cake using this recipe.  Makes me feel like a pro!  The recipe is excellent.  I shared the first cake I made with my staff and they were extremely impressed.  Moist, colourful and tasty!  Incidentally, tonight I was short of carrot and used 2 cups instead of three.  While the result was good, with 3 cups the cake was much more moist and tastier I think.  Someone suggested that I should try brown sugar instead of white sugar.  Not sure about that ... I love the recipe as it is!  Thanks for sharing.  By the way, I am a male, 40+ years old and not a great cook or baker.  This recipe makes it seem so easy!

text:
I took it work and one of my coworkers called me evil... the other one said "you know.. I could have eaten that whole cake!" I did what some of the other people did: 3 teaspoons of cinnamon, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 c canola, 3/4 c unsweetened applesauce, and I added raisins because I love them. I cheated and bought already shredded matchstick carrots and just cut most of them in 1/2.  I subbed neufatel cheese and low fat butter for the full fat versions in the icing.  My husband's coming home tonight from being out of town so I left 1/2 of it at home for him.  I hope I can control myself when I get home!

Absolutely amazing, however  1) using 1 cup brown sugar and 1 cup white sugar 2) adding an extra teaspoon of vanilla extract 3) Added 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg 5) added 1 extra teaspoon of cinnamon 6) used 3/4 cup canola oil and 1/2 cup applesauce. I followed another reviewer's suggestion of grating the carrots with the large grater side (the one you use for cheese) so that you don't end up with a bunch of carrot mush and juice that can't be used.

text:
I LOVE carrot cake.  I have never made cake from scratch so I decided to venture out and make a carrot cake.  This recipe is to DIE for!!  Very rich and delicious!  The only addition that I made was to add 1 c. of golden raisins.  The icing is great.  After the cake had cooled, I split the 9 x 13 cake in half, and frosted the tops of both and put together to make a 2 layer carrot cake.  I will definitely be using this as my carrot cake recipe.  Thanks for sharing!

text:
AMAZING!!  I made a few modifications.  I added 1/4 teaspoon of nutmeg, an extra teaspoon of cinnamon, an extra teaspoon of vanilla extract to the cake, and used walnuts instead of pecans.  For the frosting, I reduced the powdered sugar by 1 cup so I used only 3 cups and I omitted the pecans.  I made these modifications based on other reviews.  This was perfect, amazing, and immediately eaten by all.

text:
I used the advice of others for this recipe plus my own - here is what I used 1) 3 eggs + 2 egg whites 2) 3/4 c. coconut oil + 3/4 c. applesauce 3) 1 cup of white & brown sugar 4) 3 tsp vanilla 5) 2 c. whole wheat flour.  For the icing I reduced the icing sugar to 2 cups and whipped all the ingredients until it was light and fluffy.  Simply deeelish!!!  Will definitely make this one again!

This recipe was perfect as is...made it for my brother's birthday this morning, comes out nicely moist, but not overly so, with good flavour and texture!  Awesome!!!  I do have to admit that I used whole wheat flour and egg substitute because I happened to have those ingredients, and didn't want to have to buy new...but again, the results were excellent.  I don't think there is any need to modify the recipe, unless you desire a decrease in fat or calories.

text:
This is by far the best carrot cake I have ever tasted! And it's the first one I've ever made. I did use the suggestions of 1c sugar/ 1c brown sugar and used 1-1/2 tsp cinnamon and 1/2tsp nutmeg and 1/2tsp allspice.  I also used walnuts(because that is what I had on hand).  I was also pretty heavy handed with the nuts and the raisins.   I just dusted the top with powdered sugar instead of frosting. This cake is so moist and delicious. I can't wait to make it again!

I made this for Easter and my husband said it was the best carrot cake he'd tasted. Thanks for a great recipe.  A keeper.

text:
I think I have a new all time favorite dessert!  I didn't even know I liked Carrot Cake, but I thought it would be appropriate for Easter, so I made one.  The only problem was I completely messed up the recipe.  I was following the suggestions of other reviewers, I did 1 cup white sugar, 1 cup of brown, 3/4 cup oil, 1/2 cup applesauce, and extra teaspon of cinnamon, and a teaspoon of nutmeg, and used walnuts instead of pecans--so this portion of my recipe was right, but somehow the main recipe had been adjusted to a half batch, so the rest of my cake was only half the ingredients--half the flour, half the carrots, half the egg, half the baking powder/soda/salt, etc...  I realized it when I went to make the frosting and fretted all day on what the result of this cake I was serving for Easter was going to be.  Surprisingly, it was an amazing mistake!  It was the best carrot cake I have ever had, very moist, very sweet, and very delicious!   I also slightly altered the frosting.  3.5 cups of powdered sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar.  It was EXCELLENT!  Everyone that ate it LOVED the whole thing.  So, if you like a sweet cake, give my mistake a try.  You won't be disappointed.

text:
Rave review from my family.  I did a few minor changes.  Used 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce and 3/4 cup of oil.  It was somewhat difficult cooking - took longer than expected and the middle did sink in, but that's nothing that frosting won't cover.  After reading some reviews, I do believe I overmixed the batter.  Oh, for the icing, I made lemon cream cheese that turned out perfectly and added a nice hint of flavor.  I used 1 1/2 packages of cream cheese (softened), 1 1/2 sticks butter (softened), 2 tablespoons of fresh lemon juice, dash of lemon extract, and 3 3/4 cups of confectioners sugar.  My husband and family loved it.  Again, rave reviews from people who normally don't even like Carrot Cake.  This will be a new Easter Dessert favorite, I can assure you.  My two year old kept repeating, "More Carrot Cake".

text:
Yum! I didn't make any major changes, just used half brown & half white sugar and reduced the sugar in the frosting to about 2.5 cups. I made them into mini cupcakes and piped the frosting (first time and looked great! I will never put frost another way!) and reduced the cooking time to about 28 minutes to compensate. The cake itself was fairly moist, but I think it lacked a bit of flavor-maybe I'll use applesauce in place of some of the oil next time and up the spice (maybe a bit of nutmeg?).  However, the frosting was DELICIOUS! Also, two culinary school graduates tried them and raved, so I upped the rating from a 4 to a 5. Will definitely make again!

Made this for easter...just today! Turned out AWESOME! I did sub about 1/2 cup flax seed oil, 1/2 cup applesauce and 1/4 cup canola oil for the 1 1/4 cup veg oil. It is moist and very good! I did have to up the cook time about 10 - 15 minutes. OH I also cooked in 2 9" round pans so I had a layer cake. The icing for this is kinda sweet, but very good. It made PLENTY to use for filling and to ice the entire cake. Overall and AWESOME recipe. Well worth a try!

great recipe, i didnt even read the reviews, just thought i would try it and all i can say is WOW, my girlfriend almost bit my hand off when i tried to take her plate away from her ha ha.. only by the fact i didnt have enough brown sugar i used 1 1/2 cups white sugar and substituted 1/2 cup light brown sugar and it was just amazing. i also used 5 eggs instead of 4 because the eggs in japan tend to be a little smaller more along the medium size. i will never buy carrot cake in a box again!

text:
I don't like cake.  I don't like carrot cake.  HOWEVER...this one is to die for.  You have to make the icing from scratch as well - don't cheat and buy a can!  It takes 2 minutes to whip up the icing.  I like this cake because the cake itself is moist and not too terribly sweet (which is why I don't like most cakes...they're just too sweet).  I used half oil and half natural applesauce instead of all that oil, and it turned out just fine.  Everyone went back for seconds.  Thank you so much for this wonderful recipe!!!

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Made this now several times to exact portions and with some mods. First time I over mixed but second time forward perfect and made several times since! Some tips: I use my juicer to shred the carrots but retain all the juice and mix both with all the other wet ingredients before adding in the dry. It's finer but I can't be asked to shred by hand. What results is a superb moist cake to which you can add raisins, walnuts or other candied citrus peel (tried orange). Additional cinnamon or nutmeg to taste. Also tried soaking the raisins in some brandy or grand marnier. Provides a nice counterpoint to the carrot and/or nuts.

text:
Fantastic! When my boyfriend saw the recipe, he said, "what possessed person number 1,472 to decide to write a review? didn't they think there were enough?" Well, i'm going to add as well. It's just that good! Also used part applesauce and part canola oil and replaced most of white sugar with brown sugar (ran out of white!).   For the frosting I only used about 2 3/4 cup powdered sugar. Had a great cream cheese flavor.   My cake also cooked REALLY fast. Done in about 30 minutes in a 13 x 9 pan. It's not the oven - used it a lot. So watch the cake!

This is by far the best carrot cake ever.  I make it for all my kids' birthdats.  I do add extra vanilla, nutmeg, cinnamon and do the oil and applesauce as previously stated.  I also add raisins and only one fourth of the amount of sugar and i use brown sugar.(my husband's not big on sweets but the raisins make up for it; use a mix of golden and regular grapes for color).  walnuts are yummy in it too.You must try it!!!!

region:
None
country:
None
text:
This was my first attempt at a carrot cake and it was so delicious!  The cake was fluffy and moist.  I did shred about a 1/2 cup too many carrots and added it anyway, and did add a bit more vanilla and cinnamon (I don't know if it made a significant difference).  The icing was yummy, too!  My only problem was that the cake didn't set well in the middle, so I wasn't able to take it out of the glass pan as it stuck even though I greased and floured it plenty (maybe if I'd used metal?). I had to bake it for about 10 extra minutes since it was still wobbly in the center.  I didn't take it out of the pan and just cooled and frosted it in there.  I will definitely make it again!

userID:
1038215
Display Name:
BAKININBUDAPEST
isPro:

photo:
https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/5674138.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
Being the party pooper here and giving it only 4 stars.  After reading the breathless reviews of how great this cake was going to be, thought I would make it for my husband's 35th b-day yesterday.  It was a great cake, but not the best, the most delicious, the most penultimate ever, the take-me-to-the-moon cake I was expecting after reading the reviews.  That carrot cake would have been made by the "Carrot Cake Man" in West Philadelphia, a type of cake I've been searching for years. In the end, hubby and guests liked it.  I was less than impressed as I like a denser carrot cake and expected to swoon with delicious delight.  No swooning.  Mine looked just exactly like the picture here, but I didn't add nuts.  Grated the carrots not only the smallest grate and not one that we would use for cheese, but the medium side. That worked out well as there was virtually no carrot juice and yet there was still texture.  Good cake and one that will certainly get the baker compliments,  but I won't be making this particular recipe again.  Back on the quest for the perfect carrot cake on allrecipes site!
Review:
Rating:
5

text:
Just- amazing. It's so light, fluffy and MOIST. It's the perfect carrot cake! Just one odd thing happened to me: I didn't peel my carrots and I had green flecks in my carrot cake. Honest (I have witnesses.) The carrots were just bought and gorgeous with beautifully bright, clean, peels, so I just scrubbed them and grated them unpeeled. I think the peel portion oxidized or something. So peel your carrots! As for the icing, it was delicious, but it was very sweet, even when I cut down on the sugar, and then the icing was runnier than I think it should have been. I am going to look for a cheesier recipe with less sugar. Nobody complained, though- my hubby and company were moaning with pleasure as they ate!

text:
It is dense, but completely fool-proof. I DON'T know how to bake and it turned out perfect. Read plenty of reviews and made these changes: half white half brown sugar, 1 cup oil, 2 cups carrots and 1 cup of sweetened coconut. For the frosting, I used 2 cups of confectioner sugar. Since I didn't have a 9x13 pan, I used half the batter for an 8x8 pan and the other half to fill a 6-muffins pan. I put BOTH pans in the oven at 350 for 35 minutes. Did not collapse in the middle. I am very much impress with myself :)

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This cake is so good!  I followed the recipe pretty closely but did heed a few suggestions.  I used 1 cup brown sugar + 1 cup white sugar; used 1 tbs. cinnamon; and 3/4 cup oil + 1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce.  I also added about 1/3 cup crushed pineapple (squeezed of most juice).  My husband's coworkers said it was one of the most moist cakes they've ever had.  Oh, and I also divided the batter between (3) 9" round cake pans and reduced the time in the oven slightly.  I did this because my husband's family likes a greater icing to cake ratio.  This is my go-to recipe for carrot cake!

text:
this cake is really good- of course, i did follow a few suggestions! ;-) definitely sub out 1/2 cup of the oil with unsweetened applesauce- i'll actually increase that to 3/4 cup next time. it really is so moist that you'll have no idea the fat's been reduced. also, i did sub out half the white sugar with light brown, added 1/2 tsp nutmeg and a pinch of ground cloves. truly delicious- but, fyi- very sweet. i added some tang (grated lemon peel) to the frosting to mellow out the sugar just a touch. Oh! and i baked the cake as THREE 8.5 inch layers. make this for a birthday or special gathering with no second guessing!

text:
I made this recipe for my mom's birthday because carrot cake is the only cake she likes.  Not only did she LOVE it, but my 2 nieces, 2 nephews, and both of my sisters-in-law loved it!  It was so moist.  It was much better than the last one I did.  My suggestion would be to use only 2 to 2 1/2 cups of powdered sugar for the frosting.  Any more than that and I think the frosting would be too sweet and take away from the cream cheese.  Great recipe!!

First time I've made carrot cake from scratch.  This was awesome.  Used 1/2 cup brn sugar, 1/4 cup white sugar, 1/4 cup splenda.  Used 8 oz applesauce and 1/4 cup oil. city:

None
country:
None
text:
This carrot cake was one of the best I've had, however I can't give it a full 5 stars. The cake was extremely moist, almost too moist. I had a hard time telling it was done baking because the toothpick I inserted in the center to test with, wasn't exactly dry and clean but it wasn't gummy either. It didn't come out dry and clean because the cake is so wet. I actually had to cut a little chunk out of the middle to see that it actually was fully baked. I will definately replace my old carrot cake recipe with this one, just perhaps I'll cut down on the oil a bit. I also replaced the pecans in this recipe with walnuts because walnuts were cheaper. Also I had never had carrot cake with pecans before, only walnuts.

city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
This is the simplest and most delicious recipe ever! But I've made some variations: I use corn oil instead of vegetable, 3 tsps of cinammon instead of 2, and I've also added an ESSENTIAL ingredient: 1.5 teaspoon of NUTMEG!! (IT'S A MUST and makes a world of difference!). For the frosting, I soften the cream cheese and then add 2 cups of the the powdered, and then add the third cup little by little till I get JUST THE RIGHT AMOUNT OF SWEETNESS BUT THE CREAM CHEESE STILL BEING THE DOMINANT FLAVOR. Trust me, the cake tastes much better when the frosting is less sweet; people that don't like carrot cake have tried this recipe and loved it!!!

text:
I usually bake the triple-layer carrot cake recipe that's on epicurious.com, but I needed something quick and easy to bring to a funeral, and this really fit the bill. I like my cake with a little more spice to it and usually add crushed pineapple, but people ate this up. It was the first dessert to go, and people loved it. I like it that it's in a 9x13" pan, so it's easily transported. I'd make this again for another potluck type event.

None
text:
My boyfriend and I really loved this cake. I made it because he had been pestering me to, and he thought it was rather daring of me to attempt one from scratch. I think he might have been worried that it was not going to turn out very well, but I followed the recipe to a T and it was perfect. The frosting however came out a little to cream-cheesy for me, so I did at another teaspoon and a half of vanilla (very good real vanilla)  more confectioners sugar, and a few teaspoons of cream. I am glad I did because the consistency was still a little thick and i was almost short on frosting the cake. I would highly recommend this recipe to anyone, and it is very easy to prepare. It baked up beautifully and was perfect in texture.

text:
WOW...wow wow wow. This is so yummy. I even messed it up and it was yummy. I thought I had carrots, and in fact only had about 10 of already shredded carrots. Tried it anyways and it was AWESOME. I used some of the hints/tips of other reviewers- 1 cup white, 1 cup brown sugar, 3/4 cup canola oil, 1/2 cup applesauce, and less sugar in the frosting and a teaspoon more of vanilla and cinnamon. I ate a quarter of the cake myself. I'll definitely be making this again...and soon!

text:
This cake was just okay.  I didn't think it was outstanding at all and was surprised at so many rave reviews.  I made some of the changes suggested by other reviewers... applesauce in place of half the oil; brown sugar in place of half the white sugar, crushed pineapple, cinnamon, etc.  I still found it to be very average.  It is a VERY dense cake and maybe that was part of what I didn't care for.  I was looking for something a bit lighter.  I took it to work for a birthday and it did get rave reviews and it was gone really quickly, so maybe it was just my taste.

Very strange. I did give it the two stars because although very sweet it does have a good flavor. The inside ov the cake was moist once you got past the crunchy part. I made this for my dad's birthday, and it was a HUGE HIT!  I'd never made carrot cake before, but decided to try other people's modifications with a few of my own: 1) 1 c brown sugar & 1 c white, 2) added extra tsp of vanilla, 3) added 1 c raisins, 4) added 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 5) added 1 extra tsp cinnamon, 6) used 3/4 c applesauce and 1/2 c oil, 7) subst. 1c chopped walnuts.  Fabulous & a new family favorite!

AWESOME!!!!  Made it the first time for Easter and made it again the next weekend for my family, mom, neighbor and co-workers!!
I do recommend cutting the powder sugar way down though, I am cutting to 1 cup this time (used 2 cups before and it was still very sweet).  The only other major change I made was substituting 1/2 cup of the veg. oil for 2 jars of carrot baby food, makes it just a bit healthier and doesn't loose any flavor or moisture.
This is definitely a recipe I will use again and again and again......

Absolutely THE best carrot cake recipe I have come across so far.  The cake was so moist and not too dense. text:
I followed this recipe strictly and used exact measurements... and the batter was delicious! However, I was unsure as to cooking time as it stated to bake for 40-50 minutes. At 40 minutes, the cake was not done and at 50 minutes, the cake had burned a bit at the bottom. I used a nonstick pan and greased it, however the cake still stuck (perhaps because it had overcooked).. Also I think I should have used less than 2 tsp baking soda; the cake had bubbles at the top.. Nonetheless, it was still edible and tasty!!! I used another icing recipe I found on the web site... Cream Cheese Icing II.. and it was fantastic.. used only 2 cups confectioner's sugar, 2 8 oz portions of cream cheese, 1/2 cup unsalted butter, and 1 tsp vanilla essence!! perfect, hope it's a hit at the DISH PARTY!

text:
Wonderful! I made this AS IS and it was great! I made it in 2 9 inch round pans and I did omit the nuts. It failed to rise much in the oven and was sunken down looking in the middle but it was still cooked through and the taste was still wonderful. I will surely make this again. I used the recipe as is for the frosting also, although I didn't measure out the confectioners sugar, I just eyed it and taste tested it!!! I served this up after Easter dinner and it was a hit! Next time I might try it with other suggestions using brown sugar, nutmeg, etc. just to see which way I prefer. But this is worth making!!!

text:
I have made this twice, and it is phenomenal!  First time I made as posted and it was great.  Yesterday I changed it up to make it a little healthier.  I used half brown, half white sugar and used two small jars of carrot baby food plus a half cup oil instead of the 1 1/4 cups of oil called for. It was delish and very moist.  Frosting I used cuts the sugar down: I stick butter, 8 oz. cream cheese, 1 tap. vanilla and only 2 cups of powdered sugar.  People couldn't stop eating it.

text:
This was my first time making the recipe, so I followed it exactly.  However, I would follow the applesauce substitutions that others have mentioned - it's got a gob of oil.  Less powdered sugar in the icing would also work- it just seems like a TON of sugar.  Also, take the cake out right at the 40 minute mark.  I made the cake last night and when I went to ice it this morning, it seemed a little dry.  I cooked it for 45 minutes and may have slightly overdone it.

https://images.media-allrecipes.com/userphotos/50x50/658179.jpg
city:
None
region:
None
country:
None
text:
I made this cake for my mother's birthday.  It was my first homemade carrot cake.  It was much lighter than other carrot cakes I've tried - not heavy at all.  I thought the cake was good, but I wish I had made it a day ahead.  Spice cakes always taste better the next day, in my opinion.  It could have been a bit more moist, but that may have been a result of substituting applesauce for half of the oil.  I've made this substitution with other cake recipes without any problem, though.  I may try a little crushed pineapple (drained) next time to add a little moistness.  The best part of the cake was the delicious cream cheese icing.  It was the perfect consistency - cream without being too thin.  I'll make this cake again, and I think I've found my "go to" recipe for cream cheese frosting!

text:
I followed the adjustments by other reviewers; added apple sauce, nutmeg, brown sugar, extra vanilla and instead of crushed pineapple, I added raisins that were cooked in orange juice and drained.  I baked it in the late afternoon, served it at night at a party.  Although the frosting was delicious, it didn't wow me or my friends that time.  It was too fluffy and didn't have much flavor.  I was very disappointed and took back the left over which was a lot.  Next night, other friends came over and we tried it again and somehow it was better.  Moist and settled, I guess. So I will give 4 stars instead of 3.  Still I think I wanted it to have more taste of carrot.  I wonder if I should have "packed" the carrot and maybe used organic.

text:
This cake was wonderful. I took the advice of other reviewers and made a few changes: I used 2 9'inch cake pans, 3/4 cup oil and 1/2 cup of applesause, 1 cup of white sugar and 1 cup of brown sugar, 3 t vanilla extract, 3 t of cinnamon, 1/4 t nutmeg, and 1 8oz. can of crushed pineapple (don't use the juice).  In addition to these changes, for the frosting, I only used 3 cups of sugar intead of 4.  You will not be dissappointed in this cake.  My co-worker says it's the best carrot cake that she has ever tasted. It was very moist and beautiful.

text:
Excellent recipe for Carrot Cake!  I made this for a co-worker's birthday, and everyone said it was the best they'd had!  I did notice that many reviewers made adjustments and substitutions, but I decided to follow the recipe without making any changes.  The only thing I might recommend changing is the amount of confectioners sugar in the icing.  4 cups made for a very sweet cream cheese frosting.  Half of that amount of sugar would probably be plenty.  I also saved a lot of time by buying a 1 pound bag of baby carrots.  I just tossed them through the shredder of my food processor, perfect!  No peeling, no hand grating.  Try this recipe, its wonderful!

text:
So moist---absolutely the best carrot cake I've ever had---and I wasn't the only one who felt this way.  Everybody who had a slice was blown away.

I followed the recipe,
with these changes I read in other reviews:
1.Substituted 2 cups white sugar for 1 cup brown sugar/1 cup white sugar.
2.The 1 1/4 cups oil changed to 1/2 cup applesauce & 3/4 cup oil.

Also used the larger side of grater to grate carrots.  And put it into 2 8-inch cake pans, shortening baking time by about 10 min., approx.

This cake is just too good. Will be making this one again---and throwing out all the old carrot cake recipes.

text:
I actually had to make this twice, but I'm glad that I did. The first time, I followed the original recipe exactly, and it turned out a complete mess. The middle sank in, and the cake stuck to the bottom of the pan. In my second attempt, I followed suggestions from other reviews - using 1/2 brown sugar, 1/2 applesauce(instead of oil) and adding extra flavoring (cinnamon/nutmeg). I also lined the bottom of my pan with wax paper, just to be sure. The 2nd cake turned out perfectly. I iced with Cream Cheese Icing II and it was a big hit at my Mom's birthday.

region:
None
country:
None
text:
I thought the cake part was great, but the frosting was seriously lacking to me and my family. My cake also dipped, but I didn't care about that so much as the outer part overcooking. I've never had such trouble with a cake before. That said, when it was all said and done, the cake tasted great. I didn't use a cheese grater, I just ended up using the peeler. I used paper towels to soak up extra juice so I didn't end up with a 'mushy' cake. Mine didn't taste like baking soda at all, or fish! It was really good.

Now, the frosting, awful! I used other posters ideas on using less sugar, and it was still bad. 

Next time I will split the cake into two pans, and either find another frosting recipe, or just break down and use store bought. Thanks for the recipe.

text:
A very moist, not too dense carrot cake!  I added more carrots, decreased oil to 1 cup and used a single serve size of Motts Peach Mango Applesauce (it's all I had, I just couldn't use that much oil!) decreased the sugar to 1 3/4 cups and ommitted the nuts.  The cream cheese frosting is excellent.  I also used less powdered sugar, about 3 1/2 cups.  I will be making again!

text:
Amazing!!!  I added 1 tsp. of nutmeg, increased cinnamin to 3tsp. and reduced the white sugar by 3/4 C. and adding 3/4 C. of brown sugar.  I also used 3 tsp. of vanilla in the frosting and reduced the powdered sugar to 3 C.   I believe that even without changes this cake would have been fine.  I made one cake just to keep around in case company dropped by but my family like it so much I had to make another the next week for my brother's birthday party.  I made 2 9" round cakes.  So so so good.  Will make over and over.

text:
Terrific carrot cake!! The only changes I made were to substitute 3/4 cup of the oil for apple sauce and then have only 1/2 cup oil and increase the cinnamon. This makes for less fat and a lighter cake. I didn't remove the cake from the pan and used less frosting.Like others, I left the nuts out of the frosting. I like to refrigerate the cake so the frosting stays thick. Will use this recipe every time!

Yummm.

This was recipe reflects old fashion taste and quality. I made the cake for my family and for our german babysitters to try.. they raved about the flavor, it was a new experience for them.I can not wait to have an opportunity to make this cake for a social function.
